Job_description: About UsRapt is an award-winning design and strategy studio that helps leading brands navigate the complex challenges of this ever-changing world. With locations in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and New York — and with clients spanning the globe — we bring fresh thinking and a highly customized approach to each and every partnership. Our interdisciplinary teams blend architecture, interior design, brand experience, graphic design, and strategic thinking into holistic solutions that further our clients’ missions. Our agile approach earned us the distinction of being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies.We’re embracing the future of work with a hybrid approach. We spend 3 days in the studio each week as a team, and we also have days where we work from home. Ultimately, we trust our staff to know how and where they will do their best work.Rapt Studio is looking for a Studio Coordinator who can help us facilitate a thoughtful and meaningful environment for the team, available at least on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursdays for Studio Days. We are looking for someone who can anticipate needs and critically think with confidence and approachability.About YouYou are an inquisitive, personable and curious people-person with the ability to help facilitate daily studio operations. You’re a critical thinker who can see the overarching picture while paying close attention to the details. You have an affinity for hospitality and take pride in being thoughtful. You get excited thinking about streamlining new processes while also implementing them.You are a team player, who loves to collaborate. Communication comes naturally to you, while working both above and below your experience level, and you are always able to see the opportunity and value in any challenge. Your attitude and focus is at the backbone of everything you do.About UsRapt is an award-winning design and strategy studio that helps leading brands navigate the complex challenges of this ever-changing world. With locations in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and New York — and with clients spanning the globe — we bring fresh thinking and a highly customized approach to each and every partnership. Our interdisciplinary teams blend architecture, interior design, brand experience, graphic design, and strategic thinking into holistic solutions that further our clients’ missions. Our agile approach earned us the distinction of being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies. Job Responsibilities:You will manage day-to-day operations of the San Francisco Studio, working with the Managing Director and studio leadership to ensure studio is adhering to hospitality standards, security and access policies, supply and inventory management and quality assurance, and any relevant studio communicationsYou will undertake general administrative functions to ensure a smooth and effective operation, including organizing incoming mail and packages, ordering and managing supplies and inventory, coordinating maintenance functionsYou will facilitate any requests with building management and facilities vendors and will work with staff and janitorial to ensure reception area, kitchen, library, and any adjacent areas are neat and orderlyYou will coordinate on site studio programming and events, including vendor presentations, client meetings, welcoming new employees, candidate interviews, and studio functions for staffYou will manage ad hoc projects + tasks with an acute awareness and presence and an eagerness to make things betterYou have an interest for taking big ideas and helping actualize and implement new processesYou are the type of person who comes to the table with strong ideas, who also welcomes and integrates feedback graciouslyRequired Skills:2+ years of studio/office coordinator experienceExceptional communication skills: verbal, written, and interpersonalExperience with designers, creatives, and architects is a plusFamiliarity with scheduling deliveries, maintaining budgetsExperience creating and leading partnerships with vendorsA passion for curiosityCompensation is based on relevant experience and qualifications. Base pay for this role is estimated between $25-$50/hour.Benefits and Perks:Generous options for medical, dental, vision insuranceLocation flexibility and unlimited paid time off (PTO)Tax-deferred savings through FSA, parking and transit allocations401K with employer contributionComplimentary One Medical membershipsNew hire referral bonus

Creative X is a global, integrated creative agency that drives the creative vision for our brands and how they are perceived in the world. We develop the vision for next-generation creative advertising, consumer brand content and experiences for Meta, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and our hardware products.Our vision is fearless creativity that shapes the future of connection. With some of the industry’s best talent on our team, we create beautiful work that has a purpose. And with an audience of almost five billion across some of the world’s biggest brands, we create brave ideas that demonstrate the full creative potential of our platforms, including industry leading, envy-inducing creative experiences that push the boundaries of traditional advertising.We believe in attracting and nurturing world class talent with a focus on diversity, community and career development. We have developed best-in-class collaboration models with agencies and our cross-company creative network to ensure a consistent and strong creative narrative for work that reaches an audience across the globe due to the scale of our products.We are in pursuit of a Brand Designer adept in creating forward-looking, innovative design solutions that unify the design principles of our portfolio of brands, including the Meta brand, Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp. The role necessitates proficiency in building and activating a brand design system which encompasses Meta and its Family of Apps marketing, brand, and product cross functional partners. If you possess a strong foundation in brand structure, craft, and design thought process and have a history of working on integrated projects, you could be our ideal fit. A comfort zone in various media touch points, and a knack for crafting meticulous design systems is vital. As a conceptual innovator, you should be adept at manifesting your ideas in novel and captivating ways. From ideation to deployment, you should have the vision and drive.Designer Responsibilities:Create brand systems, behaviors and design solutions with a high level of craftCollaborate with Marketing, Product Design, Research and brand design teams to work on holistic design principles that will unify parts of multiple independent design systemsWork with Program Managers to establish effective design processes, ensuring timely delivery of design deliverablesMinimum Qualifications:An effective strategic acumen for building timeless brands through brand architectureExperience working with cross-functional teams3+ years of experience in brand design (agency and/or in-house)Multidisciplinary background in brand identities/systems, coupled with experience of leveraging digital channels and emerging technologiesProficiency in graphic design, art direction, typography, photography, motion design, layouts & grids, and color strategyExperience managing external partners and influencing teams from the concept phase to executionProficiency in presenting and pitching creative concepts and ideas to senior leaders and internal/external partnersProficiency in design software such as Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and FigmaSystems thinking experience navigating complex matrices, managing stakeholders, and balancing enterprise-level considerations with attention to detailA link to an online portfolio showcasing your workPreferred Qualifications:5+ years of experience in brand design, either in an ad agency or in-house studio environmentMotion design experienceFashion or technology industry experienceExperience pursuing emerging technologiesFuture-first mindset, and experience creating in new platforms. This may include, but is not limited to: augmented, virtual or mixed reality, gaming, Web3, AI, NFTs, avatars, etcAbout Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

ABOUT KENDOKendo Holdings, Inc. is a San Francisco-based beauty brand developer and wholesaler owned by LVMH Moët Hennessy - Louis Vuitton, the world’s largest luxury group. A play on the words “can do”, Kendo has become the hub of creativity and next generation beauty product development for global Sephora channels and selective retailers outside of Sephora.Through original development, collaborations and acquisitions the Kendo stable of brands will always be creative, inspiring and innovative. A dynamic engine of speed, expertise and market-savvy, the Kendo team continues to redefine the beauty industry through great product, great storytelling, great retail and direct-to-consumer partnerships. This shows up in everything we do and in what we stand for:“Can Do” Spirit: We work together to make our wildest dreams a reality: As entrepreneurs, we embrace optimism and find creative ways to reach our goalsAdvocacy, Diversity, and Inclusion: We recognize and celebrate the full spectrum of personal identities. We create safe spaces so everyone’s voice is heard. We listen with humility and act with courage.Storytelling: We tell authentic stories like no, one else. It’s our key to inspire trust and build relationships, rallying, our people, partners, and consumers around our brands.Resilience: We embrace challenges as opportunities. Change is ever- constant, and agility is our strength.Product Excellence: We put the consumers first: We constantly raise the bar to create products of the highest quality that everyone just has to have.The salary range for this position is $90,134 - 112,668 per year based upon a San Francisco location. Offered salary is dependent upon experience and location. Kendo Total Rewards offerings also include an annual bonus and a comprehensive benefits package including: medical, dental and vision insurance, flex paid time off program, parental leave, employee discount/perks, a retirement plan with employer contributions, Summer Fridays, opportunity to work from anywhere for a month in the summer and July and December wellness/shutdown weeks for applicable positions.The Kendo house of brands currently includes: Fenty Beauty, Fenty Skin, KVD Beauty, Lip Lab, Ole Henriksen.POSITION SUMMARYA Digital Designer on the Digital Creative Team creates visually appealing and effective designs for a variety of digital platforms including brand websites, email campaigns and performance marketing. They work closely with Senior Digital Designers & Directors, Copywriters, Ecommerce, Global Creative and Brand/Marketing teams to understand project objectives and drive innovation.RESPONSIBILITIESSupports the Digital Design Director by providing creative solutions that meet business objectivesDevelop pixel-perfect, highly innovative, refined digital assets under fast-paced timelinesDrives design projects on time with the highest quality of standardsDemonstrates solid understanding of typography, photography, graphic design, digital design and motion graphics a plus; ensures all assets adhere to brand guidelinesOwns presentation of assigned projects to cross functional teams for feedback and final approvalSupports Digital Creative Team in producing final files for release, with careful consideration for proper digital file types and compressionDevelops strong partnerships with Brand Management, Marketing, Program Management and Digital (E-Commerce/Product/Performance Marketing) teamsDesign marketing emails, site assets, user experience, static and animated paid social ads and digital bannersREQUIREMENTSCollege degree; BA or BFA with a focus on Graphic Design or Communications Design preferred4-7 years of design experience in digital design focused on one or more of the following: E-Commerce web design, UX/UI, email and paid socialProficient knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite on Mac Platform (especially Photoshop, InDesign, and After Effects) and FigmaFamiliarity with Premiere Pro and Shopify, a plusStrong understanding of web UI standards, grid system, responsive design frameworksUnderstanding of digital trends and best practices for responsive web design, marketing emails and performance marketingStrong understanding of social media platforms and an interest in experimentation to meet growing trendsExceptional communication skills, both written and verbalEase and polish in presenting in a variety of settings: small/large groups, managers, formal presentationsSolid organizational skills, detail-oriented; time management skills, ability to juggle prioritiesStrong relationship-building skills; ability to work with a variety of people in various disciplinesUnderstanding of current fashion and beauty trendsAbility to work in a very fast paced environment and meet very tight deadlinesThe drive to excel and succeed; self-motivatedPassion for beauty and retail
Industries: Retail Apparel and Fashion, Retail, and Graphic Design

As the Brand marketing Manager, you will be creating and implementing a comprehensive social media strategy and crafting engaging and informative content with images, video, graphics and copy that align with our brand and marketing strategies. The ideal candidate enjoys getting involved at every level and is excited to work for a brand with deep roots and a rich story to tell.Key Responsibilities:Can identify relevant social and ecommerce industry trends for in the moment content creation opportunities.Has a good grasp of the nuances of marketing within the home and wellness categoriesLead monthly reporting + key insights and execute campaign-specific reports.Engage 1 on 1 with the consumer community to generate brand love and loyalty.Identify and cultivate impactful influencer relationships, unlocking new audiences, enhancing brand credibility, and fueling social commerce successPlan and execute monthly content strategy across multiple social media platforms, primarily Instagram, Facebook, TikTok and PinterestDevelop detailed briefs outlining campaign goals, key messages, content pillars, platforms, tone of voice, and desired visuals.Strong copywriter who knows how to generate copy that is unique to the brand voice and campaigns and optimized across all social platforms based on role of the platform (top of funnel, conversion)Test USP and build on insights to further audience engagementDevelop plans and tactics to grow TikTok, Facebook, Instagram etc. community and followersPartner with E-Com and Marketing teams to ensure all storytelling is consistent and reflective of seasonal strategies and selling prioritiesPartner with PR to drive awareness and brand buzz and create content with Influencers and Creators partnersLeverage UGC content to enhance brand storytelling and affiliationManaging and executing our content calendar across all social media pages on a daily / weekly basisIdeate and create content for social platformsAggregate data to report on social media performance for internal useExecute campaigns with efficiency in a timely mannerQualifications:3-4 years’ experience in social media management with strong growth resultsStrong experience managing and growing social media communities across multiple platforms (e.g., Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Pinterest).Deep understanding of the unique nuances of each platform and the ability to create engaging and effective content tailored to each audience.Creative eye towards elevated design, trends, style, and colorProven ability to collaborate cross-functionally, organized, and excellent communicatorSocial photography skills, Figma and Adobe a plusExperience creating engaging organic and paid social media contentStrong communication and interpersonal skills to build and maintain positive relationships with partners.Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related fieldSalary ranges are based on experience and qualifications ranging from $80,000 to $100,000

About UsWe're on a mission to make it possible for every person, team, and company to be able to tailor their software to solve any problem and take on any challenge. Computers may be our most powerful tools, but most of us can't build or modify the software we use on them every day. At Notion, we want to change this with focus, design, and craft.We've been working on this together since 2016, and have customers like Pixar, Mitsubishi, Figma, Plaid, Match Group, and thousands more on this journey with us. Today, we're growing fast and excited for new teammates to join us who are the best at what they do. We're passionate about building a company as diverse and creative as the millions of people Notion reaches worldwide.Notion is an in person company, and currently requires its employees to come to the office for two Anchor Days (Mondays & Thursdays) and requests that employees spend the majority of their week in the office (including a third day).About The RoleNotion is looking for a Digital Marketing Manager to build, own and execute on our webinar strategy. You will play a critical part in driving demand gen campaigns, growing pipeline and evangelizing our customers.Notion is fortunate to have a highly engaged and diverse community who our eager to learn more. Webinars have proven to be a successful vehicle to deepen their knowledge and experience with our platform. We are looking for a talented individual to oversee webinars from start to finish, develop processes for amplification and create promotional plan. We would love to find someone who is passionate about experimentation with different formats, promotions and using data to determine the most effective strategies for scaling.You will build digital events with a variety of audiences in mind, working on both cross-functional and single-function use cases, and collaborating with partners, customers, and even some of our influencers to bring these use cases to life!What You'll AchieveDrive the creation and execution of digital events at Notion. You will own end to end campaign ownership from brainstorming content ideas, crafting promotional materials and partnering cross-functionally to make these digital events a success and generate pipeline.Work with external customers and partners to speak at webinars.Manage multi-channel digital campaigns, working with the demand gen, regional, social and sales teams to promote and scale these events globally.Collaborate across the marketing team with product marketing, content and ABM to develop digital events that create on-brand, unique and impactful experiences.Experiment with new formats and promotional strategies.Track and report metrics to determine the effectiveness of Notion’s webinars and campaigns and iterate based on those metrics.What We’re Looking ForYou’re an excellent writer and strong communicator.You understand what successful webinars, field and digital events require.You know how to partner across teams to successfully execute.You are a creative individual who is passionate about using data to drive experimentation.You have experience working with sales teams to convert leads into the sales funnel.Bonus points if you have experience with email promotion strategies and Marketo or Goldcast.We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our global employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you’re a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.Notion is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Notion considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Notion is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.Notion is committed to providing highly competitive cash compensation, equity, and benefits. The compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors such as location, the role’s scope and complexity, and the candidate’s experience and expertise, and may vary from the range provided below. For roles based in San Francisco, the estimated base salary range for this role is $110,000- $140,000.

What We NeedWe are looking for a talented Visual Merchandising Manager to join our dynamic Creative team in San Francisco (Hybrid). In this role, you will be responsible for end-to-end design, as well as management of VM 3D + 2D development and executions at US retailers.Responsibilities:Primarily focus on and manage VM expressions at US retailers for campaigns, product launches and promos.Plan and develop planograms, mockup testers, props and store presentations via 3D + 2D renderings.Design 2D artwork: tester graphics, large artworks, in-store signs and props with all specifications outlined and completed files to be print and production ready for regional markets.Support your manager with translating marketing briefs into storytelling solutions and partner with the Retail marketing team to conceptualize and develop compelling consumer centric VM design that is plausible for production.Ability to partner with cross-functional retailer, marketing, copy and creative teams in order to create cohesive, innovative and educational storytelling designs in-store.Work directly with vendors for production, timelines, prototypes and budget.Present renderings and graphics to the Creative Director, internal team members and cross-functional teams for rounds of review and validation process.Act as project manager for all projects and manage the timeline and callout milestone dates. Ensure that the projects stay on time and within budget.Qualifications:3-5 years of experience in visual merchandising with educational background in interior design, architecture, product design or graphic design.Background in beauty preferred- prestige category is a bonus.Local San Francisco area a must- needs to come into the office 2-3x per week.Working experience with retailers and vendors is ideal.Well-versed in 3D software (Sketchup or other 3D modeling tool is a must), InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop and Microsoft Office.Ability to effectively communicate and present ideas.Work with attention to detail, knowing that you are the last to touch and release files to different markets.Project management and experience working with vendors and retailers.Ability to multitask within multiple projects and meet deadlines.Keen awareness of current trends in visual arts, design, fashion and beauty.Flexible work hours based on project needs and online meeting accommodating the time zone differences between US cities.The Details:The expected base salary range for this position is $90,000 to $105,000. The exact base salary is determined by various factors including experience, skills, education, geographic location, and budget.This position is also eligible for participation in the company discretionary bonus plan, based on personal performance and company results.In addition to base salary, Tatcha offers a competitive benefits package to eligible employees, including medical insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, life insurance, accident insurance, critical illness insurance, disability insurance, retirement savings plans and company match, paid family leave, education-related programs, and paid holidays.Tatcha is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender identity, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other classification protected by Federal, State or Local lawWe respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, experience and business need.Tatcha will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.
Industries: Personal Care Product Manufacturing and Retail

Job_description: We're looking for a Product Designer who is at the beginning of their career and excited by our mission of designing the future of teamwork . With millions of teams using Asana across the globe, our work has only just begun. Join us on a journey of driving clarity for teams, individuals and executives. As designers, we are streamlining how teams get work done in a more efficient, effective and delightful way. You’ll make it as simple as possible for teams big and small to realize the value of Asana.In this role, you’ll be the customer's voice as you collaborate with Engineering, Product, Experience Research, Data Science, and business partners to build compelling products. You will solve problems with cross-functional partners in collaborative teams, that enable designers to do their best work. As part of a product-driven and design-led company, you'll play a key role in a team of Product Designers owning core product development from inception to iteration and post-launch reflection. If you’re looking for the opportunity to do high-quality work as you embark on your product design journey, this is it.This role is based in our San Francisco office with an office-centric hybrid schedule. Along with most Asanas, you’ll work from this office in person on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays. Most Asanas have the option to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays. If you're interviewing for this role, your Talent Acquisition Partner will share more about the in-office requirements.About The Design TeamWe design the future of teamwork. Asana has a bold, ambitious mission: help humanity thrive by enabling the world’s teams to work together effortlessly. Our design team is at the heart of that mission.Asana Design is an inclusive and collaborative community. We’re a diverse group of designers from different backgrounds (product, brand and content design, design operations, producers, motion design, film, copywriting) . We are a team that loves combining research, data insights, and peer feedback into a human-centered design process to produce designs that are core to the power of our applications. We partner with people across Asana to create our product, shape our brand, and drive greater impact through design. We use design to solve challenges and create experiences that customers love. We also take the time to get weird and have fun along the way.We believe every designer should have the opportunity to grow and learn by utilizing their strengths and nurturing their interests.Learn more about our teamAsana DesignAsana Design MediumAsana Design InstagramAsana Design TwitterAsana DribbbleAsana cultureDiversity, Inclusion, & BelongingHow we’ve designed a culture that fuels our business resultsHow I advanced my career through AsanaUPHow we use (and don’t use) job titles at AsanaWhat You’ll AchieveOwn the design from start to finish on a single project or set of focused tasks within a border initiative for Asana products and featuresCreate flows, prototypes, and high-fidelity user interfacesCollaborate with cross-functional partners to shape customer problems, build, implement and ship solutionsWork under the direction of a seasoned designer in order to execute against an established strategy and learn new methodologies for divergent thinking.Help shape a product that is intuitive and elegant, which speaks from a unified voiceAbout YouUp to 1 year of experience in product design (Either strong internship experience or 1 year of professional experience)A portfolio that showcases strong foundation in interaction and interface design workExperience designing and shipping web, desktop, and/or native mobile applicationsAn ability to express ideas via rich stories, prototypes and codeAptitude to come up with novel, simple solutionsYou embody openness, curiosity, and a growth mindsetAt Asana, we're committed to building teams that include a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, as this is critical to helping us achieve our mission. If you're interested in this role and don't meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply.What We’ll OfferOur comprehensive compensation package plays a big part in how we recognize you for the impact you have on our path to achieving our mission. We believe that compensation should be reflective of the value you create relative to the market value of your role. To ensure pay is fair and not impacted by biases, we're committed to looking at market value which is why we check ourselves and conduct a yearly pay equity audit.For this role, the estimated base salary range is between $120,000 - $146,000. The actual base salary will vary based on various factors, including market and individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process. The listed base salary above is a guideline, and the base salary for this role may be modified.In addition to base salary, your compensation package may include additional components such as equity, sales incentive pay (for most sales roles), and benefits. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.We strive to provide equitable and competitive benefits packages that support our employees worldwide and include:Mental health, wellness & fitness benefitsCareer coaching & supportInclusive family building benefitsLong-term savings or retirement plansIn-office culinary options to cater to your dietary preferencesThese are just some of the benefits we offer, and benefits may vary based on role, country, and local regulations. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.About UsAsana helps teams orchestrate their work, from small projects to strategic initiatives. Millions of teams around the world rely on Asana to achieve their most important goals, faster. Asana has been named a Top 10 Best Workplace for 5 years in a row, is Fortune's #1 Best Workplace in the Bay Area, and one of Glassdoor’s and Inc.’s Best Places to Work. After spending more than a year physically distanced, Team Asana is safely and mindfully returning to in-person collaboration, incorporating flexibility that adds hybrid elements to our office-centric culture . With 11+ offices all over the world, we are always looking for individuals who care about building technology that drives positive change in the world and a culture where everyone feels that they belong.We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also comply with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws in other locations.

Job DescriptionFabKids is looking for a Jr. Graphic Designer.We are looking for a talented Junior Graphic Designer to join our small but mighty creative team. In this role, you’ll help design and create digital marketing materials for digital/social media and other platforms. Candidates should be familiar with Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, and other graphic design applications. Knowledge of animation and After Effects is a plus. This is a junior level role that reports to senior employees. Candidates should be able develop, contribute and collaborate—you will be the lead in compelling design for ads, social needs, emails and marketing initiatives. You must be willing to roll up your sleeves, develop, plan and execute. You will need strong organizational and interpersonal skills to excel in this role. FabKids is looking for a creative teammate who is a highly motivated, do-it-yourself individual who thrives in an entrepreneurial environment.Please submit your portfolio/website to be considered for this role.You will report to the Associate Art Director and partner closely with CRM, Site and Retail.What You Will DoConceptualize, elevate, maintain and is accountable for quality of work and timeliness of delivery across multiple creative projectsWorks directly with the marketing, copywriting, merchandising, and project management team to create engaging, inspiring and on brand marketing projectsEnsures on time and accurate delivery of all short and long term initiativesTakes ownership of projects from concept through productionDemonstrates flexibility, organization skills and the ability to multi-taskHaving a positive, proactive, self-starting attitudeEnsures high standards and quality assurance across all work produced so that it is cohesive, consistent, and brand-rightLearn and leverage knowledge of our customers and company KPI’s to assure we are creating optimal assetsWhat You Can Bring1-2 years experience in graphic design with an emphasis on ecommerce/fashion.Bachelor’s Degree in Multimedia Design or Web Design or equivalent experience is preferredFamiliarity with Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator and After Effects is a plusPossess a passion for, and strength in, recognizing excellent web typography and photographyAttention to detail and good time managementCollaborate in the development of project concepts, and apply consistent design approach to a wide range of digital contentA knowledge of current graphic design and social media trendCompensation & Total RewardsAt JF, we believe work and life should fit together! We continue to build a culture of flexibility, to empower you to do your best and put yourself first. Our Total Rewards program rewards employees for their hard work, supporting their health, well-being, families, and ultimately their life journey. Total Rewards at JF includes:Hybrid Work Schedule*Discretionary Paid Time Off*Summer Fridays*Healthcare PlansEmployee Discounts401kAnnual Bonus ProgramEquity Program*And MoreVaried for retail and fulfillment rolesThe hourly range for this position is from $26.90-28.85. The range provided includes the base salary that JF expects to pay for the role. Offered base salary will be dependent on factors including the scope and complexity of the role, candidate’s related work experience, subject matter expertise and work location.JustFab LLC, ShoeDazzle, LLC, Personal Retailing Inc. (d/b/a FabKids) is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, compensate, develop, and promote regardless of race, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable. At JustFab LLC, ShoeDazzle, LLC, Personal Retailing Inc. (d/b/a FabKids), we champion a vibrant workplace culture that thrives on diversity law and do not tolerate discrimination or harassment. We are one team from many backgrounds, innovating through diversity of individuals, who are driven by passion for creating an inclusive space for all. JustFab LLC, ShoeDazzle, LLC, Personal Retailing Inc. (d/b/a FabKids) will continue to champion a workplace culture that prizes diversity and inclusivity.We encourage you to apply regardless of meeting all qualifications and/or requirements.

You will be responsible for the execution of brand creative that translates business and marketing objectives into designs that are clear, compelling, visually exciting, and easy to understand. You’ll be able to clearly communicate creative ideas to both supervisors and stakeholders, collaborate on ideation with design team and business owners, and work to deliver solutions that are timely and effective. To be successful in this position, you’ll be a self-starter, capable of delivering brilliant creative ideas, and show amazing attention to detail.Please submit your portfolio/website to be considered for this role. You will report to the Associate Art Director and partner closely with CRM, Site and Retail.What You Will DoCollaborate with the creative and marketing team members to drive and design compelling assets across all channels including but not limited to digital and emailTake ownership of projects from concept through production while collaborating with creative and marketing teams working within the creative processDemonstrate flexibility, organizational skills and the ability to multi-taskEnsure high standards and quality assurance across all work produced so that it is cohesive, consistent, and on brandLearn and leverage knowledge of our customers and company KPI’s to assure we are creating optimal assetStay on top of trends in fashion, design, and photographyEnsure visual designs adhere to project requirements, objectives, and timelines upholding brand standards across all projectsDesign and execute comps, mood/storyboarding, presentation visuals, and other creative materials as directedIdentify gaps in current assets and offer recommendations for new content ideasDevelop good working relationships with internal customers and be a communicative partner across all departmentsAssist in developing and maintaining the creative look and feel for all conceptsWhat You Can Bring2-3 years working as a designer with an emphasis on ecommerce/fashion is a plusExtensive graphic design experience and an eye for great design, design principles, photography and typographyExpert Experience of Adobe Creative Suite: Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and After Effects a plusProfessional attitude; self-managed, self-motivated, proactive, detail oriented and a team player with a keen sense of urgencyJira experience is a plusBFA/BA in Graphic DesignStrong typography, layout, hierarchy, branding skillsAble to maintain daily workload in an extremely fast-paced environment while maintaining high standards and shifting priorities as needed; remain flexible and adaptable to changing deadlines and priorities with professionalismCandidate must be a proven facilitator of information, with exceptional communication and follow up skills and a keen sense of urgencyAttention to detailMust thrive in a fast-paced environmentKnowledge of current social trends is requiredExtensive knowledge of best practices for both web and pre-press print execution is a plusOnline user interface experience, including mobile is a plusCompensation & Total RewardsAt JustFab, we believe work and life should fit together! We continue to build a culture of flexibility, to empower you to do your best and put yourself first. Our Total Rewards program rewards employees for their hard work, supporting their health, well-being, families, and ultimately their life journey. The range provided includes the base salary that JustFab expects to pay for the role. Offered base salary will be dependent on factors including the scope and complexity of the role, candidate’s related work experience, subject matter expertise and work location. About TechStyleOSTechStyleOS is the globally integrated Operations and Services provider behind some of the fastest growing online fashion brands in history, including Fabletics, Savage X Fenty, JustFab, ShoeDazzle, and FabKids. Our work is tailored to the uniqueness and diversity of each client and place, maintaining a consistent focus on design excellence, thorough project management and superior service. We believe in collaboration, continuous learning and sharing, and actively support candidates on the path to become licensed architects. Our office is friendly and spirited, with regular happy hours, field trips and design-focused presentations. We are conveniently located in SoMa within walking distance of all major transit systems.For more information about our projects and firm, please visit us on or at Instagram at @walkerwarnerarchitectsThis position is based out of the San Francisco office and open to a hybrid schedule once onboarding and orientation is complete.Primary ResponsibilitiesSupport project team in development of the design and production, organization, coordination, thoroughness, and accuracy of the virtual building model and all documents in the drawing setCommunicate and coordinate with project team members, consultants, and contractorsResearch code requirements and interface with governmental agenciesResearch materials, products and systemsWork with the project team to produce presentation materials for client and agency presentationsCoordinate and participate in project meetings; screen share and navigate BIM model and other exhibits through Zoom, record and issue meeting notesDistribute project deliverables (drawing sets, correspondence, submittals)Implement the established graphic standards of the officeAssist with other office-wide tasks that make day-to-day operations of the office possibleQualificationsAccredited degree in architectureUp to three years of related professional experience in design and production; experience can include internships, school projects, etc.Basic technical knowledge of Type V constructionDemonstrated 3D modeling/BIM proficiency (ArchiCAD preferred, but not required)Excellent verbal, written and graphic communication skillsCompensation And BenefitsWalker Warner Architects offers a competitive compensation package including fully paid health benefits for employees, profit sharing, employer 401(k) contribution, generous paid time-off and flexible spending accounts, plus so much more.The hiring base annual salary range for this position is $75,000 - $85,000. About UsRapt is an award-winning design and strategy studio that helps leading brands navigate the complex challenges of this ever-changing world. With locations in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and New York — and with clients spanning the globe — we bring fresh thinking and a highly customized approach to each and every partnership. Our interdisciplinary teams blend architecture, interior design, brand experience, graphic design, and strategic thinking into holistic solutions that further our clients’ missions. Our agile approach earned us the distinction of being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies.We’re embracing the future of work with a hybrid approach. We spend 3 days in the studio each week as a team, and we also have days where we work from home. Ultimately, we trust our staff to know how and where they will do their best work.About YouAt Rapt Studio, Designers work on multiple projects of varying types and scales from concept through construction. Designers are the backbone of the work we do. With dedication and hard work, they have the potential to grow quickly and become a big part of our creative process and output. We’re looking for someone who’s a strong conceptual thinker, visualizer, and designer.Qualifications:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture or Interior Design0-5+ years of experience working at an architecture or design studioExperience working with project teams from concept design through constructionExperience with Revit, AutoCAD, SketchUp, Adobe Creative Suite, G-Suite, FigmaEagerness to learn project management, construction administration, budget review, building codes, consultant coordination, and client relationsEagerness to learn about the development of construction documents for reviewEagerness to work with furniture vendorsExperience and interest in 3D visualization is a plusWe’re looking for:A collaborative individual who isn’t afraid to think outside the boxA team player with leadership potential and a positive attitude who’s enthusiastic about tackling the unexpected and unknownA creative person with strong graphic, organizational, and communication skillsA conceptual thinker who’s always seeking inspirationA person in active pursuit of mentorship and development, excited about what's ahead in their careerBenefits and Perks:Generous options for medical, dental, vision insuranceLocation flexibility and unlimited paid time off (PTO)Tax-deferred savings through FSA, parking and transit allocations401K with employer contributionComplimentary One Medical membershipsNew hire referral bonusCompensation is based on relevant experience and qualifications. Salary for this role is estimated between $50,000 to $80,000 plus benefits and bonuses.

Job_description: About UsWe're on a mission to make it possible for every person, team, and company to be able to tailor their software to solve any problem and take on any challenge. Computers may be our most powerful tools, but most of us can't build or modify the software we use on them every day. At Notion, we want to change this with focus, design, and craft.We've been working on this together since 2016, and have customers like Pixar, Mitsubishi, Figma, Plaid, Match Group, and thousands more on this journey with us. Today, we're growing fast and excited for new teammates to join us who are the best at what they do. We're passionate about building a company as diverse and creative as the millions of people Notion reaches worldwide.Notion is an in person company, and currently requires its employees to come to the office for two Anchor Days (Mondays & Thursdays) and requests that employees spend the majority of their week in the office (including a third day).About The RoleSocial media is how Notion connects daily with our >20 million users. Given the size of our communities on Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, and LinkedIn, this role is responsible for creating content for an audience the size of a small country.We have ambitious business goals to make Notion ubiquitous. As a steward of our public channels, you will be a key part of realizing that vision and bringing our brand to life.We're looking for an instinctive storyteller who isn’t afraid to experiment with voice and add a dash of whimsy. As a fluid communicator, you know how to make a brand sing across multiple channels, audiences, and communities.What You'll DoCollaborate. You are a self-starter and a fount of ideas, but also know that successful execution requires managing projects cross-functionally, taking in and prioritizing requests from across the organization, and communicating with all stakeholders. Grow our audience across social channels and spotlight Notion’s employees and thought leaders in creative ways.Strategize. You understand the importance of creating a content ecosystem and even if you haven’t held a formal strategic role, have strategic instincts. You will set the vision for our social platforms, then work cross-functionally to achieve those goals. Leveraging both data and intuition, you'll determine the best ways to educate our audience, deepen their engagement, celebrate their accomplishments, project our brand identity, and trumpet our news — all without falling into rote patterns.Test. You are risk tolerant and love to experiment. The faster we can figure out what works, the sooner we can reach more people in compelling ways. You'll identify social media metrics that map to our goals, determine what type of content we should invest in, and iterate as you go.Expand. You know the audience reach of our current channels, stay on top of emergent channels, and look for opportunities to expand. You'll monitor conversation taking place across our existing channels and help us branch into new ones where we can seed and grow an audience, whether that's Pinterest, Discord, Reddit, or something yet to take off.Write. You'll be reviewing Notion's most important short-form copy every day across Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok and Facebook — and writing some of it yourself. You'll be the steward of our profiles and owner of our social voice and tone, making sure both evolve as fast as we do.Design. You are a scrappy creator and producer who doesn’t make perfect the enemy of good. Notion is very visual and best learned by seeing it in action or in context of who's using it and how. You'll develop ways to express the product and brand visually by creating assets yourself, and work with our top-of-class Creative Studio to bring ideas to life.What We're Looking ForYou've scaled brand accounts before. You’ve been to this rodeo before and are now ready to run it.You've built significant communities. You've amassed a serious following for a brand (or yourself). You know what strategies and tactics work and can bring them to global scale.You’re an expert collaborator. This role interfaces with people across all teams at Notion: product, recruiting, marketing, creative, comms, and more. You know how to craft deep cross-functional relationships to move quickly and deliver top-tier work.You understand both B2B and B2C marketing. Notion’s international user base is diverse. You know how to communicate with everyone from enterprise buyers to college freshmen.You stay up with the trends. You know how fast social can move. Channels rise and fall. Memes come and go. We want our content to feel classic and current.You are allergic to cliches. Notion doesn’t pick fights on Twitter. We don't share meandering “thought leadership” posts on LinkedIn. You know when not to lean in.You are an excellent writer. Compelling communication requires exceptional writing craft. You are a strong writer and have a portfolio that demonstrates distinct brand voice.You bring design to the table. You have experience with creating visual assets — photography, video, motion graphics, illustration, fine art — and can point to numerous projects where you worked side-by-side with design and content teams to create arresting work.Important note: The above is what we suspect the right background might be — but this role is one where there’s really no such thing as “right background.” We'd love to hear from artists and creative producers with all kinds of strengths and ideas.We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our global employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you’re a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.Notion is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Notion considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Notion is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.Notion is committed to providing highly competitive cash compensation, equity, and benefits. The compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors such as location, the role’s scope and complexity, and the candidate’s experience and expertise, and may vary from the range provided below. For roles based in San Francisco, the estimated base salary range for this role is $145,000-$180,000 per year.

Job DescriptionAbout the Graphic Design RoleWe are looking for a versatile and proactive graphic designer to join our cross-brand design team as the primary creative dedicated to our growing loyalty program, The Key Rewards. This is a unique role within the company— supporting all WSI brands on a wide variety of projects, from digital, web, in-store signage, print, UI and more. This role will work closely with the cross-brand creative manager and creative director across all campaign phases—from initial concepting through to launch. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in graphic design and/or production design, an eye for detail, and a solid understanding of design systems. We value those with enthusiastic attention-to-detail, consistent and reliable delivery, a readiness to jump into new challenges, are quick to learn and adapt, and will proactively communicate and problem-solve.Essential Functions Collaborate with the digital creative team to execute polished designs from concept to launch. You are confident translating direction from the earliest ideation phases all the way through final delivery across multiple mediums  Develop and maintain a consistent visual identity and brand presence across all loyalty projects  Create digital assets including banners, landing pages, email templates, social media graphics, and other promotional materials  Produce designs that effectively communicate complex concepts and information in an aesthetically pleasing and user-friendly manner  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, site, and development, to ensure designs align with project goals and objectives  Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends, techniques, and industry best practices to continuously improve the quality and effectiveness of designs  Assist in managing and organizing design assets, ensuring they are easily accessible and maintained for future use  Participate in design reviews and provide constructive feedback to maintain and elevate design standards  Ensure designs are delivered on time and meet established deadlines  Adapt to changing priorities and handle multiple projects simultaneously, balancing quality and efficiency Criteria Bachelor’s degree in Visual, Web, Graphic Design or equivalent experience  Proven experience as a graphic designer with a focus on digital design, preferably in the retail/loyalty industry or related field. Multi-brand retail is a plus  Proficiency in design software such as Figma, and Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.)  A strong critical-thinker that is solutions-focused. Able to foresee and assess possible issues and quickly problem-solve—does not let complications slow them down  Strong portfolio showcasing a range of design work, demonstrating attention to detail, and a solid understanding of design principles  Excellent understanding of best practices and usability principles  Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment and effectively communicate design concepts and rationale  Experience in creating and maintaining branding guidelines and design systems  Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines effectively  Any additional experience with light video/animation, UI/UX design, or copywriting is a big plus  Ability to perform work onsite in the San Francisco corporate office BenefitsOnce you are here, you can look forward to a wide variety of benefits designed to help you grow, personally and professionally, to keep you healthy, to prepare you for the unexpected, to care for your family and to build a secure future. Depending on your position and your location, here is a look at what you might be eligible for: A generous discount on all Williams Sonoma Inc. brands through multiple shopping channels  A 401(k) plan and other investment opportunities  Paid vacations, holidays and other time-off programs  Health benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance; health and dependent care tax-free spending accounts; medical, family and bereavement leave; same-sex domestic partner benefits; short- and long-term disability programs; life and travel insurance; an employee assistance program  Tax-free commuter benefits  A wellness program that supports your physical, financial and emotional health  In-person and online learning opportunities through WSI University  Cross-brand and cross-function career opportunities  Location specific sample sales  A business casual work environment  San Francisco based bike share program  Time off to volunteer  Matching donations to qualifying nonprofit organizations  Company-sponsored community involvement  Various discounts on local businesses The expected starting pay range for this position is $70,000 -$80,000. Applicable pay ranges may differ across markets. Actual pay will be determined based on experience and other job-related factors permitted by law. In addition to competitive pay, compensation may include a variety of other components like benefits, paid time off, merit, and bonus opportunities.Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Williams-Sonoma, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, or other applicable state or local laws and ordinances.WSI will not now or in the future commence an immigration case or "sponsor" an individual for this position (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration.)This role is not eligible for relocation assistance.About UsOur CompanyFounded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of high-quality products for the kitchen and home in the United States. Our family of brands are Williams Sonoma, Williams Sonoma Home, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn teen, pottery barn kids, Rejuvenation, Mark & Graham, west elm, or Outward. These brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We offer beautifully-designed, stylish and functional products for every area of the home, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, home office, closet, laundry room and even outdoor spaces. We've seen some big changes since our first brick-and-mortar store opened more than half of a century ago. What hasn't changed is our passion for high-quality products, functional design, outstanding customer service, and enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities where we operate. Today, we're a multi-brand, multi-channel, global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas.
