About UsRapt is an award-winning design and strategy studio that helps leading brands navigate the complex challenges of this ever-changing world. With locations in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and New York — and with clients spanning the globe — we bring fresh thinking and a highly customized approach to each and every partnership. Our interdisciplinary teams blend architecture, interior design, brand experience, graphic design, and strategic thinking into holistic solutions that further our clients’ missions. Our agile approach earned us the distinction of being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies.We’re embracing the future of work with a hybrid approach. We spend 3 days in the studio each week as a team, and we also have days where we work from home. Ultimately, we trust our staff to know how and where they will do their best work.About The RoleAt Rapt, Senior Designers maintain a keen eye for detail while managing multiple projects, from conception to realization. They lead our designers and work closely with Studio Leads and Design Directors to ensure each project’s success. We’re currently looking for someone who’s got the confidence and creativity required to be on the frontlines of our work.Qualifications:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture or Interior Design8+ years of experience working at an architecture or design studioExpertise with Revit, AutoCAD, SketchUp, Microsoft Office, and Adobe Creative SuiteExpertise working with project teams from concept design through constructionExpertise with project management, construction administration, budget review, building codes, consultant coordination, and client relationsProficiency with jurisdictional agencies and multi-disciplinary consultantsProficiency with commercial projects, including ground-up construction, core and shell repositioning, and creative workplaceState licensure or pursuance of state licensure is encouragedWe’re looking for:A team player with a positive attitude who’s enthusiastic about tackling the unexpected and unknownA creative person with strong graphic, organizational, and communication skillsA conceptual thinker who’s always seeking inspirationA confident decision-maker and risk-takerA leader who’s interested in mentoring fellow design staffSomeone who can both design conceptually and detail thoroughly, with an ability to zoom in and out along the project timeline from the macro to the micro and back againA leader who doesn’t allow ego to push teams or projects in ways that don’t benefit everyone, and who provides guidance not for their own benefit but for the benefit of the project and teamCompensation is based on relevant experience and qualifications. We’ve created the first-ever PMS supplement, FLO Vitamins, designed to make periods and the symptoms that come with them more tolerable. Along with FLO we have products spanning many women’s health topics such as immunity, gut health, skin health, and many more to come. Our team is small-yet-mighty, with big ambitions and an entrepreneurial spirit. We are a growth-stage startup gaining serious traction (check us out in Fortune, Forbes, Bloomberg, and Business Insider ), with a strong brand presence and some amazing advisors. Overview:The Global Visual + Experiential Designer Director for Kendo will lead the creative vision for all IRL spaces across the globe and for all brands at Kendo bringing together design, merchandising, and copy to formulate a north star creative vision for how our brands are presented. This critical creative leadership role will translate strategy, campaigns and 2d assets into 3d storytelling for the consumer in a compelling way. This Director would be very experienced in concepting and drafting blue sky thinking for retail & experiential initiatives with the strong ability to marry those ideas with the consumer, our brand DNA, innovative retail concepts and the business needs to deliver best-in-class experiences that meet the business objectives. This role will be the first to identify the changing retail & consumer landscape and propose ideas on how to stay ahead. This role would support all Kendo brands and offer a wide range of projects across retail spaces, merchandising, marketing, store design, experiential marketing for the consumer, influencers, founders and retail partners.Responsibilities:InnovationLead the blue sky thinking and push the brands IRL experience to be best in classConceptualize + DesignLead the conceptualization and design of visually appealing and on-brand in-store displays, windows, animated VM spaces to maximize product visibility and consumer experience. This can be through hand sketches and renderings.Introduce innovative design concepts for experiential and retail spacesLead the translation of the 2D space to the 3D space while bringing to life brand storytelling.SourcingLead the research and selection of materials and fixtures to enhance product displays.Establish innovative relationships with vendors and oversee the procurement of fixtures.CollaborationCollaborate with brand teams to ensure strong briefs for team and vendors for product launches.Lead brainstorms with creative team to ideate and ensure fixture design aligns with overall concept design.Collaborate with retailer partners and field teams to understand best in class fixtures and understand what is working and not with Kendo fixtures.Maintain Visual StandardsProvide leadership by regularly visiting stores to ensure that visual merchandising standards are maintained and execute innovative adjustments as needed.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Visual Design, or a related field or equivalent experience.10 + years of proven experience as a Store Design, Visual Merchandising Designer or related in the beauty or retail industry.Strong understanding of beauty industry trends and consumer behavior.Proficiency in design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, SketchUp).Excellent communication, collaboration, leadership, and innovation skills.Creative thinking and ability to translate ideas into visually appealing displays.Strong project management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.Experience in vendor management and procurement processes.People leadership experience including cross functional partnerships and influencing.

Job Description:At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we know that each talent makes our collective bolder and brighter. We are guided by four core principles that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses: Music is Everything: Music is our passion, and we can never get enough. Tastes, trends, and tech will change, but great artists and songwriters will always be our driving force. Global Growth, Local Expertise: Music is a global language. Through communication and collaboration, our success can come from anywhere and translate everywhere. Innovation and Insight: Pushing the boundaries requires the best information and the boldest imagination. We use both to create the future. Empowered by People: Like the artists we serve and the music they make, our differences make us stronger. This is a place where every talent can belong and build a career.We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity. Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.Job Title: Manager, Creative Graphic DesignerA little bit about our team:Established in 2017 by Elliot Grainge, 10K Projects is one of the fastest growing completely independent record labels in the world. Its innovative multi-platinum artists and partners drive billions of streams each year with acts including Ice Spice, Trippie Redd, iann dior, Surfaces, YTB Fatt, COIN, Salem Ilese and many more. The company is dedicated to continually pursuing philanthropy efforts expressed through its 10K Together division. Based in Los Angeles, CA, 10K Projects is committed to recognize and champion the unique visions of creatives and storytellers of tomorrow.Your role:The Creative team at 10K Projects is looking for a digital graphic designer who can create social and web-specific art that brings our artists’ voices onto these platforms. We are seeking vision, creativity, and design expertise to create immersive experiences across various social platforms, web, email, and other fan-facing digital outlets. This role will work alongside the Digital Marketing team to plan and implement ongoing, campaign-driven creative elements for 10K Projects; roster of music artists.Here you’ll get to: Participate in brainstorms alongside Digital Marketing strategists, Marketing Directors, and on occasion A&R, artists, and their management teams Align with marketing strategy and translate initiatives into visual content (photos, gifs, and graphics) with the intent to engage artists fans and grow their following while supporting key business objectives Conceptualize, produce, and edit content aligning with the artist’s voice/vision that is designed and optimized with platform, target audience, and marketing goals in mind Understand best practices for social media, web, and email including the how to create successful, engaging content for each platform Create engaging content including: static designs using imagery and/or typography, gifs, illustrations, photography, paid social ads including carousels, thematic types of posts including countdown assets, lyrics, infographics, etc. Attend events and create real time content including but not limited to photography and videography to be used for social posting or Instagram stories Edit, retouch, and resize existing assets Available for off-hour (weeknights and weekend) deliverables as tied to artist releases Lead all aspects of Digital Asset Management and proper archiving of photo shoots and finished packaging deliverablesAbout you: 2-3+ years of experience producing custom social content within agency or in-house social/creative teams Strong design skills, comfortable taking an idea from concept to implementation. Strong typography, photography, and illustration/image editing skills with a keen eye for taste level and unique executions Strong visual sense and taste level with an understanding of photo and design principles for mobile, web, and social-first content. Previous experience showcasing a range of artistic themes, styles, and formats Deep understanding of the nuances of each online platform (Facebook, X, Instagram, Snapchat, YouTube, Web, email, etc) and how to adapt and optimize content per channel; this includes proper file size, specs, and copy adaptations Manage tight deadlines while maintaining commitment to excellence and impeccable attention to detail Highly organized, proactive, multifaceted, capable of working on concurrent projects and able to communicate effectively to digital team members, vendors, artists, and executives Highly skilled in Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign) Proven experience conceptualizing, driving, and delivering impactful, engaging creative assets for digital/social platformsWe’d love it if you also had: Motion graphics, animation, and/or video design skills Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design/related fields or equivalent experienceAbout us:As the home to 10K Projects, 300 Elektra, Asylum, Atlantic, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Redefining what it means to be a music company in the 21st century, our consumer brands include trend-setters like UPROXX, Songkick, HipHopDX, and EMP. We’re the home to WMX – the next generation services division that connects artists with fans and amplifies brands in creative, immersive, and engaging ways – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels. Together, we are Warner Music Group: Music With Vision & Voice.Love this job and want to apply?Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.Salary Range$66,650 - $70,000 AnnuallySalary ranges are included for job postings where required by law. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as work experience and business needs. The pay range is subject to change at any time dependent on a variety of internal and external factors.WMG is committed to inclusion and diversity in all aspects of our business. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and will evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law (genetic characteristics or cancer), physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.Copyright © 2023 Warner Music Inc.Links to relevant documents:2024 Benefits At A Glance final.pdfEVerify Participation Poster.pdfRight To Work - English.pdfRight to Work - Spanish.pdf

Design DirectorRate: 70-75/hrLocation: LAOur client, a growing name in the luxury CPG space is looking for a Design Director/Art Director. This is a temp to hire opportunity that is hybrid (Tues-Thurs) in the LA area.THE ROLE: As the Design Director, you'll play a pivotal role in crafting the visual identity of consumer promotional and retail products for prestigious global brands. Collaborating closely with our product architects and clients, you'll unleash your creative genius to deliver extraordinary solutions. Your realm of influence will extend across various creative and supply chain channels, where you'll deftly manage multiple projects and tight deadlines. The expertise you bring in physical product and production techniques will be instrumental in guiding our China and Asia-Pacific factories to breathe life into remarkable concepts.We're looking for a unique blend of a thinker and a doer: someone who’s as comfortable with brainstorming the next big idea as they are with rolling up their sleeves to design something breathtaking themselves. Though we're a small team, our aspirations are sky-high, aiming to create memorable experiences for our global clients like Tom Ford, Maker's Mark, and Jameson.The candidate must be able to design. This is not a position built to solely direct and guide. They must have great design skills and be capable of doing design work themselves.REQUIREMENTS:BA/BS in Graphic Design or a related field (or showcase 5 years of relevant experience as your key to this extraordinary role).5+ years of proven graphic design expertise, honing your skills with a focus on retail, consumer brands, and marketing campaigns.Proficient in Adobe CS (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat Pro) and SketchMust know Pantone ConnectMust know how to create 3D mockups / renderingsIDEAL BUT NOT MANDATORYExperience with sourcing products overseasExperience using Salesforce, Slack, Mailchimp, CanvaExperience with CopywritingFamiliarity with Generative AIExperience working with factories to develop a product

Location: Los Gatos, California (San Francisco Bay Area - USA)With over 260 million members in over 190 countries, Netflix is the world's leading entertainment service offering great Series, Movies, and Games that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight members around the world. Netflix is powered by a work culture that focuses on high performance and continuous improvement.About XD DiscoveryThis leadership role is on the Experience Design (XD) Discovery team. The XD Discovery team is responsible for the core member experience worldwide, creating personalized entertainment experiences that focus on connecting people with stories they’ll love. The team designs the end-to-end member experience from the moment someone joins Netflix: onboarding, searching, playing, and managing their Netflix experience. Our team’s focus is to create engaging user experiences to entertain our global members by making it easier to discover and choose content that’s right for them.About YouYou are a Product Design Manager with exceptional design, communication, and people management skills. As a leader, you will lead and manage teams to ensure our products and features are valuable for our members, easy to use, and of the highest level of craft and execution. You'll be a foundational member of the leadership team, working together with your partners in product, engineering, data science, consumer insights, content design, and other disciplines to define the strategy, operations, and communications that guide the team to build great products addressing real user needs.You measure success in terms of both human and business impact. You foster excellence through collaboration and encourage an inclusive, open environment that makes space for different perspectives and work styles. You inspire creativity and you’re an excellent advocate, evangelist, and listener who seeks and offers candid, constructive feedback.What You'll DoManage and build a diverse, inclusive team of Product Designers that consistently delivers impactful human-centered experiences that meet user needs and business goals.Coach and mentor team performance, manage resource allocation, and project prioritization, and cultivate a culture of design excellence.Keep your teams inspired and engaged by providing strategic clarity, direction, and focus while identifying and unblocking barriers to successChampion the design thinking philosophy across the org and be an advocate for user-centered design and systems thinking to drive innovation at scale.Utilize your full range of people management skills, product strategy, product design, interaction design, and visual design skillsIntroduce new user-centered methodologies, frameworks, and thought leadership to help your team facilitate strategic alignment across the organization.Contribute to strategic decisions around the future direction of Netflix's products. Establish a vision for the long term while ensuring near-term product features ladder up to a holistic user experience that delivers on the user needs and business goals.Collaborate closely with your Product, Engineering, Data Science, Consumer Insights, and leadership partners to plan OKRs and execute product roadmaps. Develop and nurture relationships with stakeholders and ensure your team is designing and shipping impactful and cohesive product experiences.Effectively communicate your team's product goals (both within the team and outside the team), and connect related projects across the company.Bring a balanced perspective and thoughtful decision-making to strategic discussions, advocating for both user-centricity and the needs of the business with your teams and your peers.Embody a growth mindset and a deep curiosity for the business, emerging technologies, and human behavior to identify product opportunities.Actively seek and provide constructive feedback and look to improve things for the product, team, and company.Qualifications8+ years of successfully managing high-performance Product Design teams.Successful track record of leading teams to successful outcomes and shipping impactful consumer products across a variety of platforms at a global scaleAbility to inspire, lead, and engage your design teams, leaning in and giving them critical business context, feedback, and direction.Ability to navigate ambiguity, and drive clarity that brings the user, technology, and business together through rigorous design thinking and human-centered design for evolving problem spacesExperience working on large-scale, complex projects across multiple teams.Experience leading product direction and strategic thinking by articulating a product vision, and goals, identifying opportunities, and making decisions based on the impact to people and the companyExperience collaborating closely with cross-functional stakeholders, helping drive alignment between design and your cross-functional partners, and building strong relationships across business areas.Exceptional communication skills, in writing and verbally, to represent work to broader product teams and leaders.Experience connecting the dots across the organization with other related initiatives across the company while driving collaboration.Pay TransparencyOur compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $270,000-$700,000.Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off.See more details about our benefits here. Netflix has a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds more substantial teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job_title: Associate Manager, Graphic Illustrator, Packaging Design
Job_description: POSITION SUMMARYDo you love to draw? Are you fast on the spot? Think in the moment? Can you visualize a design concept and quicky render it into reality? Kendo is looking for a talented rendering wizard to join the Packaging Design Team in San Francisco.The Graphic Illustrator of Packaging design is responsible for creating new product design renders for the entire scope of our Kendo brand portfolio. This position is key to demonstrate on the fly sketching/rendering/illustrations using creative vision to translate and evolve brand packaging by bringing concepts to life and tell a story through design. The Graphic Illustrator will communicate information, ideas, and instructions via visual drawings according to specifications set forth by the Product Universe Team.RESPONSIBILITIES:Produce high-level, on strategy Illustrations/renders that meet Kendo standard of creative excellence.Produce visual concepts to sell-in new product/packaging design ideas for presentations.Uses artistic judgment to select appropriate composition, design, and layout for each render/illustration.Creates accurate exploded-view drawings that can be manufactured.Performs other related duties as assigned.REQUIREMENTSGraphic designer or Illustrator with 2-4 years’ work experience including 1-2 years of experience in the beauty or fashion, packaging design experience requiredBA or BFA in Design, Arts, and/or Graphic Design or equivalent experienceAdvanced/Expert Apple computer skills in Adobe Creative Cloud Suite, with a specialty within Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesignDetail oriented designer who is comfortable with shifting design direction and working on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environmentMust possess strong interpersonal skills and creative resolution skillsSelf-starter who will participates in all aspects of the programs from concept through executionAbility to quickly generate concepts and visually communicate those ideas with renderings and/or compsAbility to take initiative and know how to design ahead proactively without always being promptedDemonstrated ability to meet tight timelines and work productively in a team environment are requiredExcellent time management skills with ability to project manage workload autonomously is a mustMust have excellent eye for color and typography.Very strong organizational skillsPassion for graphic design and beauty with a sense of both current and developing trends in print/pattern, art, and packaging

OverviewThe OpportunityThe Brand Experience (Experiential) team is responsible for delivering best-in-class activations for all brands across the PepsiCo portfolio. From major events to LTO influencer kits, from temporary retail displays to permanent stadium installations, the Brand Experience team touches every facet of the design process.The Design Associate Manager is an integral part of the growing Brand Experience team. Under the direction and guidance of the Experience Design Lead, the Senior Designer is responsible for the creative development process from conceptualization through to on-site execution, collaborating closely with cross functional partners both internally and externally. Successful candidates will be agile, curious, entrepreneurial, and most importantly passionate about pushing the boundaries of what can be achieved through design.Why PepsiCo?PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated more than $66 billion in net revenue in 2014, driven by a complementary food and beverage portfolio that includes Frito-Lay, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Quaker, and Tropicana. PepsiCo's product portfolio includes a wide range of enjoyable foods and beverages, including 22 brands that generate more than $1 billion each in estimated annual retail sales. At the heart of PepsiCo is Performance with Purpose – our goal to deliver top-tier financial performance while creating sustainable growth and shareholder value. In practice, Performance with Purpose means providing a wide range of foods and beverages from treats to healthy eats; finding innovative ways to minimize our impact on the environment and reduce our operating costs; providing a safe and inclusive workplace for our employees globally; and respecting, supporting and investing in the local communities where we operate.Why PepsiCo Design?At PepsiCo design, we have a saying: “We’re crazy enough to think we can inspire the future.” This is what drives us, in everything we imagine, develop and execute.Our goal is clear: to connect PepsiCo’s beverage, snacks and nutrition portfolios, with today’s hyper-connected, networked users and consumers hungry for meaningful, authentic and relevant brand experiences across multiple touch points and regions of the world.PepsiCo Design & Innovation is a creatively driven team that leverages the power of Design Thinking to solve brand and business problems that drive meaningful value and growth. Our mission is to elevate the role of design and design thinking as a function, process, mindset, and as culture in PepsiCo and the broader business world.We are a consumer-centric organization with a start-up mentality within our larger organization; we partner with world-class partners in Marketing, Insights, and R&D to strategically drive business results with purpose.ResponsibilitiesOwning the creative process from brief to execution with emphasis on concept visualizationLeading cross functional creative brainstorms leveraging design thinking to unlock innovative approaches to brand activationsPartnering with individual brand teams to identify and codify experiential brand language through own-able materials, finishes, colors, lighting, sounds, scents and more.Clearly communicating ideas through visualization and effective presentation to cross functional internal and external stakeholdersSourcing and engaging external agencies, fabricators, architects, and producersEffectively managing timelines and deliverables across multiple projectsCompensation & Benefits:The expected compensation range for this position is between $81,000 - $135,600 based on a full-time scheduleLocation, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salaryBonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 10% of annual salary paid out annuallyPaid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavementIn addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement PlanQualificationsStrong portfolio which demonstrates breadth of experience and impeccable taste in design7+ Years relevant experienceBA required; related field (design, industrial design, architecture) preferredSelf-described “Jack/Jill of all trades,” with a curiosity and excitement to learn new thingsHighly proficient in one or more 3D programs (SketchUp, Rhino, 3DS Max, C4D)Proficient in Adobe CS and one or more rendering programs ( Enscape, Vray, Keyshot)Knowledgeable in common production methods, materials, and technologiesKeen interest in latest trends across pop culture, fashion, art, design, music, and technologyExcellent communication, written, oral, and visualCollaborative and iterativeAbility to work in fast-paced environment while maintaining a high standard of outputMust be willing to travel up to 20% of the timeAbility to hand sketch preferred but not requiredIdeally has an existing network of vendors, fabricators, agenciesExperience with any other areas of design a plus: Motion Graphics, Photography, Video, Web design etcPrior experience with CPG brand(s) a plusAbility to develop production mechanicals for print or fabrication preferredEEO StatementAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender IdentityIf you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy.Please view our Pay Transparency Statement

Job_description: As Descript's Head of Brand Design, you will build and scale a differentiated brand identity for Descript, rooted in motion and video. One that, when people see it, makes them think things like "so helpful," "so smart," "so honest," and "such a refreshing break from the usual drivel I encounter on the internet." You have taste, and a strong point of view on work that you share willingly with empathy and positivity.In return for bringing your talents to Descript we'll keep you fed on an endless buffet of face-meltingly cool features and opportunities to flex your creative muscles.This is a leadership role reporting into the VP of Marketing, collaborating with both external partners and internal stakeholders including the CEO, leadership team and functional marketing leads.What will you do?Build our internal brand playbook and visual brand style and process from a video-native lens.Lead, grow, and inspire video and brand design teams at Descript.Own creative execution of demand generation/campaignsManage campaign development and brand strategies that include strategic collaboration with marketing functions, campaign development, testing programs and iteration, creative development, production and execution along with creative partners.Collaborate with a variety of cross-functional teams including Marketing, Product Management, Product Design, and senior leadership to develop and maintain consistent tone, identity, creative strategy across all touch points.Minimum requirements3+ years of people management and 2+ years of experience as a Brand Design leader, Creative Director, Art Director or similar roles. Strong experience with video and motion.Driven to seek and try unexpected, surprising, and unconventional brand creative and comms. Skeptical of any creative or comms that look, read, or feel like what you'd expect from a brand.Track record of building strong and effective creative organizations in a rapidly growing environment and excel at motivating and inspiring people at all levels to do their best work.Led brands that are user journey and experience focused.Player/coach who will always want to roll up their sleeves and be hands-on with the design.Experience with horizontal products for B2C/B2B.Bonus profileExperience working with Figma, Webflow, GACreated templates and other in product assetsWorked with creator-oriented tools (design, 3D, audio/video)The base salary range for this role is $155,000- $205,000. Final offer amounts will carefully consider multiple factors, including prior experience, expertise, and location, and they may vary from the amount above.About DescriptDescript is building a simple, intuitive, fully-powered editing tool for video and audio — an editing tool built for the age of AI. We are a team of 140 — with a proven CEO and the backing of some of the world's greatest investors (OpenAI, Andreessen Horowitz, Redpoint Ventures, Spark Capital).Descript is the special company that's in possession of both product market fit and the raw materials (passionate user community, great product, large market) for growth, but is still early enough that each new employee has a measurable influence on the direction of the company.Benefits include a generous healthcare package, catered lunches, and flexible vacation time. We currently have offices in San Francisco and Montreal, and are open to folks working remotely between PT and ET time zones. Whether you love WFH or can't wait to get back to being in person, we're interested in offering an environment that works for you.Descript is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We believe in actively building a team rich in diverse backgrounds, experiences, and opinions to better allow our employees, products, and community to thrive.

ResponsibilitiesAbout UsTikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.Why Join UsCreation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us.About the TeamAs the window of TikTok's business services, our TikTok UED Monetization Product team is aiming to enable and inspire clients to effortlessly connect with audiences and maximize brand potential. We want to ease and inspire clients to achieve their goals, explore more possibilities and create values with TikTok. Being part of teammember here, you will be able to utilize qualitative/quantitative studies to collect user feedback, create a deep understanding and empathy for our customers, and work cross-functionally with design, product, and marketing teams to meet the business needs.In this role you will:• Lead the development of top-notch quality websites and visual outputs for promotions across TikTok's various monetization products.• Drawing from profound insights into intricate business products, provide systematic design solutions that elevate the user experience to the next level.• Create and test rough prototypes early in the design process to create confidence in a solution• Design high quality visuals for enhanced user experience.• Contribute your design thinking skills to other areas of the platform (Research, Marketing, product education, customer success, etc.)• Promote high-quality design and systematic design thinking through evangelization.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications:• Experienced with designing and shipping end to end web-based products with complicated flows, multiple scenarios and edge cases• Demonstrate the capacity to institute quality design in technical challenges and adeptly facilitate intricate collaborations with confidence• Ability to organize and communicate your thoughts and motivations with different audience• Experience with the following tools: Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, After EffectsPreferred Qualifications:• Self-motivated and able to efficiently run a project without close supervision• Degrees in Art, Graphic Design, UX Design, Human Interface Design.• Ability to navigate through technical challenges and complex collaboration• A keen eye for visual UI details• Ability to think at a high level about product strategy and visionTikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at tt.accommodations@tiktok.comJob Information:【For Pay Transparency】Compensation Description (annually)The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $137244 - $318960 annually.​Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.​Our company benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support our employees to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees: ​We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care. ​Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off (PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability. ​We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.​

About The RoleA person’s financial life is intimately connected to their dreams — from the home where they’ll live to the travels they’ll take to the future they picture for themselves. As a pioneer in automated investing and money management, Wealthfront offers tools and services to make more of those dreams possible for a broader range of people than ever before. The Creative Team at Wealthfront is searching for a Designer to help us find innovative, engaging ways to bring our brand promise to life with conceptual flair and impeccable execution.You’ll be responsible for creating a wide range of awesome things: producing assets to support a tentpole brand campaign and ongoing marketing experiments, dreaming up unexpected (and unexpectedly fun) ways to illustrate complicated financial concepts and delivering the kinds of creative ideas that no one would ever expect from a financial institution.Our Designer will be a hands-on builder, well-versed in Figma and the Adobe Suite, who nit-picks pixels and never settles until the typography is perfect.About YouYou believe in our missionYou know that money can be both intimidating and empowering, and you feel invested in Wealthfront’s vision of how well-managed finances can reduce worry and enable our clients to live their lives more fully. You are motivated to make a meaningful impact, to improve the financial system, and to do your part to define a brand working to do just that.You sweat the small stuffYou recognize that the line between ok and exceptional can be very very thin, and you work ceaselessly to stay on the correct side of it. You make considered decisions in your work, can defend your creative choices, and are ready to revise your opinions in the face of compelling arguments because you care — deeply — about making the work the best it can be. You have high expectations for yourself and the people around you.You expect your work to serve the teamYou know that your way isn’t always the right way, and you’re eager to find a way to contribute, even when it might be outside your typical skill set. You understand there’s always more you can learn, and you look forward to opportunities to add to your creative arsenal.You are resourceful and enterprisingYou think like an owner, are solutions-oriented and adapt quickly to the constraints and challenges of a fast-paced, rapidly growing business with a small team.You create memorable, engaging things that might-or-might-not look like marketing.You have experience finding the moments that bring a brand to life. You’re happy designing matchbooks, Instagram ads, emails, billboards and everything both in between and beyond. Whether big or small, you look for ways to intersect consumers’ lives to communicate a brand truth in a way that feels relevant, authentic, and memorable, regardless of channel or medium.Preferred ExperienceA few years of experience as a designer in an agency, production studio, or in-house creative teamDemonstrated expertise in Figma and the Adobe Creative SuiteExperience working across media channels, including digital, print and non-traditional mediaSome combination of motion graphics, illustration, photography/videography, and/or video editing skills a plusEstimated annual salary range: $105,000 - $120,000 USD plus equity and discretionary bonus.Benefits include medical, vision, dental, 401K plan, generous time off, parental leave, wellness reimbursements, professional development, employee investing discount, and moreAbout WealthfrontWealthfront started with the ambition to transform the investment advisory business, with the goal to unlock access to high quality investment advice for millions who were underserved by the traditional institutions. We built one of the first automated investment products that allows you to invest in a personalized portfolio of thousands of companies in seconds for a remarkably low fee. We then expanded. We now work with partner banks to offer exceptional banking features through a Wealthfront Brokerage Cash Account, which makes it remarkably easy for people to automate their finances end-to-end and eliminated the hassle of money management, all of which resulted in attracting more than $50 billion of our client’s hard earned money, pioneering the robo-advisor category and transforming the broader industry. And yet, we have a long way to go to achieve our mission to build a financial system that favors people, not institutions.Wealthfront’s vision is to make it delightfully easy to build long-term wealth on your own terms. This vision is more relevant than ever because millions more people are getting into the market early and investing their hard earned savings in a handful of stocks. While this is a great way to start, it is inconsistent with building long-term wealth. We want to empower young investors to expand their horizon, and easily explore and execute on a wider range of investing strategies, make informed investment decisions that are consistent with their values and beliefs while also making it effortless to grow and compound their savings exponentially in a way that’s transformational to their lives and their long-term future.For more information please visit www.wealthfront.com .We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Please review our candidate privacy notice .

Job Title: UX Design InternLocation: This position is based in our Campbell, California offices, on-site & full-time. Imperative Care does not provide relocation or additional housing compensation for the summer internship.Why Telos Health?At Telos Health we are developing novel robotic-assisted technologies and interventional capabilities that will forever change the disparate outcomes of ischemic stroke – a disease that impacts close to a million people a year in the U.S., and 10 million worldwide. Not only is Telos changing the way stroke is treated, but also bringing this treatment to the greater population who is currently without. We are actively building a team who is focused on developing novel solutions for this complex disease – a disease in which one in four adults will face in their lifetime.What You’ll Do:We are looking for a talented UX Design Intern to be an integral part of the Telos R&D team. Are you interested in developing innovative, robotic-assisted technology to transform the way ischemic stroke is treated? You will utilize user-centered design practices to contribute to the UI design of our novel robotic-assisted system for stroke treatment. We are looking for someone who is eager to work at the intersection of digital and physical. To deliver on our mission you will craft solutions that take user experience, ergonomics, function, aesthetics, quality and safety into account.Apply user centered design techniques to develop compelling UX design from concept ideation to visual mock-upsDesign and deliver user flows, wireframes, use scenarios, user journeys, mockups, and prototypesDevelop interaction concepts that take hardware and UI touchpoints into account, translating complex problems into simple and elegant solutionsParticipate in primary and secondary user research to understand the context of your work, use it as the foundation and rational for UX concepts, and to continuously improve upon designWork collaboratively with other designers, the engineering team and other stakeholder to come develop easy to use, safe andContribute to design documentation and communicationWhat You’ll Bring: ExperienceCurrently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in UX Design, Interaction Design or equivalentDesign portfolio that demonstrates a user-centered-design processCompetent in the use of design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.Strong communication, storytelling and presentation skillsWhat You’ll GainTelos provides an opportunity for students to work in the dynamic medical device industry and gain valuable hands-on experience with state-of-the-art equipment, instruments, and facilities. Our internship program is designed to give interns foundational experience and exposure to a variety of roles and areas of focus to help prepare them for a career in MedTech. This program also offers ongoing networking, learning and professional development opportunities, mentorship from executive leadership, social activities and peer-to-peer interaction.Join Us!Salary: $27/hourly for 10 week internshipPowered by JazzHRDRPCvDyLKl

At Meta, we’re shaping innovative experiences in service of giving people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Our multidisciplinary design teams are creating new ways to help people connect, find communities and grow businesses. Together, we are committed to building innovative technologies — Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Workplace, Meta Quest and more — to serve billions of people around the globe. Product Designers at Meta play a central role in the way we build products, ensuring our products and features are valuable for people, easy to use and of the highest level of craft and execution. By focusing on people and doing the simple things first, we develop quality experiences for some of the world’s biggest, most challenging problems.Product Designers help creatively solve big, complicated, real-world problems. We utilize a full range of product design skills to contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the product and executive teams. Join a diverse group of thinkers and do some of the most meaningful work of your career.This posting represents different full-time roles across the Meta company.Product Designer Responsibilities:Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something useful and valuable for our 2 billion plus users and drive product strategy and innovation across a large organizationDesign leading-edge concepts through the craft of end-to-end flows which impact broad sets of users at scale while using the appropriate prototyping toolsDesign new experiences or layouts that evolve visual systemsPlay an active role in communicating strategic decisions around the future direction of Facebook productsGive and solicit feedback from a broader product team in order to continually raise our bar for quality, while also taking on mentorship and coaching opportunitiesLead a partnership with Product Managers, engineers, researchers and content strategists to oversee the user experience of a product from conception until launchMinimum Qualifications:8+ years of experience building and shipping applications or software at company-level scale level, leading the end-to-end experience within a large-scale, ambiguous domain.8+ years of interaction design experience with knowledge defining and evangelizing how an experience should behave based on understanding people's needs, plus consideration of how this innovation will scale and examples of the use of appropriate prototyping tools to demonstrate how a particular interaction will work.8+ years of visual design experience with proficiency in typography, desktop/mobile UI, color, layout, iconography and aesthetic sense and how these elements impact product function.8+ years of strategic product thinking with the experience developing product goals, identifying opportunities in a global market, and making decisions based on the impact to people and the company.Experience representing work to senior executives, clearly and succinctly articulating the goals and concepts.Preferred Qualifications:Experience showcasing your end-to-end design process across multiple projects, that include interaction and visual design artifacts, multiple iterations, high-fidelity prototypes, and consideration of the impact and scale of workExperience connecting your work with other industry-leading related initiatives across the company while driving collaborationExamples of leadership in non-product dimensions that have made a team stronger and positively impacted the work environmentAbout Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

We are looking for a Graphic Design Associate to join our Creative Services team and play an important role in supporting the creative/marketing department with their day-to-day operations on a wide range of projects, including digital initiatives and printed collateral that maintain the continuity and integrity of the LA Clippers brand and its various entities including the future home of the organization opening in the Summer of 2024, Intuit Dome.Working in a hand-on environment, this role requires a strong ability to learn quickly and collaborate with others while also being able to work independently and efficiently under tight turnarounds to deliver strong, brand-aligned assets for use in marketing, social media, digital content production, in-arena and events, apparel and merchandise, and promotions.The ideal candidate will possess a keen eye for design and strong production skills. They should be a self starter, hardworking, highly organized, have outstanding time-management skills and an ability to prioritize projects and deliver assets on-time. Previous sports and entertainment experience is not required, but working understanding of the sports industry, NBA and basketball are a plus. Applications without portfolio of recent work will not be considered.This is a part-time role based out of our DTLA office and is not eligible for benefits. Anticipated schedule is 25-30 hours per week.What You Will DoWork with existing creative and deliver supporting designs, as well as execute original designs based on supporting strategy and brand guidelines.Nurture and maintain the brand identity and overall design across marketing, digital, social, in-arena, apparel, promotions, and events.Provide graphic design support for game presentation initiatives including in-arena environmental design & video board LED animations.Build various digital sponsorship graphics.Create content for the team's social media accounts.Prepare printing jobs for proofs and final outputs.Research and recommend images to use in assigned projects.Adhere to proper file management techniques to ensure efficient archiving and subsequent retrieval of projects.Report to and take direction from the Creative Director for all elements of visual identity and branding.Maintain high standards of efficiency, consistency, accuracy, creativity and timely delivery of all requests.Display keen attention to detail, spelling and grammar.Your Background, Skills And ExperienceHigh proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign and a working knowledge of the rest of CC suite of applications.Working knowledge of Adobe After Effects and experience in motion design & video editing a plus.Flexibility in handling a variety of assignments, ability to meet turnaround times, and deliver under pressure.Ability to work and communicate well with othersAbility to handle a fast paced environment.High level of personal integrity and professional ethics.Available to work evenings and weekends during NBA season; schedule is dynamic based on project needsCompensationThe hourly rate for this position is $18.00. This role is classified as part-time, temporary and is eligible for overtime pay.The LA Clippers are a proud equal opportunity employer. It is our desire and intent that all employees enjoy a professional business working environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.To view our employment privacy policy, please visit https://www.nba.com/clippers/california-employment-privacy-policy

Job DescriptionWe are on the search for a visionary Digital Design Director, someone with a passion for creating groundbreaking digital creative and engaging, artful marketing. This position demands versatility, encompassing a wide array of digital realms such as eCommerce (Shopify), email/SMS marketing, and organic + paid social media (including platforms like META, TIKTOK, and YOUTUBE). You'll be at the forefront of everything from extensive 360 digital campaigns and owned loyalty programs to engaging promotional ventures. Your role involves crafting and delivering compelling digital and editorial content for ILIA on an international stage across owned, earned and paid channels.This role is reports into the SVP, Creative, is hybrid (estimated 2-days in-person per week) and open to candidates based in Los Angeles Metropolitan area.Key Responsibilities:Design Mastery: Leverage your outstanding design skills to produce creative and visually appealing assets that embody our brand's philosophy. Your work should exhibit meticulous attention to detail and a dedication to exceptional design quality, particularly in the realm of beauty and skincare.Collaborative Conceptualization: Engage in collaborative brainstorming with the creative, social, eCommerce, UX, and technology teams to ensure your designs not only meet but surpass expectations.Digital Content Leadership: Spearhead the development of engaging digital content tailored to our audience across various digital platforms, such as social media, email, and websites, understanding the unique requirements of each.Typography and Design Passion: Show a profound commitment to typography, layout, and overall design aesthetics. Your creations should be visually striking while aligning strategically with our brand's objectives and values.Creative Collaboration and Execution: Work in close harmony with the Design and Copy teams, the Content Director, Creative Operations and the SVP of Creative to lead the design process and realize the creative vision.Social Media Creative Direction: Partner closely with the Social team in crafting compelling stories and assets for various channels, both in paid and organic channels.Leadership and Team Development: Manage and inspire a talented team of designers and editors, promoting creativity, efficiency, and professional development. Oversee the production of high-quality content for email marketing, our website, social media, and paid advertising campaigns.Art Direction and Design Management: Mentor and manage Art Directors, Designers, and Junior Designers, ensuring the highest design standards throughout all project stages.Integrated Campaign Collaboration: Actively participate in creative briefings and partner with Digital Commerce and Marketing teams to understand the needs of digital 360 campaigns, including aspects of social, website, and email design.Paid Campaign Oversight: Supervise our paid advertising campaigns, ensuring a consistent level of creative excellence while hitting key OKRs.Style Guide Development and Brand Consistency: Develop digital and email style guides, creatively addressing layout challenges while maintaining brand consistency.Cross-Functional Partnership: Work closely with Marketing and Creative teams during strategic development to ensure alignment across functions.User Experience Enhancement: Identify opportunities to enhance user experience through design, delivering a visually engaging and user-friendly interface.AI Understanding: Possess a solid comprehension of AI and its applications in design.Job requirements8-10 years of experience in 360 digital art design. Agency/In-house experience working with beauty, fashion, or wellness clients preferredYou should be deeply immersed in the world of beauty and skincare. Your passion for the industry should be evident in your work and your ability to stay ahead of trends and innovationsStrong portfolio showcasing expertise in digital design, typography, and brand development from concept to executionAdvanced knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch, Google Suite, Shopify, Klavio, Meta, TikTok, YouTubeUnderstanding of UX/UI design principlesFamiliarity with project tracking tools such as AsanaExcellent writing and communications experienceExcellent leadership and team management skillsManagement experience of teams with 3+ peopleMotion design experience is a plusWhat We Would Like To Offer...Base salary: $130,000-170,000*Bonus OpportunityHealth Benefits - 100% employer-paid medical, dental & vision coverageFlex Time Off - No cap on personal time off and paid company holidaysSeasonal Flex Days - Flexible scheduling to enjoy extra time under the sun during the Spring & Summer seasonParental Leave - Up to 18 weeks paid parental leave401(k) - Save for your future with a 401(k) with a company matchFlexibility & Wellness Stipends - Monthly stipends to support remote work & self-careHybrid Work Model - Find your flow, working from home or from one of our officesILIA Products - Quarterly stipend to replenish your favorite products and try new onesThis is the anticipated salary range for this position. The actual salary offered will carefully consider a few factors including your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.About ILIAILIA makes clean skin-centric beauty. We see skincare and makeup as one and believe that skin should look like skin. With transparency as our guide and color as our vehicle, we challenge the conventions of clean beauty to create something radically new, through safe, groundbreaking formulas that protect + revive the skin. Headquartered in Laguna Beach, California, ILIA brings together a strong group of innovative thinkers, rule-breakers and creative problem solvers. We pave the way forward as the leading clean makeup brand in what is being called the Clean Beauty Revolution. Fast paced growth provides constant learning, collaborative teamwork, and the desire to be the best at what you do. We celebrate taking risks and doing what hasn’t been done before.

Company: SFMOMA San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
Job_description: The San Francisco Museum of Modern Art is one of the largest museums of modern and contemporary art in the United States and a thriving cultural center for the Bay Area. We cannot imagine life without art; it inspires and connects us every day. Now more than ever, these connections matter and are aligned with our values.Inclusive: We strive to be a museum of many voices in dialogue.Passionate: We believe working with art is more than a job or trusteeship - it's a way of life.Brave: We are committed to approaching our work with courage and a sense of adventure.Empathic: We aim to act like a person, not an institution.SFMOMA is a place for the infinitely curious to explore, support, and experience the art of our time. We believe that modern and contemporary art can influence the way we think, view the world, and embrace the many voices and perspectives around us. We aspire to foster an environment that elicits joy, nurtures a sense of belonging and purpose—where difference is seen as a strength, and every one is appreciated for their whole self.SCHEDULE: Full Time, 35 hours/week, June 10 - August 16, 2024Department DescriptionThe SFMOMA Design Studio helps to translate the vision of our institution into a vibrant, cohesive, and welcoming brand and experience. The Graphic Design team within the Design Studio is responsible for all visual communication for the museum, both print and digital, including branding, exhibition graphics, publications, sfmoma.org, digital screens, and more. The department plays an integral role in content strategy and communicating the museum’s voice to onsite and offsite visitors.Position DescriptionThe Design Studio: Graphic Design Intern will work closely with the Senior Graphic Designer and other members of the Design Studio team on a wide range of projects. Projects may include brand system studies, museum signage initiatives, store product collaborations, social media efforts, website design, building and organizing a material library, and assisting on current and future exhibition materials. Through these projects the Graphic Design Intern will get hands-on experience scheduling, producing, delivering, and installing graphics for exhibitions, as well graphic design support on museum-wide projects. The Graphic Design Intern will be someone who loves a challenge, is an enthusiastic learner, has an eye for detail, and is both self-motivated and works well in a team.PROJECT PLANInterns will be given a project plan at the start of their internship that outlines several projects to be completed over the course of the summer. These projects will expose Interns to the breadth of work we do in the Design Studio and be tied to initiatives our team is working on over the summer.EDUCATIONAL OBJECTIVESSkills gained: Studio experience working on an in-house team, knowledge of the inner workings of a world class arts institution, various production methods including printing and prepress, web and email production, large scale vinyl graphics, etcTransferable Skills: Studio experience, content strategy, design critiques, project management, production experienceJobs this internship prepares someone for: a junior designer or designer position in a design studio or on an in-house design teamQualifications & SkillsMust be a current student or recent graduate with a focus in graphic design or a similar field. SFMOMA recognizes a graduation date within 6 months of the internship start date as a recent graduateHighly proficient in Adobe Creative SuiteKnowledge of Figma and digital design a plusKeen sense of typographyAbility to clearly communicate and present ideas and designs, set priorities and meet deadlinesHighly organized with great attention to detailSelf starter**Current SFMOMA employees are not eligible to apply for the Summer 2024 internship.**Application RequirementsCompleted application via SFMOMA's job siteResumeCover letter stating the specific internship of interest. Describe the experience you bring, why you are interested in museum or nonprofit work, reasons for applying to the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, and your goals for the internshipTwo letters of recommendation from either a college professor or former employerCollege transcript: Transcripts can be unofficial but need to be legibleApplication Deadline: March 15, 2024.You do not need separate letters of recommendation for each intern application - please just let each of the recommenders know which internships (up to 3) you're applying to and we'll review those two letters across all of your internship applications.Location: San Francisco, 151 3rd Street.COVID-19 Environmental Factors: In keeping with city, county, and state regulations regarding large gatherings, and to contain the spread of coronavirus, the museum is following the city of San Francisco guidelines. As a part of our commitment to health and safety, COVID-19 vaccination is required for all current and newly hired employees and contractors.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.SFMOMA is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility. No person shall be discriminated against based on race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, genetic information, ancestry/national origin, marital status, disability, medical condition, HIV status, sexual orientation, veteran/military status, and any other category protected by federal of state law.You may request reasonable accommodation if you are unable to or are limited in your ability to access job postings or provide additional information asked in the job posting.You can request reasonable accommodation by contacting the People team at talent@sfmoma.org.$7,000 pre-tax stipend paid out in a one-lump sum after start date

Job_description: Hang is building the future of loyalty for brands.Hang is the next generation brand loyalty & membership platform. By harnessing the power of personalization, gamification, and its integrations ecosystem, Hang provides brands with a radically new type of loyalty experience for their customers.Today, they work with a variety of major brands (such as Ulta Beauty, Budweiser, Flipkart, and more), as well as multiple well-known, up-and-coming restaurant chains (Boba Guys, Roam Artisan Burger, and Williamsburg Pizza, among several others).Hang draws from years of deep expertise in loyalty, game design, and finance with employees from leading companies like Google, Amazon, Apple, Meta, LinkedIn, Coinbase, Square, and Goldman Sachs.Hang raised a $16 million Series A led by Paradigm last summer, with participation from Tiger Global, Howard Schultz, Kevin Durant, Mr. Beast, and the founders of Warby Parker, Allbirds, and Bombas, among others.About The RoleAs our Graphic Design Intern, you will be responsible for the look and feel of assets seen by hundreds of large brands. At Hang, we understand that people do judge a book by its cover, and we’re dedicated to ensuring clients are delighted each and every time they interact with us or our products.What You’ll DoMarketing Materials: Design marketing collateral, including digital ads, presentations, and other promotional materials.Digital Assets: Produce high-quality graphics for our website, social media, and email campaigns.Client Assets: Work closely with our clients to conceptualize and implement compelling graphics.Creative Innovation: Stay abreast of the latest trends in graphic design and introduce innovative ideas to keep Hang's visual branding fresh and engaging.Project Management: Manage multiple design projects from concept through completion under tight deadlines.Who You AreYou have 1+ years of graphic/visual design experience.You have excellent visual taste.You have the ability to develop wireframes and prototypes.You are proficient in Figma, Adobe Illustrator, or similar design tools.You have experience delivering multiple projects with cross-disciplined teamsYou have the ability to balance delightful design with the need to move quickly and iterate.What Would Set You ApartYou've created marketing assets for major brands before.BenefitsUnlimited PTO / sick leaveCompetitive salary & equity compensation.Quarterly company offsites

Company DescriptionAt Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible.Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care.Job DescriptionPrimary Function of Position:The right candidate is passionate about improving people’s lives through design. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process.The Ideal Intern CandidateHas a passion for designing meaningful, revolutionary products that make an impact on people’s livesIs curious about user behaviors and has an eagerness to learn in the field and in a lab environmentIs excited to work on difficult problems with a dedicated team of high-energy, high-caliber peopleHas a natural aptitude for teamwork, thriving on brainstorming and presentingHas a high capacity for technical problem solving and execution workIs reliable and dedicated to achieving the highest quality design outputIs a highly creative problem solverSeeks out information as neededTakes a bias toward action and an eagerness to support the team and the projectEmploys healthy organization and communication habits making you a responsive and exemplary team playerHas a good aesthetic sensibility and artistic skillHas an incurable curiosity relating to all things designSkills, Experience, Education, & TrainingCurrent enrollment in a Graphic Design, Product Design, or degree-seeking program at the Bachelor’s level.A compelling portfolio that demonstrates understanding of scale, proportion, color, form, typography, brand, presentation; include examples of projects and processExcellent storytelling and presentation skills and an ability to effectively communicate a user-centered point of viewProficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud software, to quickly create concepts and photo-realistic compsExperience with 3D modeling software, (for viewing parts and assemblies), preferred but not requiredAdditional InformationDue to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19.
