Job Title: UX Design InternLocation: This position is based in our Campbell, California offices, on-site & full-time. Imperative Care does not provide relocation or additional housing compensation for the summer internship.Why Telos Health?At Telos Health we are developing novel robotic-assisted technologies and interventional capabilities that will forever change the disparate outcomes of ischemic stroke – a disease that impacts close to a million people a year in the U.S., and 10 million worldwide. Not only is Telos changing the way stroke is treated, but also bringing this treatment to the greater population who is currently without. We are actively building a team who is focused on developing novel solutions for this complex disease – a disease in which one in four adults will face in their lifetime.What You’ll Do:We are looking for a talented UX Design Intern to be an integral part of the Telos R&D team. Are you interested in developing innovative, robotic-assisted technology to transform the way ischemic stroke is treated? You will utilize user-centered design practices to contribute to the UI design of our novel robotic-assisted system for stroke treatment. We are looking for someone who is eager to work at the intersection of digital and physical. To deliver on our mission you will craft solutions that take user experience, ergonomics, function, aesthetics, quality and safety into account.Apply user centered design techniques to develop compelling UX design from concept ideation to visual mock-upsDesign and deliver user flows, wireframes, use scenarios, user journeys, mockups, and prototypesDevelop interaction concepts that take hardware and UI touchpoints into account, translating complex problems into simple and elegant solutionsParticipate in primary and secondary user research to understand the context of your work, use it as the foundation and rational for UX concepts, and to continuously improve upon designWork collaboratively with other designers, the engineering team and other stakeholder to come develop easy to use, safe andContribute to design documentation and communicationWhat You’ll Bring: ExperienceCurrently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in UX Design, Interaction Design or equivalentDesign portfolio that demonstrates a user-centered-design processCompetent in the use of design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.Strong communication, storytelling and presentation skillsWhat You’ll GainTelos provides an opportunity for students to work in the dynamic medical device industry and gain valuable hands-on experience with state-of-the-art equipment, instruments, and facilities. Our internship program is designed to give interns foundational experience and exposure to a variety of roles and areas of focus to help prepare them for a career in MedTech. This program also offers ongoing networking, learning and professional development opportunities, mentorship from executive leadership, social activities and peer-to-peer interaction.Join Us!Salary: $27/hourly for 10 week internshipPowered by JazzHRDRPCvDyLKl

Company DescriptionVuori is re-defining what athletic apparel looks like: built to move and sweat in but designed with a casual aesthetic to transition into everyday life. We draw inspiration from an active coastal California lifestyle; an integration of fitness, creative expression and life. Our high energy fast paced retail environment is reflected in the clothes we make. We aim to inspire others to take on all aspects of their lives with clarity, enthusiasm and purpose…while having a lot of fun along the way. We are proud to be an outlet for opportunity and for personal growth and success.Job DescriptionThe Design Manager will be responsible for all aspects of store design. He/she will be provide design support for all new stores, remodels, pop ups and special projects. Working closely with the development team including real estate, construction, visual merchandising and marketing, the Design Manager will collaborate with all parties to develop retail stores nationally and internationally.Responsibilities include but are not limited to:Develops initial test fit floor plans, facade design concepts, and design detail drawings to convey design intent to AOR.Works with all necessary internal departments including Real Estate, Construction, Visual Merchandising, Marketing and Operations to ensure the store design is in alignment with brand standards.Works closely with Head of Design to implement design vision and maintain brand and operational standards.Creates presentation materials for design concepts in the form of plans, 3D renderings, hand sketches, inspiration boards, and material sample collections for presentation to Senior Management.Manages external Architect of record and design teams across all phases of the project. (Due Diligence, SD, DD, CD and CA.)Coordinates and manages permit expeditors in conjunction with AOR to ensure regulatory approvals meet schedules.Manages / forecasts schedule of pipeline projects and is responsible for updating the Development team weekly.Reviews and approves architectural plans, elevations and relevant shop drawings to ensure design details are accurate and meet the brand standards.Conducts weekly meetings with external consultants and internal cross functional teams.Works closely with owner supplied vendors on design, shop drawings, purchase orders and schedules.Negotiates and maintains design budget and contracts with consultants.Actively researches current trends in global culture, retail design, architecture, fashion, art, etc.Develops and maintains store design standards and prototype documentation.QualificationsBA in Architecture or Interior Design7+ years design experience (2+ year’s experience in house working for a global retail brand’s store design team).Excellent ability to articulate and sketch/detail design concepts for documentation and constructability.Experience throughout the construction administration processSuperior organizational skills; ability to plan, prioritize, multi-task and manage projects independently.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Proficient in AutoCAD, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, Sketchup, BlueBeam. Revit, Enscape, 3D Max experience a plus.Must thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and work both independently and closely with others.International Experience a plusAdditional InformationPay Range: $102,000 - $120,000Benefits:Health InsurancePaid Time OffEmployee Discount401(k)All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Intercom is an AI-first customer service platform that helps businesses deliver better, faster, more personalized support.Intercom is bringing AI-first Customer Service to the world, dramatically improving experiences for customers, support agents, and managers alike.Modern, fast, and easy-to-use, Intercom’s complete AI-first Customer Service Platform enhances the customer experience, improves operational efficiency, and scales with our customers’ business every step of the way. Intercom is also the most innovative and fastest improving product on the market. Shipping over 200 product improvements every year, Intercom is bringing AI features to market before anyone else.What's the opportunity? 🤔The Intercom Creative Studio is looking to build a world-class creative team. As a key component of this highly motivated & inspired team, we are looking to hire a creative visionary to lead the newly formed Creative Marketing team. This team will be responsible for breathing life into the newly delivered Intercom brand system, maintaining and expanding the Brand book, creating brand libraries for various teams to utilize, lead the creation of net new and repurposed assets in the new brand, art directing illustrators, and managing a team of creatives.The ideal creative candidate will have a wealth of boundary-pushing visual design experience, an obsession with sweating the finer details of a design/brand system, ability to art-direct towards brand accurate execution, a driving ambition for creative quality, and will lead their team by example through unparalleled work ethic, optimistic outlook, and inspiring creative work.As a Design Manager on the Creative Marketing team, you’ll work alongside other creative managers and will report directly to the head of Creative Studio. You will steer creative execution through your clear and inspired art direction, helping to shape your designers’ work to be unparalleled in creativity and quality. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with writers, Producers, Illustrators, and Animators to produce career defining work that will shape the future of the Intercom brand.There’s never been a more exciting time to join the Intercom Brand Studio as we are reshaping what it looks like to build an in-house creative agency within a recognized and reputable Product-lead SAAS business.If you’re a highly motivated and inspired Design manager and you’re looking to help foster creative talent and shape a special, deep-rooted creative culture, this is your opportunity. We’re here to do the best work of our careers and to help shape the future of a thriving and expanding business.Our small but growing in-house team is home to a diverse group of creatives with a broad range of experience, backgrounds and talents. We’re constantly looking for ways to make our day-to-day work feel fresh and meaningful, and we deeply value the health and wellness of each member of the team.What will I be doing?🚀Managing a team of creativesGiving on-brand art direction and creative feedbackDesigning boundary-pushing, creatively inspired workDelivering work at the forefront of design trendsStoryboarding motion-based assets and art directing animatorsWorking within and expand upon a brand systemHelping to implement a new brand identity throughout various touch pointsOwning projects from concept to final executionCollaborating with stakeholders in a highly iterative and agile environmentBalancing design excellence with a need for speed and a focus on success metricsPartnering with writers, producers, marketers, product experts, company leaders and external agencies to drive projects forwardArt directing designers, freelancers, agencies, and motion designersWhat skills do I need? 📖8-10 years of design experience with a portfolio showcasing a breadth of excellent brand-related work2-3 years Management experienceProficiency in Figma, Adobe CCExperience in motion design and storyboarding (in execution and/or art direction)Strong design sensibilities, from high-level strategic direction to production detailsAbility to communicate with precision, clarity, honesty, and respectA general understanding of business goals and strategyA general understanding of web performance metricsAbility to present ideas effectively to stakeholdersAbility to navigate ambiguous projectsBenefits 😍We are a well-treated bunch, with awesome benefits! If there’s something important to you that’s not on this list, talk to us! :)Competitive salary and meaningful equityComprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverageRegular compensation reviews - great work is rewarded!Open vacation policy and 10 corporate holidaysPaid Parental Leave Program401k plan & matchIn-office bicycle storageFun events for Intercomrades, friends, and family!The base salary range for candidates within the San Francisco Bay Area is $148,800 - $201,300. Actual base pay will depend on a variety of factors such as education, skills, experience, location, etc. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. All regular employees may also be eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).Intercom has a hybrid working policy. We believe that working in person helps us stay connected, collaborate easier and create a great culture while still providing flexibility to work from home. We expect employees to be in the office at least two days per week.Intercom values diversity and is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity. Intercom will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.Is this role not quite what you're looking for? Join our Talent Community to stay connected with us.

About UsRapt is an award-winning design and strategy studio that helps leading brands navigate the complex challenges of this ever-changing world. With locations in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and New York — and with clients spanning the globe — we bring fresh thinking and a highly customized approach to each and every partnership. Our interdisciplinary teams blend architecture, interior design, brand experience, graphic design, and strategic thinking into holistic solutions that further our clients’ missions. Our agile approach earned us the distinction of being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies.We’re embracing the future of work with a hybrid approach. We spend 3 days in the studio each week as a team, and we also have days where we work from home. Ultimately, we trust our staff to know how and where they will do their best work.About The RoleAt Rapt, Senior Designers maintain a keen eye for detail while managing multiple projects, from conception to realization. They lead our designers and work closely with Studio Leads and Design Directors to ensure each project’s success. We’re currently looking for someone who’s got the confidence and creativity required to be on the frontlines of our work.Qualifications:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture or Interior Design8+ years of experience working at an architecture or design studioExpertise with Revit, AutoCAD, SketchUp, Microsoft Office, and Adobe Creative SuiteExpertise working with project teams from concept design through constructionExpertise with project management, construction administration, budget review, building codes, consultant coordination, and client relationsProficiency with jurisdictional agencies and multi-disciplinary consultantsProficiency with commercial projects, including ground-up construction, core and shell repositioning, and creative workplaceState licensure or pursuance of state licensure is encouragedWe’re looking for:A team player with a positive attitude who’s enthusiastic about tackling the unexpected and unknownA creative person with strong graphic, organizational, and communication skillsA conceptual thinker who’s always seeking inspirationA confident decision-maker and risk-takerA leader who’s interested in mentoring fellow design staffSomeone who can both design conceptually and detail thoroughly, with an ability to zoom in and out along the project timeline from the macro to the micro and back againA leader who doesn’t allow ego to push teams or projects in ways that don’t benefit everyone, and who provides guidance not for their own benefit but for the benefit of the project and teamCompensation is based on relevant experience and qualifications. Salary for this role is estimated between $90,000 to $140,000 plus benefits and bonuses.Benefits and Perks:Generous options for medical, dental, vision insuranceLocation flexibility and unlimited paid time off (PTO)Tax-deferred savings through FSA, parking and transit allocations401K with employer contributionComplimentary One Medical membershipsNew hire referral bonus

Overview:The Global Visual + Experiential Designer Director for Kendo will lead the creative vision for all IRL spaces across the globe and for all brands at Kendo bringing together design, merchandising, and copy to formulate a north star creative vision for how our brands are presented. This critical creative leadership role will translate strategy, campaigns and 2d assets into 3d storytelling for the consumer in a compelling way. This Director would be very experienced in concepting and drafting blue sky thinking for retail & experiential initiatives with the strong ability to marry those ideas with the consumer, our brand DNA, innovative retail concepts and the business needs to deliver best-in-class experiences that meet the business objectives. This role will be the first to identify the changing retail & consumer landscape and propose ideas on how to stay ahead. This role would support all Kendo brands and offer a wide range of projects across retail spaces, merchandising, marketing, store design, experiential marketing for the consumer, influencers, founders and retail partners.Responsibilities:InnovationLead the blue sky thinking and push the brands IRL experience to be best in classConceptualize + DesignLead the conceptualization and design of visually appealing and on-brand in-store displays, windows, animated VM spaces to maximize product visibility and consumer experience. This can be through hand sketches and renderings.Introduce innovative design concepts for experiential and retail spacesLead the translation of the 2D space to the 3D space while bringing to life brand storytelling.SourcingLead the research and selection of materials and fixtures to enhance product displays.Establish innovative relationships with vendors and oversee the procurement of fixtures.CollaborationCollaborate with brand teams to ensure strong briefs for team and vendors for product launches.Lead brainstorms with creative team to ideate and ensure fixture design aligns with overall concept design.Collaborate with retailer partners and field teams to understand best in class fixtures and understand what is working and not with Kendo fixtures.Maintain Visual StandardsProvide leadership by regularly visiting stores to ensure that visual merchandising standards are maintained and execute innovative adjustments as needed.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Visual Design, or a related field or equivalent experience.10 + years of proven experience as a Store Design, Visual Merchandising Designer or related in the beauty or retail industry.Strong understanding of beauty industry trends and consumer behavior.Proficiency in design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, SketchUp).Excellent communication, collaboration, leadership, and innovation skills.Creative thinking and ability to translate ideas into visually appealing displays.Strong project management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.Experience in vendor management and procurement processes.People leadership experience including cross functional partnerships and influencing.

Job Description:At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we know that each talent makes our collective bolder and brighter. We are guided by four core principles that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses: Music is Everything: Music is our passion, and we can never get enough. Tastes, trends, and tech will change, but great artists and songwriters will always be our driving force. Global Growth, Local Expertise: Music is a global language. Through communication and collaboration, our success can come from anywhere and translate everywhere. Innovation and Insight: Pushing the boundaries requires the best information and the boldest imagination. We use both to create the future. Empowered by People: Like the artists we serve and the music they make, our differences make us stronger. This is a place where every talent can belong and build a career.We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity. Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.Job Title: Manager, Creative Graphic DesignerA little bit about our team:Established in 2017 by Elliot Grainge, 10K Projects is one of the fastest growing completely independent record labels in the world. Its innovative multi-platinum artists and partners drive billions of streams each year with acts including Ice Spice, Trippie Redd, iann dior, Surfaces, YTB Fatt, COIN, Salem Ilese and many more. The company is dedicated to continually pursuing philanthropy efforts expressed through its 10K Together division. Based in Los Angeles, CA, 10K Projects is committed to recognize and champion the unique visions of creatives and storytellers of tomorrow.Your role:The Creative team at 10K Projects is looking for a digital graphic designer who can create social and web-specific art that brings our artists’ voices onto these platforms. We are seeking vision, creativity, and design expertise to create immersive experiences across various social platforms, web, email, and other fan-facing digital outlets. This role will work alongside the Digital Marketing team to plan and implement ongoing, campaign-driven creative elements for 10K Projects; roster of music artists.Here you’ll get to: Participate in brainstorms alongside Digital Marketing strategists, Marketing Directors, and on occasion A&R, artists, and their management teams Align with marketing strategy and translate initiatives into visual content (photos, gifs, and graphics) with the intent to engage artists fans and grow their following while supporting key business objectives Conceptualize, produce, and edit content aligning with the artist’s voice/vision that is designed and optimized with platform, target audience, and marketing goals in mind Understand best practices for social media, web, and email including the how to create successful, engaging content for each platform Create engaging content including: static designs using imagery and/or typography, gifs, illustrations, photography, paid social ads including carousels, thematic types of posts including countdown assets, lyrics, infographics, etc. Attend events and create real time content including but not limited to photography and videography to be used for social posting or Instagram stories Edit, retouch, and resize existing assets Available for off-hour (weeknights and weekend) deliverables as tied to artist releases Lead all aspects of Digital Asset Management and proper archiving of photo shoots and finished packaging deliverablesAbout you: 2-3+ years of experience producing custom social content within agency or in-house social/creative teams Strong design skills, comfortable taking an idea from concept to implementation. Strong typography, photography, and illustration/image editing skills with a keen eye for taste level and unique executions Strong visual sense and taste level with an understanding of photo and design principles for mobile, web, and social-first content. Previous experience showcasing a range of artistic themes, styles, and formats Deep understanding of the nuances of each online platform (Facebook, X, Instagram, Snapchat, YouTube, Web, email, etc) and how to adapt and optimize content per channel; this includes proper file size, specs, and copy adaptations Manage tight deadlines while maintaining commitment to excellence and impeccable attention to detail Highly organized, proactive, multifaceted, capable of working on concurrent projects and able to communicate effectively to digital team members, vendors, artists, and executives Highly skilled in Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign) Proven experience conceptualizing, driving, and delivering impactful, engaging creative assets for digital/social platformsWe’d love it if you also had: Motion graphics, animation, and/or video design skills Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design/related fields or equivalent experienceAbout us:As the home to 10K Projects, 300 Elektra, Asylum, Atlantic, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Redefining what it means to be a music company in the 21st century, our consumer brands include trend-setters like UPROXX, Songkick, HipHopDX, and EMP. We’re the home to WMX – the next generation services division that connects artists with fans and amplifies brands in creative, immersive, and engaging ways – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels. Together, we are Warner Music Group: Music With Vision & Voice.Love this job and want to apply?Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.Salary Range$66,650 - $70,000 AnnuallySalary ranges are included for job postings where required by law. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as work experience and business needs. The pay range is subject to change at any time dependent on a variety of internal and external factors.WMG is committed to inclusion and diversity in all aspects of our business. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and will evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law (genetic characteristics or cancer), physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.Copyright © 2023 Warner Music Inc.Links to relevant documents:2024 Benefits At A Glance final.pdfEVerify Participation Poster.pdfRight To Work - English.pdfRight to Work - Spanish.pdf

Job_description: A little about who Síol is...Our office is based on culture.Our success is built on trust and empowerment.Curiosity is the foundation of success.Through equity and inclusivity, we embrace multiple perspectives.Collaboration on projects fortifies a strong team.Transparency engenders trust.A healthy work-life balance clears the mind.A little bit of what we hope defines you...We are looking for a Designer that can see themself thriving in the above environment.We elevate those who embrace their role in leadership by setting the example.Successful projects rely on dedication, planning, and attention to detail.A team’s growth and success is dependent on empowerment and the distribution of responsibility.Learning from others forms a diverse worldview.Architects embrace the expertise of their consultants to make a cohesive project.Form and Function need not be mutually exclusive.Job Title: Assistant Project Manager | Interior DesignPosition Status: Full-TimeClassification: Non-ExemptSalary Range: $68,250 - $84,000This job description reflects the general level and nature of the job. It is not intended to be all inclusive.JOB SUMMARYThis role is responsible for working with our Senior team to see each phase of assigned projects through to completion. Itrequires a highly motivated interior design professional, creative thinker, and friendly self-starter. This position is best suitedfor someone comfortable coordinating and managing a variety of tasks with moving parts in a fast-paced and collaborativeenvironment. Attention to detail is a must.PRIMARY DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIESWork closely with the Principal and Senior Interior designers on projects in all phases• Coordinate and communicate between architectural and landscape teams within Síol and within each project• Participate in concept research/development, design language and detail generation• Prepare and maintain project schedules and budgets• Source and specify furniture, fittings, equipment, accessories and soft goods in alignment with the project narrative,functional requirements and budget• Assist and oversee the production of presentation materials including digital and physical• Prepare and maintain specification sheets and purchase logs• Assist with the preparation of construction documents, consisting of plans, elevations, details, and specifications, toillustrate structural and non-structural elements, power locations, reflected ceiling plans, and lighting designs. Abilityto field measure and document building conditions• Coordinate and collaborate with other design professionals who may be retained to provide professional services,including but not limited to upholstery, drapery, painters, cabinetmakers, and wallpaper installers• Manage communication with various vendors from specifying through purchasing and installation/delivery• Effectively and accurately document and complete purchases. Coordinate client invoicing with in-house team• Coordinate and oversee on-site installations with movers and subcontractors• Manages organization of project files, documents, material boxes and photos• Provide periodic updates to Senior team• Jump into non-project relates tasks from time to timeKNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES - REQUIRED• 3-5 years of experience in high-end residential interior design• Proficient with AutoCAD, Adobe Creative Suites, and G Suite• Relationships with furniture makers, showrooms, and local vendors/trades• Efficient time management and prioritization of assigned tasks• Flexibility to toggle between jobs and tasks• Strong sense of self-motivation and attention to detail• Demonstrates professional and clear communication skill• Must be authorized to work in the United StatesKNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES – PREFERRED• Experience with Studio Designer and ArchiCAD a plusBENEFITS• Company-Paid: Medical, vision, and dental insurance• Annual year-end discretionary bonus based on the health of the company• PTO: 15 days per year• Paid Holidays: 9 paid holidays + 2 additional floating holidays• 401(k) with 4% employer match• Life and disability insurance coverage• Commuter benefit• Cell phone: $100/month cell phone reimbursement• Education Reimbursement: Compensation for select continued educational opportunities, including reimbursementfor pass professional licensure exams.• Based on the financial health of the firm, we will offer twice annual team day trips to enjoy experiences togethersuch as architecture tours, walking tours, museumIf you meet these qualifications and are motivated to contribute in a team environment, please send cover letter, resume, and work samples to hiring@siolstudios.com. Emails only, please. We value attention to detail and thoroughness; those who follow said protocol for application will be considered first.We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome diversity in the workplace. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Design DirectorRate: 70-75/hrLocation: LAOur client, a growing name in the luxury CPG space is looking for a Design Director/Art Director. This is a temp to hire opportunity that is hybrid (Tues-Thurs) in the LA area.THE ROLE: As the Design Director, you'll play a pivotal role in crafting the visual identity of consumer promotional and retail products for prestigious global brands. Collaborating closely with our product architects and clients, you'll unleash your creative genius to deliver extraordinary solutions. Your realm of influence will extend across various creative and supply chain channels, where you'll deftly manage multiple projects and tight deadlines. The expertise you bring in physical product and production techniques will be instrumental in guiding our China and Asia-Pacific factories to breathe life into remarkable concepts.We're looking for a unique blend of a thinker and a doer: someone who’s as comfortable with brainstorming the next big idea as they are with rolling up their sleeves to design something breathtaking themselves. They must have great design skills and be capable of doing design work themselves.REQUIREMENTS:BA/BS in Graphic Design or a related field (or showcase 5 years of relevant experience as your key to this extraordinary role).5+ years of proven graphic design expertise, honing your skills with a focus on retail, consumer brands, and marketing campaigns.Proficient in Adobe CS (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat Pro) and SketchMust know Pantone ConnectMust know how to create 3D mockups / renderingsIDEAL BUT NOT MANDATORYExperience with sourcing products overseasExperience using Salesforce, Slack, Mailchimp, CanvaExperience with CopywritingFamiliarity with Generative AIExperience working with factories to develop a product

About Banana RepublicBorn from two California creatives fueled by their explorer spirits, Banana Republic has repositioned itself as a premium, experiential lifestyle brand for today’s modern world. Designed for a life where anything is possible, we use the finest materials with the latest fabric innovations to create timeless, versatile clothing, jewelry, shoes and handbags. Through our home and art collections, we extend beyond apparel and are a part of our customers' lives at home.We are creating memorable, immersive experiences online and in-store that build lasting relationships and solve our customers’ lifestyle needs. Our team is made up of passionate and curious storytellers who are pushing the boundaries to deliver consistent, quality product through an elevated customer experience. Sound interesting? Join us as on the BR journey as we create what’s next.About The RoleAs a Banana Republic Home Design Consultant, you have a passion for creating aspirational and on trend looks that enhance the customer's emotional connection to the brand. You build meaningful and lasting relationships with your customers, leveraging your thorough understanding of interior design, lifestyle brands and seasonal trends to guide and advise your customers looking to furnish an entire room or simply add an accent piece. As a Home Design Consultant, you will contribute to a positive, friendly and inclusive environment that inspires and makes our customers feel welcome. Your goal is to grow the business by genuinely wanting to create an outstanding and elevated customer experience.What You'll DoSupport and maintain sales goals as communicated by your leadership teamPromote design services to clients in order to elevate their shopping experienceBuild rapport with customer by demonstrating strong product knowledge and interpersonal skillsDevelop lasting relationships with clients through clientelingEnsure brand is brought to life through refined aesthetics and merchandisingRepresent the brand and understand the competition and home furnishings landscapeDemonstrate values and behaviors that amplify our Words to Live byCreate an inclusive environment through meaningful and authentic connections with employees and customersWho You AreProven success in elevated selling culture and experience leveraging clienteling behaviors in premium or luxury retail environment with home furnishingsStrength in driving metrics to deliver results that will meet or exceed business goalsAbility to navigate various technology platforms and devices with or without a reasonable accommodation as part of the selling experienceAbility to build/maintain a client based and provide creative furnishing solutions for clientsAbility to manage complex customer issues or concerns in a timely mannerFlexible to work days, nights, weekends and holidays to meet the needs of the business; consistent scheduling may be available as required by state and local lawsAbility to lift and carry 50lbs. with or without a reasonable accommodationYou have 12+ months previous sales experience in a premium or luxury retail environment with home furnishings, with some interior design or spatial planning experience preferredHigh School+ diploma or GEDA champion for Gap Inc cultureBenefits at Banana RepublicMerchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*See more of the benefits we offer.For eligible employeesGap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We will meet minimum wage or minimum of the pay range (whichever is higher) based on city, county and state requirements.US CandidatesPlease note that effective, June 30, 2022, Gap Inc. will no longer require any of its employees to wear face masks or require proof of COVID vaccination, unless required by local or state/provincial mandates or as part of Gap Inc’s quarantine guidelines after being exposed to or testing positive for COVID. Job_title: Associate Manager, Graphic Illustrator, Packaging Design
Job_description: POSITION SUMMARYDo you love to draw? Are you fast on the spot? Think in the moment? Can you visualize a design concept and quicky render it into reality? Kendo is looking for a talented rendering wizard to join the Packaging Design Team in San Francisco.The Graphic Illustrator of Packaging design is responsible for creating new product design renders for the entire scope of our Kendo brand portfolio. This position is key to demonstrate on the fly sketching/rendering/illustrations using creative vision to translate and evolve brand packaging by bringing concepts to life and tell a story through design. The Graphic Illustrator will communicate information, ideas, and instructions via visual drawings according to specifications set forth by the Product Universe Team.RESPONSIBILITIES:Produce high-level, on strategy Illustrations/renders that meet Kendo standard of creative excellence.Produce visual concepts to sell-in new product/packaging design ideas for presentations.Uses artistic judgment to select appropriate composition, design, and layout for each render/illustration.Creates accurate exploded-view drawings that can be manufactured.Performs other related duties as assigned.REQUIREMENTSGraphic designer or Illustrator with 2-4 years’ work experience including 1-2 years of experience in the beauty or fashion, packaging design experience requiredBA or BFA in Design, Arts, and/or Graphic Design or equivalent experienceAdvanced/Expert Apple computer skills in Adobe Creative Cloud Suite, with a specialty within Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesignDetail oriented designer who is comfortable with shifting design direction and working on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environmentMust possess strong interpersonal skills and creative resolution skillsSelf-starter who will participates in all aspects of the programs from concept through executionAbility to quickly generate concepts and visually communicate those ideas with renderings and/or compsAbility to take initiative and know how to design ahead proactively without always being promptedDemonstrated ability to meet tight timelines and work productively in a team environment are requiredExcellent time management skills with ability to project manage workload autonomously is a mustMust have excellent eye for color and typography.Very strong organizational skillsPassion for graphic design and beauty with a sense of both current and developing trends in print/pattern, art, and packaging

OverviewThe OpportunityThe Brand Experience (Experiential) team is responsible for delivering best-in-class activations for all brands across the PepsiCo portfolio. From major events to LTO influencer kits, from temporary retail displays to permanent stadium installations, the Brand Experience team touches every facet of the design process.The Design Associate Manager is an integral part of the growing Brand Experience team. Under the direction and guidance of the Experience Design Lead, the Senior Designer is responsible for the creative development process from conceptualization through to on-site execution, collaborating closely with cross functional partners both internally and externally. Successful candidates will be agile, curious, entrepreneurial, and most importantly passionate about pushing the boundaries of what can be achieved through design.Why PepsiCo?PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated more than $66 billion in net revenue in 2014, driven by a complementary food and beverage portfolio that includes Frito-Lay, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Quaker, and Tropicana. PepsiCo's product portfolio includes a wide range of enjoyable foods and beverages, including 22 brands that generate more than $1 billion each in estimated annual retail sales. At the heart of PepsiCo is Performance with Purpose – our goal to deliver top-tier financial performance while creating sustainable growth and shareholder value. In practice, Performance with Purpose means providing a wide range of foods and beverages from treats to healthy eats; finding innovative ways to minimize our impact on the environment and reduce our operating costs; providing a safe and inclusive workplace for our employees globally; and respecting, supporting and investing in the local communities where we operate.Why PepsiCo Design?At PepsiCo design, we have a saying: “We’re crazy enough to think we can inspire the future.” This is what drives us, in everything we imagine, develop and execute.Our goal is clear: to connect PepsiCo’s beverage, snacks and nutrition portfolios, with today’s hyper-connected, networked users and consumers hungry for meaningful, authentic and relevant brand experiences across multiple touch points and regions of the world.PepsiCo Design & Innovation is a creatively driven team that leverages the power of Design Thinking to solve brand and business problems that drive meaningful value and growth. Our mission is to elevate the role of design and design thinking as a function, process, mindset, and as culture in PepsiCo and the broader business world.We are a consumer-centric organization with a start-up mentality within our larger organization; we partner with world-class partners in Marketing, Insights, and R&D to strategically drive business results with purpose.ResponsibilitiesOwning the creative process from brief to execution with emphasis on concept visualizationLeading cross functional creative brainstorms leveraging design thinking to unlock innovative approaches to brand activationsPartnering with individual brand teams to identify and codify experiential brand language through own-able materials, finishes, colors, lighting, sounds, scents and more.Clearly communicating ideas through visualization and effective presentation to cross functional internal and external stakeholdersSourcing and engaging external agencies, fabricators, architects, and producersEffectively managing timelines and deliverables across multiple projectsCompensation & Benefits:The expected compensation range for this position is between $81,000 - $135,600 based on a full-time scheduleLocation, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salaryBonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 10% of annual salary paid out annuallyPaid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavementIn addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement PlanQualificationsStrong portfolio which demonstrates breadth of experience and impeccable taste in design7+ Years relevant experienceBA required; related field (design, industrial design, architecture) preferredSelf-described “Jack/Jill of all trades,” with a curiosity and excitement to learn new thingsHighly proficient in one or more 3D programs (SketchUp, Rhino, 3DS Max, C4D)Proficient in Adobe CS and one or more rendering programs ( Enscape, Vray, Keyshot)Knowledgeable in common production methods, materials, and technologiesKeen interest in latest trends across pop culture, fashion, art, design, music, and technologyExcellent communication, written, oral, and visualCollaborative and iterativeAbility to work in fast-paced environment while maintaining a high standard of outputMust be willing to travel up to 20% of the timeAbility to hand sketch preferred but not requiredIdeally has an existing network of vendors, fabricators, agenciesExperience with any other areas of design a plus: Motion Graphics, Photography, Video, Web design etcPrior experience with CPG brand(s) a plusAbility to develop production mechanicals for print or fabrication preferredEEO StatementAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender IdentityIf you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy.Please view our Pay Transparency Statement
Industries: Food and Beverage Services and Manufacturing

Job_description: As Descript's Head of Brand Design, you will build and scale a differentiated brand identity for Descript, rooted in motion and video. One that, when people see it, makes them think things like "so helpful," "so smart," "so honest," and "such a refreshing break from the usual drivel I encounter on the internet." You have taste, and a strong point of view on work that you share willingly with empathy and positivity.In return for bringing your talents to Descript we'll keep you fed on an endless buffet of face-meltingly cool features and opportunities to flex your creative muscles.This is a leadership role reporting into the VP of Marketing, collaborating with both external partners and internal stakeholders including the CEO, leadership team and functional marketing leads.What will you do?Build our internal brand playbook and visual brand style and process from a video-native lens.Lead, grow, and inspire video and brand design teams at Descript.Own creative execution of demand generation/campaignsManage campaign development and brand strategies that include strategic collaboration with marketing functions, campaign development, testing programs and iteration, creative development, production and execution along with creative partners.Collaborate with a variety of cross-functional teams including Marketing, Product Management, Product Design, and senior leadership to develop and maintain consistent tone, identity, creative strategy across all touch points.Minimum requirements3+ years of people management and 2+ years of experience as a Brand Design leader, Creative Director, Art Director or similar roles. Strong experience with video and motion.Driven to seek and try unexpected, surprising, and unconventional brand creative and comms. Skeptical of any creative or comms that look, read, or feel like what you'd expect from a brand.Track record of building strong and effective creative organizations in a rapidly growing environment and excel at motivating and inspiring people at all levels to do their best work.Led brands that are user journey and experience focused.Player/coach who will always want to roll up their sleeves and be hands-on with the design.Experience with horizontal products for B2C/B2B.Bonus profileExperience working with Figma, Webflow, GACreated templates and other in product assetsWorked with creator-oriented tools (design, 3D, audio/video)The base salary range for this role is $155,000- $205,000. Final offer amounts will carefully consider multiple factors, including prior experience, expertise, and location, and they may vary from the amount above.About DescriptDescript is building a simple, intuitive, fully-powered editing tool for video and audio — an editing tool built for the age of AI. We are a team of 140 — with a proven CEO and the backing of some of the world's greatest investors (OpenAI, Andreessen Horowitz, Redpoint Ventures, Spark Capital).Descript is the special company that's in possession of both product market fit and the raw materials (passionate user community, great product, large market) for growth, but is still early enough that each new employee has a measurable influence on the direction of the company.Benefits include a generous healthcare package, catered lunches, and flexible vacation time. We currently have offices in San Francisco and Montreal, and are open to folks working remotely between PT and ET time zones. Whether you love WFH or can't wait to get back to being in person, we're interested in offering an environment that works for you.Descript is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We believe in actively building a team rich in diverse backgrounds, experiences, and opinions to better allow our employees, products, and community to thrive.

WHAT WE NEED FROM EVERYONE:Live our values & do the brave thing.Our Values: Good Enough is Not Enough. Grab an Oar. Be More Human. Play Like a Pirate.Doing the brave thing is about courage. It's about never being a spectator. Speaking up with clarity and conviction and kindness. Not hedging our points-of-view with clients or each other. Saying what we think when it's in the best interest of the idea or the people, even if it's uncomfortable. Being willing to take smart risks. Making tough decisions without agonizing. And, being transparent and vulnerable in search of the best. This is the expectation for all of us. In turn, we commit to perpetuating a culture where bravery is rewarded and support is always within reach.WHO WE ARE:Design by Disruption® is a global design studio housed within TBWA\Chiat\Day Los Angeles and is part of the TBWA global collective, created to unleash the experience soul of a brand across every touch point and channel. We care about craft and we care a lot. We call this Craft Devotion. We want to make beautiful stuff. We want the design to be thoughtfully, masterfully, and artfully executed across the many touch points that consumers experience from a brand.https://designbydisruption.com/WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU:The Senior Project Manager, Design is responsible for the delivery of the design development portion of the agency's output and is involved throughout the duration of the project. They are the glue that holds the design development process together, acting as agnostic steward of the work, driving the most effective and efficient systems to optimize our agency's creative and design output.WHAT YOU WILL DO:This role is expected to manage the communications of the design process, drive timelines for optimum output, and manage the workflow throughout the lifecycle of a project. They are also responsible for managing overarching schedules, design development budgets and reconciliation.Must have experience with design workflows and how work should be completed. Creative problem-solving ability and a sharp attention to detail.Thinks clearly under pressure, remaining flexible and managing challenging deadlines/stressful situations with confidence.Strong organizational skills and capabilities, with the ability to handle multiple tasks and keep accurate and detailed records for every project while developing solutions.Works as a team player with a positive attitude.Proactively drive projects forward while communicating next steps to team members.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; able with the ability to communicate with employees of all levels.Specific Responsibilities:Manages internal and client-facing meetings, tracking feedback, requested revisions,, leading and reporting next steps and deadlines, ensuring timely completion of all deliverables.Is the primary point of contact for DxD project intake, ensuring there is a clear design brief and ask.Manages client (external and internal) feedback, solicits and acts on and establishes clear expectations for delivery and ambitions..Partner with Ops Directors, Brand Leads on scoping and budgeting of projects.Partner with Associate Production Director in creating work plan and also to ensure that deadlines are being met.Adjusts/refines and shifts priorities across projects and leads internal reviews to ensure that we are on-time and delivering the best work possible.Manage schedules, scopes, assets, capacity planning, change management and overall project organizationEnsure requirements and project deliverables dates are clearly communicated, understood, and executed upon.Monitoring projects, working with the Ops Director/Brand PM to escalate or mitigate any issues that may arise, and adapting responses to changing conditions to ensure best possible project outcomesManages deadlines and communication to key partners on expectations and key milestones or changes to schedule.Coordinates and run design weekly status meeting and provide day-to-day project status to the teamHandles invoice tracking and account billing for both retainer and project-based accountsOrganizes the creative briefs on DXD task system.Partners with brand PMs to develop timelines on creative development projects. Sets timelines on projects both large and small and distributes timelines to the team.Contributing to project management process, tools and templatesQUALIFICATIONS:8-10 years project management or production experience; ideally in design projectsExperience working in a creative environment; from strategy development through to production delivery.Team player, able to multi-task and problem solve under pressure in a fast-paced environment.Excellent interpersonal skills, able to establish strong working relationships with cross-functional teams and colleagues of all levels.Able to work both autonomously and collaboratively for solutions-oriented results.Clear and concise written and verbal presentation skills and style; proficient in presentation (Google Slides, Keynote, PowerPoint) and workflow software (Smartsheet, Microsoft Project).Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.As a member of TBWA's Design x Disruption team, you should be seen as a positive force, always problem solving and offering solutions. As the glue holding the creative development process together, project managers should maintain a good attitude in the face of the many challenges their team members will encounter. They should know how to manage stress, conflict, and adversity in a positive, productive manner.All hires must be located in or willing to relocate to Los Angeles to work from our offices hybrid three days a week.The annual salary range for this role is $105,000-$125,000 and may vary depending on the candidate's experience. Other compensation includes relocation costs, if applicable. Benefits for this role include health/vision/dental insurance, 401(k), stock purchase, vacation, sick and personal days, Also, you will be eligible (approximately thirty days after you commence employment) to participate in all disability, life, travel insurance plans and programs, retirement plans subject to the terms and conditions of such benefit plans. Please don't let our posted ranges keep you from exploring this or any other exciting opportunities within TBWA.

We are Brand New School.What we are looking for:We want eager artists and who are hungry for the chance to gain real world experience.
