Job_description: Company DescriptionWe create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.Universal Products & Experiences OverviewUniversal Products & Experiences (UP&E) globally drives the expansion and elevation of NBCUniversal’s iconic collection of brands, intellectual properties, characters, and stories based on the company’s extensive portfolio of properties created by Universal Pictures, Illumination, DreamWorks Animation and NBCUniversal Television and Streaming. The division executes this through innovative physical and digital products, engaging retail and product experiences across our expansive global theme park destinations (for both owned and 3rd party IP), location-based venues, e-commerce product platforms, and retailers around the world. Along with global brand strategy and creative, UP&E’s three lines of business include Consumer Products, Games and Digital Platforms, as well as Theme Parks Products & Retail. UP&E is a division of Universal Parks & Resorts, part of NBCUniversal, a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation. https://www.universalproductsexperiences.com/Universal Products & Experiences is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce of the highest caliber. We are committed to fostering equitable and inclusive environments that honor the experiences, perspectives, and uniqueness of each colleague.It is the policy of NBCUniversal and NBCUniversal's affiliated businesses to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy) sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law.Job DescriptionLeads, concepts, and executes global creative strategy and creative tools for Franchises as assigned.Shapes the tone and vision of any given brandDevelops campaigns and tools that unlock business and brand, ensuring exceptional creative quality across any given Franchise ecosystem.As a Franchise shepherd, ensures ownership of projects from start to finishGo-to brand expert in the characters/stories/content of NBCU entitiesOversees deliverables, inclusive of: style guides, asset packs and seasonal deliveries to align with business priorities, packaging and retail guidelines and subsequent approvalsEnsures that design projects align with brand guidelines, maintaining brand consistency across all touchpointsDevelops and maintains design standards and guidelines, ensuring consistency across design project and deliverables.Ensures best in class processes and fiscal responsibility across the team and organization.A people and projects leader. Looking for a seasoned people manager who can lead direct and indirect reports.Influences and inspires executives, leaders, and teams - both external and internal - across the organization.Collaborates with stakeholders to understand feedback and incorporate design principles into the design process.Cultivates effective senior level relationships with key internal and external executivesCollaborates with cross-functional teams, including studio and character art group to ensure cohesive concept and storylineProvides mentoring and coaching to team membersCurates knowledge of global market landscape and evolving industry trendsDrives new ideas on partnerships and turnkey creative solutionsPromotes collaboration, innovation, and problem-solvingContributes to the advancement of Universal’s diversity, equity, and inclusion commitments.QualificationsMinimum of 10 years’ experience working as a graphic designer (2 in a manager capacity) developing creative programs, with a focus on strategy and brand positioningExcellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. A confident and seasoned creative storytellerAbility to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced deadline driven environmentBest in class diversified portfolio. High level design expert with impeccable knowledge of craftOptimistic, with a love for creativity and partnershipHas long term and productive relationships across entertainment and creative industriesExpert level proficiency in Adobe CS, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, KeynoteBachelor’s degree preferredAdditional RequirementsHybrid: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.Salary range: $130,000 - $170,000 (Bonus Eligible)Additional InformationNBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable.If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

Job_description: Join SOM’s Year One Program as a Junior Designer - InteriorsOur Year One program picks up where your formal education leaves off, with a suite of events and creative initiatives to help you get the most out of your first year at SOM. Alongside your day-to-day project responsibilities, we’ll encourage you to expand your learning and to propose bold ideas for the future of design. SOM offers the best of both worlds: the hands-on experience of small, dynamic studios, and the resources and diversity of a global organization. Our interdisciplinary firm affords a wealth of opportunities for emerging designers; our collaborative approach means that your ideas and creativity will be valued and recognized from day one. In keeping with SOM’s reputation for innovation, our Year One program invites you to shape the future of the practice with us. Start here to dive into the profession, chart your path forward, and make your mark.At SOM, we are a collective committed to shaping a better future for our clients, communities and planet. We aspire to create the most sustainable, impactful work through creative, interdisciplinary teams with all the resources and diversity of a global firm. We value those who are passionate about excellence, innovation, integrity, inclusivity, and collaboration. Together we can achieve great things.Special Instructions For Year One ApplicantsComplete applications must include Resume or CV, Work Samples, and Statement of Intent. Work Samples shall be one PDF attachment, 10-20 pages, maximum 5 MB. The Statement of Intent shall not exceed 250 words, and should communicate your passions and interests, as well as your skills and experience. Submit Work Samples and Statement of Intent as part of your application in the section where the application asks for your Resume or CV.SOM is a global collective of talented and passionate people―help us understand what you would bring to the table. Applications that do not meet this criteria will not be reviewed.Success at SOM MeansIdeas: We believe in a meritocracy of ideas. We look to everyone to actively contribute to the discourse in the firm.Knowledge: We believe that expertise is the result of lifelong learning. We are not expected to know everything, but rather to passionately pursue answers, develop new skills and deepen our knowledge.Product: We strive for excellence in the concept, quality, and delivery of our work.Individual: We value individuals who bring the highest standards of professionalism and personal integrity in the way they work. Each person can develop and contribute their wealth of attributes, skills and knowledge to support the overall health of the firm.Team: We value the power of interdisciplinary integration. A positive team culture in which everyone collaborates openly towards common goals is essential.Firm: We have a history of making transformative contributions to the profession and our communities. We are constantly innovating and attempting to bring new approaches, solutions and processes to our work.Position ResponsibilitiesCreates and innovates with a strong conceptual design ability and integrates interdisciplinary criteria to effectively move the design of a project component(s) forward.Demonstrates a basic understanding of Interiors and Architectural building materials and finishes, building systems, specifications, current and applicable building, design and detailing standards and construction techniques. Able to enrich design concepts through technical strategies and effectively uses appropriate tools to research, design and document at all project phases.Demonstrates a basic knowledge of Interior Architecture and Architectural design including workplace planning and design concept development (hospitality and/or residential as applicable), design documentation, construction documentation, construction administration, and furniture (FF&E) and materials selection and specifications.Manages time and workload to meet project task deadlines and commitments with regular interaction and direction from project leaders.Minimum QualificationsRecent completion of a professional degree in Architecture, Interior Design or a related field.Strong collaborative ability.Effectively communicates with the project team and consultants through timely and appropriate written, oral, and visual means.Demonstrates proficiency in Revit, AutoCAD, Rhino, Enscape, VR, Adobe Suite, parametric, rendering & graphics software; proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Workspace.Actively implements BIM/CAD project standards and procedures.Are you ready to join a team of creative professionals working on transformational projects around the world? Take advantage of this exciting opportunity to build a better future with SOM.Our BenefitsHealth and Wellness: Medical, dental, vision, disability, and life & accident insuranceSavings: 401K matching, pre-tax spending accounts, and employee discount programsWork/Life Balance: Hybrid/Flexible schedules, paid family leave, paid vacation, backup child and elder care, and an employee assistance programProfessional Development: Reimbursement for professional licenses, associated renewals, and exam fees as well as specialized in-house career developmentCompensation for this role is based upon experience, qualifications, location, and education and typically ranges from $56,000 – $62,000.Our CultureOur creative, interdisciplinary teams work like small, dynamic studios, with all the resources and diversity of a global firm. Here, you’ll collaborate with industry experts on some of the most exciting and transformative architecture, engineering, and planning projects in the world.We believe an inclusive environment improves our teams, our firm, and our communities and are passionate about Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. Our DEI Action Plan was created to bring meaningful change to our profession, starting with our own culture and practices.We are proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Visit this page to learn more about SOM's employment policy and how to apply offline: www.som.com/employment_opportunities_and_policyFor more about SOM: www.som.comPortfolios must be submitted for all design positions (Architecture, Interiors, Planning, etc). Applications without work samples will not be reviewed. Portfolios should be one PDF attachment, 10-20 pages, maximum 5 MB. Submit portfolios as part of your application in the section where the application asks you for your Resume or CV.
Industries: Architecture and Planning, Civil Engineering, and Design Services

Job_description: Who We AreDudek is a leading environmental, planning, and engineering firm that help public and private clients plan, design, and build projects that improve communities’ built and natural infrastructure. Founded in 1980, Dudek has grown steadily to more than 800 professionals across the U.S. and received the Top Workplace Award for 2024.As a 100% employee-owned company, Dudek’s culture rewards smart, productive team members with ownership, professional development, and financial benefits. We seek creative, pragmatic problem-solvers working at the intersection of science, engineering, regulations, and multiple stakeholders’ interest to help clients achieve project goals.We encourage collaboration, sustainability, and innovation.At Dudek, we abide by shared values:Trust: We trust each other to use good judgment.Respect: We act professionally and treat each other fairly.Teamwork: We come together, share openly, and apply diverse perspectives.Fun: We take our work seriously…not ourselves.Well-Being: We care about each other’s health, safety, and total wellness.Our culture is the foundation of who we are and how we work.About The JobDudek is seeking an on-call graphic designer to join our team in Encinitas, CA. Our Encinitas office spans coverage and support of various clients including military, municipalities, and commercial entities both local and international. Our projects provide our clients real-world environmental and infrastructure solutions, and we are seeking a senior graphic designer to elevate our deliverables and marketing materials to meet our client’s needs. We are passionate about developing innovative solutions and are looking for a forward-thinking innovator to join our team supporting a vast array of different opportunities and assisting different project teams while enhancing your knowledge about the AEC market and our various clients.Working as part of our team, this position plays a strong supporting role for our project managers and technical professionals to take complex ideas and translate them into engaging marketing deliverables. This involves a team player that is involved with the planning, coordination, and development of a variety of deliverables to support of our clients’ needs. This ideal candidate will support these deliverables by designing and creating various types of visual aids and design elements, including maps, info graphics, presentations, advertisements, document covers, reports, brochures, organizational charts, newsletters, schematics, signs, posters, event materials, and websites and microsites. Additionally, this position may include an opportunity for other support roles.you will have the opportunity to shape.Who You AreTo thrive at Dudek, you should be comfortable with accountability, collaboration, flexibility while being a resourceful and independent thinker. We look for curious, solution-focused people who can adapt quickly to an ever-changing industry. There is no single way to solve a problem, so we encourage innovation.Duties and Responsibilities (may include some or all of the below):Assist with designing and updating education and outreach materials.Organize and process incoming data.Organize and maintain project files, documents, and deliverables.Prepare reports and other project deliverables.Assist with other project requirements.Formatting of various types of visual design in reports.Minimum RequirementsMaster’s degree or higher in science or related field.Graduate coursework in graphic design or related field.Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.Advanced skills with graphic and web design software packages including ACS (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat) and MS Office Suite.Ability to work under pressure or deadlines and handle multiple priorities.Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.Ability to adapt and shift priorities in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.Excellent analytical, verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.Flexibility to work outside normal business hours as required.* As a federal contractor, successful candidates are required to pass the following pre-employment requirements prior to beginning employment: pre - employment drug test and background check.Preferred QualificationsExperience working for the federal government is a plus, including DoD, DHS, DLA, BLM, FEMA and the EPA.Physical RequirementsWorking Conditions:This job operates in a remote or office-based environment and this role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers, etc.This job requires occasional project site visits-based outdoors which can include excessive noise, uneven walking surfaces, extreme weather, moving vehicles and equipment.Physical Requirements: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met in order to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.This job requires working on a computer, sitting or standing for long periods of time in an office or remote office setting.This job requires attending meetings, both in person and virtually as well as speaking on the phone with peers, clients, etc. Speaking, hearing and listening are required.Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Proposed Salary Range: $65-$70 hourly*Final agreed upon compensation will be based on a variety of factors including but not limited to an individual’s related experience, education, certifications, skills, and work location.Perks of Being a DudekianAt Dudek we will provide you with a competitive salary in an environment that promotes growth, career development, and a flexible work–life balance. Dudek offers an array of benefits, from medical, dental, and vision coverage, to the discretionary bonuses, based on firmwide, divisional, and individual performance.We also offer a yearly merit review, an employee stock ownership program, and dog friendly offices! To honor our key value of well-being, Dudek provides generous Paid Time Off (PTO) packages for both salaried and hourly employees. If you’re tired of an overly bureaucratic decision-making process and want to be part of a work culture that puts its employees first, speak with your recruiter to learn more about the great perks of being a Dudekian.As-needed and part-time employees are eligible for our 401(k) plan, sick leave, and our Employee Assistance Program (EAP). As-needed and part-time employees have the option of additional benefits like medical benefits and ESOP participation provided they meet minimum hours worked during the 12-month look back measurement period. Speak with your recruiter to learn more.Dudek is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by applicable law.Powered by JazzHRj0hUat1bkz

We are looking for a Graphic Design Associate to join our Creative Services team and play an important role in supporting the creative/marketing department with their day-to-day operations on a wide range of projects, including digital initiatives and printed collateral that maintain the continuity and integrity of the LA Clippers brand and its various entities including the future home of the organization opening in the Summer of 2024, Intuit Dome.Working in a hand-on environment, this role requires a strong ability to learn quickly and collaborate with others while also being able to work independently and efficiently under tight turnarounds to deliver strong, brand-aligned assets for use in marketing, social media, digital content production, in-arena and events, apparel and merchandise, and promotions.The ideal candidate will possess a keen eye for design and strong production skills. They should be a self starter, hardworking, highly organized, have outstanding time-management skills and an ability to prioritize projects and deliver assets on-time. Previous sports and entertainment experience is not required, but working understanding of the sports industry, NBA and basketball are a plus. Applications without portfolio of recent work will not be considered.This is a part-time role based out of our DTLA office and is not eligible for benefits. Anticipated schedule is 25-30 hours per week.What You Will DoWork with existing creative and deliver supporting designs, as well as execute original designs based on supporting strategy and brand guidelines.Nurture and maintain the brand identity and overall design across marketing, digital, social, in-arena, apparel, promotions, and events.Provide graphic design support for game presentation initiatives including in-arena environmental design & video board LED animations.Build various digital sponsorship graphics.Create content for the team's social media accounts.Prepare printing jobs for proofs and final outputs.Research and recommend images to use in assigned projects.Adhere to proper file management techniques to ensure efficient archiving and subsequent retrieval of projects.Report to and take direction from the Creative Director for all elements of visual identity and branding.Maintain high standards of efficiency, consistency, accuracy, creativity and timely delivery of all requests.Display keen attention to detail, spelling and grammar.Your Background, Skills And ExperienceHigh proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign and a working knowledge of the rest of CC suite of applications.Working knowledge of Adobe After Effects and experience in motion design & video editing a plus.Flexibility in handling a variety of assignments, ability to meet turnaround times, and deliver under pressure.Ability to work and communicate well with othersAbility to handle a fast paced environment.High level of personal integrity and professional ethics.Available to work evenings and weekends during NBA season; schedule is dynamic based on project needsCompensationThe hourly rate for this position is $18.00. This role is classified as part-time, temporary and is eligible for overtime pay.The LA Clippers are a proud equal opportunity employer. It is our desire and intent that all employees enjoy a professional business working environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.To view our employment privacy policy, please visit https://www.nba.com/clippers/california-employment-privacy-policy

Job DescriptionWe are on the search for a visionary Digital Design Director, someone with a passion for creating groundbreaking digital creative and engaging, artful marketing. This position demands versatility, encompassing a wide array of digital realms such as eCommerce (Shopify), email/SMS marketing, and organic + paid social media (including platforms like META, TIKTOK, and YOUTUBE). You'll be at the forefront of everything from extensive 360 digital campaigns and owned loyalty programs to engaging promotional ventures. Your role involves crafting and delivering compelling digital and editorial content for ILIA on an international stage across owned, earned and paid channels.This role is reports into the SVP, Creative, is hybrid (estimated 2-days in-person per week) and open to candidates based in Los Angeles Metropolitan area.Key Responsibilities:Design Mastery: Leverage your outstanding design skills to produce creative and visually appealing assets that embody our brand's philosophy. Your work should exhibit meticulous attention to detail and a dedication to exceptional design quality, particularly in the realm of beauty and skincare.Collaborative Conceptualization: Engage in collaborative brainstorming with the creative, social, eCommerce, UX, and technology teams to ensure your designs not only meet but surpass expectations.Digital Content Leadership: Spearhead the development of engaging digital content tailored to our audience across various digital platforms, such as social media, email, and websites, understanding the unique requirements of each.Typography and Design Passion: Show a profound commitment to typography, layout, and overall design aesthetics. Your creations should be visually striking while aligning strategically with our brand's objectives and values.Creative Collaboration and Execution: Work in close harmony with the Design and Copy teams, the Content Director, Creative Operations and the SVP of Creative to lead the design process and realize the creative vision.Social Media Creative Direction: Partner closely with the Social team in crafting compelling stories and assets for various channels, both in paid and organic channels.Leadership and Team Development: Manage and inspire a talented team of designers and editors, promoting creativity, efficiency, and professional development. Oversee the production of high-quality content for email marketing, our website, social media, and paid advertising campaigns.Art Direction and Design Management: Mentor and manage Art Directors, Designers, and Junior Designers, ensuring the highest design standards throughout all project stages.Integrated Campaign Collaboration: Actively participate in creative briefings and partner with Digital Commerce and Marketing teams to understand the needs of digital 360 campaigns, including aspects of social, website, and email design.Paid Campaign Oversight: Supervise our paid advertising campaigns, ensuring a consistent level of creative excellence while hitting key OKRs.Style Guide Development and Brand Consistency: Develop digital and email style guides, creatively addressing layout challenges while maintaining brand consistency.Cross-Functional Partnership: Work closely with Marketing and Creative teams during strategic development to ensure alignment across functions.User Experience Enhancement: Identify opportunities to enhance user experience through design, delivering a visually engaging and user-friendly interface.AI Understanding: Possess a solid comprehension of AI and its applications in design.Job requirements8-10 years of experience in 360 digital art design. Agency/In-house experience working with beauty, fashion, or wellness clients preferredYou should be deeply immersed in the world of beauty and skincare. Your passion for the industry should be evident in your work and your ability to stay ahead of trends and innovationsStrong portfolio showcasing expertise in digital design, typography, and brand development from concept to executionAdvanced knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch, Google Suite, Shopify, Klavio, Meta, TikTok, YouTubeUnderstanding of UX/UI design principlesFamiliarity with project tracking tools such as AsanaExcellent writing and communications experienceExcellent leadership and team management skillsManagement experience of teams with 3+ peopleMotion design experience is a plusWhat We Would Like To Offer...Base salary: $130,000-170,000*Bonus OpportunityHealth Benefits - 100% employer-paid medical, dental & vision coverageFlex Time Off - No cap on personal time off and paid company holidaysSeasonal Flex Days - Flexible scheduling to enjoy extra time under the sun during the Spring & Summer seasonParental Leave - Up to 18 weeks paid parental leave401(k) - Save for your future with a 401(k) with a company matchFlexibility & Wellness Stipends - Monthly stipends to support remote work & self-careHybrid Work Model - Find your flow, working from home or from one of our officesILIA Products - Quarterly stipend to replenish your favorite products and try new onesThis is the anticipated salary range for this position. The actual salary offered will carefully consider a few factors including your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.About ILIAILIA makes clean skin-centric beauty. We see skincare and makeup as one and believe that skin should look like skin. With transparency as our guide and color as our vehicle, we challenge the conventions of clean beauty to create something radically new, through safe, groundbreaking formulas that protect + revive the skin. Headquartered in Laguna Beach, California, ILIA brings together a strong group of innovative thinkers, rule-breakers and creative problem solvers. We pave the way forward as the leading clean makeup brand in what is being called the Clean Beauty Revolution. Fast paced growth provides constant learning, collaborative teamwork, and the desire to be the best at what you do. We celebrate taking risks and doing what hasn’t been done before.

About Arena ClubIf you’re looking for a place to geek out over sports cards and memorabilia, look no further. Arena Club is revolutionizing the collectibles space by creating the first-ever digital card show. Led by 5x World Series Champion Derek Jeter and serial entrepreneur Brian Lee, Arena Club has built an entirely digital marketplace, utilizing transparent authentication and grading and vaulting to share and display your cards in a personalized online showroom, no matter where you are.Exciting information regarding Arena Club's $10M Series A fundraise can be found here!About the RoleWe're on the hunt for a creative and innovative Designer to join our dynamic team at Arena Club. This role is crucial for bringing our digital marketplace to life, ensuring it's not only functional but visually stunning and user-friendly. You'll work closely with our product and engineering teams to create design solutions that enhance user experience and engagement. Your designs will be at the heart of our mission to transform the collectibles space, requiring a blend of artistic skill, technical proficiency, and a deep understanding of digital design trends. What you will do?Join our team as a Digital Designer to bring innovative designs to life in our digital marketplace. You'll craft visually stunning designs for our website, mobile apps, and promotional materials, ensuring a seamless user experience and strong brand identity. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you'll turn user feedback into actionable design improvements and play a key role in mobile app development.Basic QualificationsExperience: 2+ years in visual design, with a strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in creating graphics, layouts, and interfaces.Skills: Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), Figma.Collaboration & Communication: Excellent interpersonal skills, able to clearly articulate design concepts.Problem-Solving: Creative and strategic thinker with outstanding problem-solving abilities.Time Management: Skilled at managing multiple projects with tight deadlines.Preferred Qualifications3+ years of design experience.Advanced degree or certification in Graphic Design, UX/UI Design, or related fields.Experience in mobile app design for iOS and Android platforms.Deep knowledge of UX/UI principles, including user-centered design, wireframing, prototyping, and usability testing.Advanced skills in design software and knowledge of web and mobile app development technologies. Familiarity with motion design software is a plus.Proven leadership and project management skills, capable of leading design projects from start to finish.Interest in sports, collectibles, or digital marketplaces, with knowledge of current trends and technologies in these sectors.Please include your design portfolio with your application.

Collaborate on design projects and provide input on creative direction.Minimum QualificationsProven experience as a Graphic Designer, preferably in a product design or cosmetic industry setting.Proficiency in design software and tools.Strong creative and artistic skills.Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.Knowledge of licensing and branding is a plus.A strong portfolio showcasing a diverse range of design work.

Crooked believes that we need a better conversation about politics, culture, and the world around us—one that doesn't just focus on what's broken, but what we can do to fix it. We are a media network that showcases stories, voices, and opportunities for activism that inform, entertain, and inspire action, because it's up to all of us to do our part to build a better world.Job Summary:A Senior Designer at Crooked Media has strong design skills, produces high caliber design work and is a leader amongst the design team who provides direction for junior design staff. A Senior Designer reports to the Art Director andbut is able to work autonomously, making informed design decisions without significant oversight. They are able to handle projects from conception through completion, and can effectively present their work to stakeholders. They have a knowledge of politics and current events that informs their design decisions.Crooked is moving towards a hybrid work model for our entire staff. Ideally looking for Los Angeles based candidates, or candidates willing to relocate within the first 3 months of accepting an offer.How You'll Spend Your Time:Produce best-in-class design work across a range of mediums (show logos, merchandise, website graphics, social assets, email/newsletter, live shows and more)Provide UX and UI expertise for digital products. Work with agencies to ensure UX and UI best practices are metPresent work effectively to project stakeholdersManage a complex schedule and workloadProvide direction for junior designersMake informed design decisions without significant guidanceLead medium sized projects autonomously, from idea generation through post-mortemHelp evolve and define brand assets and guidelinesProvide production support when needed (sourcing and retouching photos, resizing assets)Distill market trends and internet literacy into impactful visualsWhat You'll Bring To The Table:5+ years of experience and an aptitude for leadershipStrong knowledge of color, typography, design and graphic principlesA passion for art, advertising, design, culture and trendsGood organizational skills and an awareness of deadlinesA willingness to accept and respond to feedbackAn interest in politicsStrong conceptual and critical thinking skillsBachelor's Degree in graphic design or a related discipline preferredA working knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator and After Effects specifically)Working knowledge of Keynote, Google Drive - Docs, Sheets, SlidesWorking knowledge of project management and communication tools such as Slack, Asana, Monday, Google suiteEffective collaborator with a track record of cross-functional success.Bonus but not necessary: Working knowledge of motion design.Pay and Perks:At Crooked, we believe in paying employees at or above market rates that are informed by salary surveys and industry benchmarks. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer full-time employees excellent benefits including:Paid healthcare401k matchGenerous vacation16 weeks of paid parental leaveA discretionary year-end bonusDid we also mention our offices are closed at the end of the year?When we open up a position, we conduct a market analysis to ensure we have the most up-to-date data. Once we're ready to extend an offer, we look at the individual's years of relevant experience and other compensable factors to determine a competitive offer. And for this role, the starting salary range is $85,000 - $95,000.About UsWe welcome everyone—as an inclusive workplace, we invite all our employees to bring their authentic, whole selves to work. Our mission and intent is to encourage people from every nation, race/ethnicity, belief, gender, gender identity, sexual identity, disability, and culture to feel respected and valued for their unique contributions to our company.We approach our work courageously, adapt and improve constantly, and celebrate the wins big and small. We cultivate a culture of creativity and expression at Crooked Media. We hire the best talent, ensure they have the tools and training they need, and set them free. If you have a high degree of ownership and are driven to excel, you'll fit right in.That's it. End of mission.

Join SOM’s Year One Program as a Junior Designer - ArchitectureOur Year One program picks up where your formal education leaves off, with a suite of events and creative initiatives to help you get the most out of your first year at SOM. Alongside your day-to-day project responsibilities, we’ll encourage you to expand your learning and to propose bold ideas for the future of design. SOM offers the best of both worlds: the hands-on experience of small, dynamic studios, and the resources and diversity of a global organization. Our interdisciplinary firm affords a wealth of opportunities for emerging designers; our collaborative approach means that your ideas and creativity will be valued and recognized from day one. In keeping with SOM’s reputation for innovation, our Year One program invites you to shape the future of the practice with us. Start here to dive into the profession, chart your path forward, and make your mark.At SOM, we are a collective committed to shaping a better future for our clients, communities and planet. Job_description: WHO WE ARE:Fiercely independent. Passionately creative. Fueled by data.Ayzenberg Group, based in Pasadena, CA, is one of the largest, privately held advertising and media companies on the West Coast. A culture of curiosity, we're filled with player/coaches who care about the work from the top down, and team members with an entrepreneurial mindset. We are an equal opportunity employer."Okay, nice jargon, but what does that actually mean?" Good question.Basically, we believe we can do the best work possible, while still being kind and respectful to everyone involved.We strive to macro (not micro) manage and give all team members the support and freedom they need to thrive—both professionally and personally.In a nutshell, whether you're a client or a team member, we want you to love it here.WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR:Ayzenberg is looking for an Associate Creative Director who will be the day-to-day creative lead on a social team for one of our global gaming brand clients.You are smart, genuine, and play well with others in a highly collaborative team environment. You get excited about gaming, and love talking about what’s here, what’s next, and how it drives culture. You love Social, and you live and breathe the culture of social media and the internet.Specifically, you thrive at the intersection of gaming & social media - and consider yourself fluent in the language of live service MOBA and FPS games and the competitive, creator, and fan cultures that surround these games. You understand the cultural intricacies of each social platform, and can code switch across what works best on X, IG, TikTok, and everything in between.As the day-to-day creative lead on the account, you will be both supported by and constantly collaborating with a dedicated team of copywriters, art directors, designers, and engagement managers. Your job will be to inspire them to create best-in-class social creative every single day. This means you will be leading brainstorming sessions, inspiring the team with smart and relevant trends and references across the internet, giving feedback to craft ideas, presenting to clients, and sometimes rolling up your sleeves as a maker yourself.***PLEASE NOTE: To start with, this is an ongoing FREELANCE ROLE, with full-time hours, and with the intention of converting to a full-time employee assuming it's a great fit on both sides.The day-to-day:You are an expert in live service MOBA and FPS games. This means you play the games and understand what makes them special, and what keeps their players engaged.You will concept, design, and craft visual stories and assets that bring these games to life on social, unfold across platforms, and achieve strategic goals.You will stay connected to gaming (with a focus on this client), esports, creator culture, and all the latest things going on in the industry, promoting engagement with fans about what they are excited about now, and what’s coming next.You are comfortable concepting for screens of all shapes and sizes and brainstorming with your team about great content and great campaigns.You will lead the creative team on specific projects - across both evergreen social, in the moment trend based work, and larger campaigns - crafting a deck narrative, working with strategists and collaborating on briefs, inspiring the team, and driving the creative to be the best in the industry.You thrive on collaboration and yet still want to own it whenever possible.Your presentation skills are on point. You know how to work the room (or a conference call) and can inspire clients to take necessary and insight-driven risks.You embody transparency, respect, and collaboration. You understand how to thrive within a creative team and mentor junior staff.You’ll partner with your team to ensure all content is on voice, on brand, and as compelling as possible.You have a strong sense of accountability. You deliver on your promises and take responsibility for your actions. You work with producers and PMs to make sure work keeps getting done in an always-on environment, yet protective so that no team member is getting overwhelmed (including yourself!).You grasp the big picture, but your attention to detail is an even greater strength.You’re calm and collected in stressful situations and amidst strict deadlines.WHAT WE'LL (FOR SURE) BRING TO THE TABLE:A super competitive salary and amazing benefits and perks package, including full medical, dental, and visionA matching 401(k)Paid maternity/paternity leavePet insuranceMonthly wellness benefits (to spend however you like on your own well-being!)Annual education credit (for anything from Masterclass, to LinkedIn certifications, to a cooking or tango class -- have fun with it!)Unlimited PTO and paid holidaysA supportive, fun, and respectful team environmentWHAT YOU'LL (IDEALLY) BRING TO THE TABLE:6-7+ years of experience (3+ at an advertising/marketing/entertainment agency).You are a master of bringing brand style through to exciting concepts and assets using mood-boards, deck design, and original comps to bring your thinking to life.Great portfolio of social creative in gaming. You consider yourself social-first in your thinking.You’re proud of your bookmarks and favorites. They’re overflowing with content you love and want to reference and share with others. And specifically, you know why you like it and what makes it work.Technical knowledge and understanding of social media platforms, what works, and how to design for greatest impact - with a special emphasis on the distinct cultures, audiences, and voices of the different social platforms.Exceptional written and communication skills. You know how to solicit meaningful answers from clients as much as you know how to give actionable feedback to someone on your team.Desire to learn, grow, teach and contribute in a creative environment.Familiarity and/or experience with content creation for social. Ideally, you have your own personal accounts and know what it takes to make great content. This means you’re not afraid to shoot some photos, or some video, or record some VO, or capture some content at an event.Excellent presentation/communication skills both verbally and in writing.Ability to work well both independently and as part of a team.Enjoy video games and understand how the gaming community thrives and drives culture on social media. You are a player of live service MOBA and FPS games yourself, probably addicted to grinding ranked. You trash talk with your friends, and know how to dish it on social.Proven time management and organizational skills.Previous experience with social media management is a big plus.Bachelor’s degree preferred in graphic design related field. So, if you've read this far and have that butterflies in your stomach feeling, send us your resume, we'd love to hear from you.So, if you've read this far and have that butterflies in your stomach feeling, send us your resume, we'd love to hear from you.
Industries: Advertising Services, Marketing Services, and Computer Games

Job_description: Who We Are: At Huda Beauty, our Vision is to lead in creating a democratized beauty industry where power is given back to people to define, create, and enjoy beauty for themselves! Launched by award-winning beauty powerhouse Huda Kattan in 2013, Huda Beauty is one of the world’s fastest growing beauty brands. As a company, we are fueled by purpose which allows us to approach things differently so that we can create products, content, and a community like no other. A lot has changed since our launch in 2013, but something that will forever remain at the core of Huda Beauty is our focus on business excellence and our unwavering passion for kindness!Summary: Huda Beauty is looking to hire a talented and detailed oriented Visual Merchandising Coordinator, based in our Los Angeles office with a hybrid work schedule. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, enthusiastic, and will play a starring role in helping with project management, implementing strategies and workflows, with a specialized focus on graphics.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesKeep the Project Tracker up-to-date with management of ongoing product launches & hard deadlines, flagging to the team if anything is at risk of being on time.Upload & organize our internal digital filing system for VMEngage actively in meetings and calls; ensuring timely graphic and fixture delivers to stores w/ consistent communication with applicable vendorsAlign creative endeavors with the brand's vision and maintain our creative asset treasuryDesign and produce store graphics, ensuring they’re aligned with Huda Beauty’s & Kayali’s branding, as well as creating clear digital presentations to gain edits and/or approvals by various teirs for approvals.Assist in designing renderings for Huda Gondola and/or Kayali Fragrance presentations, including product and graphic placement.Manage financial documents in partnership with our finance team & input/update numbers into the Budget Tracker in a timely manner, in partnership with the Senior Manager, VM.Assist in maintaining & updating the office’s Huda Gondola and/or Kayali Fragrance display.Requirements2-3 years in a similar role within a Marketing or Visual Merchandising capacityDesire to be on a Visual Merchandising team & openness to gain more knowledge & grow your careerProject management experience & a self-starterPresentation skills & clean digital presentationIntermediate to highly skilled in Adobe Acrobat, Illustrator, InDesign & PhotoshopExcellent attention to detail & communication skills for liaising with internal & external stakeholdersProduction knowledge for print projects including; materials & creating print ready files w/ Die LinesA portfolio, or samples of work, with design examples is requiredOur Benefits & PerksMonthly “Self-Love Days” – at company discretion401(k) matching contributionsPremium Medical/Dental/Vision coverage for employee plus dependentsMonthly coaching sessions with our in-house Success CoachEmployee discounts on all Huda Beauty, Wishful, and Kayali productsHybrid working schedules (home & office)Quarterly product giftingThe pay range for this role is $65,000 per year. Individual compensation will be commensurate with the candidates' relevant work experience, skills, qualifications, and location.Huda Beauty is committed to building diverse and inclusive teams and upholding an equal employment workplace that is free from discrimination. We hire stellar individuals regardless of their race, color, ancestry, religion, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, medical conditions, disability, or veteran status. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

The successful candidate will take projects from concept through final delivery with oversight from Design Manager. The ideal candidate has 1-3 years of design experience. The company offers a great work environment.Graphic Designer Pay And BenefitsHourly pay: $30/hrWorksite: Leading enterprise software solutions company (Pleasanton, CA 94588 - Hybrid)W2 Employment, Group Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Retirement Savings Program, PSL40 hours/week, 9 Month AssignmentGraphic Designer ResponsibilitiesFollow branding guidelines and effectively communicate design decisions.Enhance and edit PowerPoint presentations created by Instructional Designers for video offerings.Design a variety of projects including graphics for video training, presentations, email marketing, info-graphics, icons and logos.Take projects from concept through final delivery with oversight from the Design Manager.Efficiently handle workload, interact with stakeholders, communicate project status, receive feedback and adhere to tight deadlines.Graphic Designer Qualifications1-3 years of design experience.Degree in Graphic Design or Related Field.Excellent graphic design, visualization, typographic, production and personal management skills.A collaborative and creative attitude.Strong communication skills, both written and oral.Ability to think independently, problem-solve, and brainstorm creative solutions.Thrive and multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud applications such as Photoshop and Illustrator.Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint (templates, animations).Adobe After Effects skills a plus.Articulate Rise skills a plus.

Job_title: Associate Art Director, Old Navy Photo Studio
Job_description: About Old NavyForget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, you’re choosing a different path. From day one, we’ve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season.We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, we’re family.About The RoleAs the Associate Art Director, through close collaboration with our Studio Creative Director and our San Francisco studio team, you will be responsible for the daily delivery and execution of on-brand, market leading imagery that both pushes boundaries in terms of creative execution and adheres to seasonal e-commerce creative direction and guidelines.We are looking for an Associate Art Director with a proven record in leading studio based photoshoots at the highest caliber. A true visionary, willing to drive creative output and elevate the on-set Art Direction for PPOF (E-commerce) for Old Navy.What You'll DoLead on-set art direction of our daily e-commerce photography shoots (PPOF)Ensure our visual brand strategy and creative guidelines are interpreted in our daily photoshootsCollaborate and drive effective communication with on-set photographers, stylists, hair and makeup artists and digital technicians to create shoots that are both on brand.Edit daily photoshoots with on-set teams to ensure lighting and tonal consistencyProvide clearly notated PDF of shoot edits daily, complete with retouching notes for Digital ArtistsWork alongside our studio Creative Director to inspire, influence and evolve our imagery for Old NavyEnsure that product photography runs smoothly and efficiently and reaching daily shot count.Collaborate with Studio Creative Director to support on the creation of seasonal guidelines for on figure and lay-down product photographyDaily quality control check-ins with Brand AD on all operating sets, when neededAssist on marketing style shoots and content when requiredPartner with production on planning shoots, bringing in new talent and sourcing new talent.Who You Are3 years of studio art direction and/or creative direction experienceBA or BFA preferred in Arts, Fine Arts or Graphic DesignExpert knowledge of Adobe Creative SuiteDeep knowledge in on-figure site photography, motion and studio creativeExperience in directing photoshoot teams in an e-commerce environmentOperates with an elevated taste level and all round passion for fashion and imageryUnderstanding of current industry related trendsGoal oriented, with demonstrated success in managing through ambiguity and change in a fast-paced, complex environmentStrong critical-thinking, problem-solving and strategic-thinking skillsEstablished skillset in relationship-building, presentation, and communication (written and verbal); Demonstrated ability to collaborate and work with a variety of people in various disciplinesBenefits at Old NavyMerchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*See more of the benefits we offer.For eligible employeesGap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. In 2022, we were recognized by Forbes as one of the World's Best Employers and one of the Best Employers for Diversity.Salary Range: $140,700 - $186,400 USDEmployee pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level, competencies and work location. We will meet minimum wage or minimum of the pay range (whichever is higher) based on city, county and state requirements.US CandidatesPlease note that effective, June 30, 2022, Gap Inc. will no longer require any of its employees to wear face masks or require proof of COVID vaccination, unless required by local or state/provincial mandates or as part of Gap Inc’s quarantine guidelines after being exposed to or testing positive for COVID. Therefore, please disregard any language in any job posting that refers to Gap Inc.’s face mask and proof of vaccination policy as said policy is no longer effective.

About GeneoHealth & beauty – it's in our DNA. Born out of two great companies, the name Geneo is inspired by its root word "gene," paying homage to the parent company Lumenis, experts in aesthetics technology, and the developers Pollogen, innovators in skincare, who together created the perfect balance of science and artistry in Geneo.About Glo2FacialGlo2Facial is a breakthrough treatment that unlocks the body’s natural superpowers: Oxfoliate™ with O2 bubbles, amplify with LUX via our lite ultrasound experience, and detox via lymphatic massage. The results are clean, calm, naturally hydrated skin which we call rebalanced beauty. See why this is the gateway to extraordinary outcomes for your skin… and your life. With seven customizations available, there is a solution for all your skin care needs. You’ll know it when you feel it.We're on the lookout for a Digital Media Designer with a sharp eye for design aesthetics, dedicated to ensuring that every detail meets our exacting standards of excellence. In this role, you'll be responsible for executing a diverse array of creative projects. Your tasks will include ideating imaginative concepts and crafting high-quality deliverables that consistently surpass expectations. Through seamless teamwork and clear communication, you'll play a crucial role in bringing our vision to fruition.This is a full-time, in-person, position based in Newport Beach, CA. Please do not apply if you are seeking a remote position.WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS JOBAs an Adobe Creative Suite Virtuoso, you will be wielding Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro, and After Effects to craft visually stunning content aligned with our brand's aesthetic and messaging.Embrace your role as a Creative Maverick, pushing boundaries with exceptional creativity and out-of-the-box thinking to refine every idea to meet our standards of innovation and excellence.Thrive as a Deadline Dynamo, managing your time with multiple projects and resources with precision to deliver high-quality work on schedule, never compromising our standards.Fostering communication skills as a Collaboration Catalyst, ensuring all team member's contributions are valued and integrated into impactful campaigns.With your discerning eye for design aesthetics, scrutinize every detail as a Design Perfectionist, ensuring every aspect of your work aligns perfectly with our vision and standards of excellence.You'll be part of a dynamic, supportive team in a fast-paced but incredibly rewarding environment, where you'll have ample development opportunities for your long-term career goals.Join us on this exciting journey with our unicorn company, one of those well-funded startups everyone wishes they could find.What You Will Be DoingCraft visually stunning and effective digital paid ads tailored specifically for social media platforms, strategically promoting Geneo and Glo2Facial products and treatments to maximize engagement and conversion rates.Bring the brands' DNA and messaging to life through compelling graphics, animations, and videos, ensuring every piece of content resonates with our target audience and drives brand awareness and loyalty.Collaborate closely with the marketing team to gain a deep understanding of project requirements and objectives, fostering synergy to deliver content that exceeds expectations and achieves desired outcomes.Stay at the forefront of industry trends, design tools, and social media platform updates, leveraging this knowledge to continuously elevate our content, keeping it cutting-edge, relevant, and highly impactful.Master the art of managing multiple projects simultaneously, executing with precision and agility to consistently deliver high-quality work within tight deadlines, maintaining brand integrity and excellence across all campaigns.Actively contribute creative input and participate in brainstorming sessions, leveraging your expertise to generate innovative ideas and strategies that drive the success of our marketing initiatives and propel the brands forward.What Are Your X-factorsDemonstrated expertise as a Graphic Artist, underscored by a compelling portfolio highlighting digital advertising campaigns, ideally within the health and beauty sector.Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, Multimedia Arts, or commensurate practical experience.At least 5 years of hands-on experience in graphic design and video editing, preferably within a marketing or advertising context.Mastery of the Adobe Creative Suite, encompassing Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro, and After Effects.Profound proficiency in video editing, adept at crafting captivating content that resonates deeply with our target demographic.Unparalleled creativity and a penchant for innovative thinking.Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, consistently meeting deadlines with precision.Superlative communication and collaborative skills.Meticulous attention to detail, coupled with a discerning eye for design aesthetics.All applicants must submit a portfolio of creative work (PDF or link.)Join the Leaders in the Next Evolution of Skincare!Here are some amazing benefits we extend to our Geneo employees. We proudly offer full health benefits, that’s medical, dental, vision, FSAs, and HSAs. We also provide Basic Life/AD&D and Long-Term Disability coverage at no cost to you! Top these benefits off with a 401(K) plan with an employer match & monthly facials!Geneo is a team that expects breakthrough outcomes from yourself and others, we strive to accelerate success for our customers and employees and is committed to excellence in everything we do.Extraordinary people play here. Come GLO with us!(Base Salary Pay: $80,000.00-$90,000.00)Experience counts, attitude matters. The range listed is just one component of Geneo’s total rewards package for our employees. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, paid time off, and region-specific benefits. An employee’s pay position within the listed salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, travel requirements, revenue-based metrics, any contractual agreements, and business or organizational needs.The job description outlined above reflects general details as necessary to describe the primary functions of this job, the level of knowledge and skill typically required, but should not be construed as an all-inclusive listing of work requirements. Individuals may be asked to perform duties other than those mentioned above in order to cover absences or relief in the appropriate department to equalize peak work periods or otherwise balance the workload.Geneo extends kindness to everyone, all the time. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability, gender identity, and sexual orientation.

About UsRapt is an award-winning design and strategy studio that helps leading brands navigate the complex challenges of this ever-changing world. With locations in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and New York — and with clients spanning the globe — we bring fresh thinking and a highly customized approach to each and every partnership. Our interdisciplinary teams blend architecture, interior design, brand experience, graphic design, and strategic thinking into holistic solutions that further our clients’ missions. Our agile approach earned us the distinction of being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies.We’re embracing the future of work with a hybrid approach. We spend 3 days in the studio each week as a team, and we also have days where we work from home. Ultimately, we trust our staff to know how and where they will do their best work.About The RoleAt Rapt Studio, Project Designers work on multiple projects of varying types and scales while maintaining a keen eye for both design and detail.They’re at the core of the work we do. With dedication and hard work, they have the potential to grow quickly and become a big part of our creative process and output. We’re looking for someone who’s a strong conceptual thinker, visualizer, and designer.Qualifications:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture or Interior Design4-8+ years of experience working at an architecture or design studioExperience working with project teams from concept design through constructionProficiency with Revit, AutoCAD, SketchUp, Microsoft Office, and Adobe Creative SuiteFamiliarity with project management, construction administration, budget review, building codes, consultant coordination, and client relationsAbility to develop construction documents for reviewAbility to work with furniture vendors to manage process and deliveriesProficiency and interest in 3D visualizationState licensure or pursuance of state licensure is encouragedWe’re looking for:A collaborative individual who isn’t afraid to think outside the boxA team player with a positive attitude who’s enthusiastic about tackling the unexpected and unknownA creative person with strong graphic, organizational, and communication skillsA conceptual thinker who’s always seeking inspirationA person in active pursuit of mentorship and development, willing to take the first step or the first pass at a problem and seeking review and guidance afterwardCompensation is based on relevant experience and qualifications. Salary for this role is estimated between $75,000 to $100,000 plus benefits and bonuses.Benefits and Perks:Generous options for medical, dental, vision insuranceLocation flexibility and unlimited paid time off (PTO)Tax-deferred savings through FSA, parking and transit allocations401K with employer contributionComplimentary One Medical membershipsNew hire referral bonus

Job_description: Company DescriptionVuori is re-defining what athletic apparel looks like: built to move and sweat in but designed with a casual aesthetic to transition into everyday life. We draw inspiration from an active coastal California lifestyle; an integration of fitness, creative expression and life. Our high energy fast paced retail environment is reflected in the clothes we make. We aim to inspire others to take on all aspects of their lives with clarity, enthusiasm and purpose…while having a lot of fun along the way. We are proud to be an outlet for opportunity and for personal growth and success.Job DescriptionWe are seeking an Assistant Designer to support the development & execution of the Vuori Men’s product assortment. This individual will be responsible for aiding in the design process including but not limited to concept, research, design, tech pack creation, BOM development, fabric selection, trim selection, fitting, and finessing product. To be effective in this role, the individual must be eager to learn and support the team in any way needed, have an eye for elevated design, and have a basic understanding of Vuori aesthetics. We are looking for someone who is passionate about the performance apparel space, Vuori’s mission and will embody the brand’s values.Ability to successfully work in a team environment.A self-starter with the ability to anticipate team needs.Execute specific design development projects as assigned by the designer. Graphic design experience is a plus.Attend and assist in fittings, taking notes as needed.Ability to own lab dip requests, comment communication and tracking.Owns all departmental requests including but not limited to, tailoring requests, fabric briefs, mill sheets, new and existing trims.Support men’s design team with seasonal tech pack creation & updates.Aid in visual process, owning comments on prototypes and seasonal submits.Responsible for meeting deadlines and staying organized.Basic level technical knowledge Men’s apparel and accessory constructions.Ability to sketch or to communicate design ideas via Adobe Suite.Ability to respond to business objectives with creative, innovative, and cost-effective design solutions.Create designs that support line plans, assortment strategies, and brand initiatives, through the Vuori filters.Support design team for seasonal product presentations & sales meetings.Responsible for general assortment updates for all tools.Act as cross departmental liaison, creating a consistent flow of communication throughout the organization.QualificationsBachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.0-2 year product development or design experience.Graphic Design experience a plus.Excellent communication skills - written and verbal.Strong understanding of apparel market and trends.Working knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft PowerPoint, Office and Excel.Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.Must live in the San Diego area or be willing to relocate.Additional InformationPay: from $60,000 - $70,000Benefits:Health InsurancePaid Time OffEmployee Discount401(k)All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Company: SFMOMA San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
Job_description: The San Francisco Museum of Modern Art is one of the largest museums of modern and contemporary art in the United States and a thriving cultural center for the Bay Area. We cannot imagine life without art; it inspires and connects us every day. Now more than ever, these connections matter and are aligned with our values.Inclusive: We strive to be a museum of many voices in dialogue.Passionate: We believe working with art is more than a job or trusteeship - it's a way of life.Brave: We are committed to approaching our work with courage and a sense of adventure.Empathic: We aim to act like a person, not an institution.SFMOMA is a place for the infinitely curious to explore, support, and experience the art of our time. We believe that modern and contemporary art can influence the way we think, view the world, and embrace the many voices and perspectives around us. We aspire to foster an environment that elicits joy, nurtures a sense of belonging and purpose—where difference is seen as a strength, and every one is appreciated for their whole self.SCHEDULE: Full Time, 35 hours/week, June 10 - August 16, 2024Department DescriptionThe SFMOMA Design Studio helps to translate the vision of our institution into a vibrant, cohesive, and welcoming brand and experience. The Graphic Design team within the Design Studio is responsible for all visual communication for the museum, both print and digital, including branding, exhibition graphics, publications, sfmoma.org, digital screens, and more. The department plays an integral role in content strategy and communicating the museum’s voice to onsite and offsite visitors.Position DescriptionThe Design Studio: Graphic Design Intern will work closely with the Senior Graphic Designer and other members of the Design Studio team on a wide range of projects. Projects may include brand system studies, museum signage initiatives, store product collaborations, social media efforts, website design, building and organizing a material library, and assisting on current and future exhibition materials. Through these projects the Graphic Design Intern will get hands-on experience scheduling, producing, delivering, and installing graphics for exhibitions, as well graphic design support on museum-wide projects. The Graphic Design Intern will be someone who loves a challenge, is an enthusiastic learner, has an eye for detail, and is both self-motivated and works well in a team.PROJECT PLANInterns will be given a project plan at the start of their internship that outlines several projects to be completed over the course of the summer. These projects will expose Interns to the breadth of work we do in the Design Studio and be tied to initiatives our team is working on over the summer.EDUCATIONAL OBJECTIVESSkills gained: Studio experience working on an in-house team, knowledge of the inner workings of a world class arts institution, various production methods including printing and prepress, web and email production, large scale vinyl graphics, etcTransferable Skills: Studio experience, content strategy, design critiques, project management, production experienceJobs this internship prepares someone for: a junior designer or designer position in a design studio or on an in-house design teamQualifications & SkillsMust be a current student or recent graduate with a focus in graphic design or a similar field. SFMOMA recognizes a graduation date within 6 months of the internship start date as a recent graduateHighly proficient in Adobe Creative SuiteKnowledge of Figma and digital design a plusKeen sense of typographyAbility to clearly communicate and present ideas and designs, set priorities and meet deadlinesHighly organized with great attention to detailSelf starter**Current SFMOMA employees are not eligible to apply for the Summer 2024 internship.**Application RequirementsCompleted application via SFMOMA's job siteResumeCover letter stating the specific internship of interest. As a part of our commitment to health and safety, COVID-19 vaccination is required for all current and newly hired employees and contractors.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.SFMOMA is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility. Company StoryFamily owned and operated, Ohana Cannabis Co. was established as a Corporation in 2014. Ohana Cannabis Co. is built from a passion to bring Cannabis therapy to the forefront of mainstream retail. We strive to reduce the negative stereotypes associated with Cannabis consumption by building strong, educated, responsible, productive and purpose driven leaders who love to help people get back to looking good and feeling good via the power of plant medicine, healthy lifestyle habits and 5-star customer service. Fast forward to 2020 and not only are we one of the premier, vertically-integrated, cannabis brands in the largest global cannabis market, we are also in the midst of statewide and nationwide expansion with our retail presence currently spanning across Sacramento, Emeryville, San Francisco, Oakland, Los Angeles, Long Beach, San Diego, Palm Springs, and New York.This is an opportunity to get involved on the ground floor with a premier company that is pioneering the modern age of cannabis. If you have a passion for producing modern creative and are an effective Leader, then we have a once in a lifetime opportunity for you as we are currently seeking a proficient Graphic Design & Marketing Specialist to join our strong, positive, passionate, solution oriented and thriving team.Get in touch today for more information and to arrange an interview immediately.Brief Job DescriptionThis full-time Graphic Design and Marketing Specialist will create and produces compelling design collateral and digital content that effectively communicates the work of Ohana Cannabis Co. You must understand marketing fundamentals and collaborate effectively while successfully managing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.RequirementsEducation - Bachelor’s degree in design, advertising, marketing, business or related field of study.Minimum 3 years of related design experience, preferably in a corporate communications setting.Strong project management experience preferred.Ability to create and manage a range of document and presentation templates.Ability to precisely control and interpret information flow between team members.Ability to work in a deadline-orientated environment without compromising artistic creativity.Ability to work within corporate brand guidelines.Knowledge OfPrinciples, practices, and techniques of graphic design, marketing, communications and public information including line, form, scale, and color.Principles and practices of public and community relations and print and electronic media, and video.Theories and techniques of design, marketing, expository writing, and editing.Principles, theories, and applications of design, graphics, reproduction, digital publishing, web publishing, photography and video production processes, and commonly used social media.Web design and basic HTML programming.Standard office practices and procedures.Filing and maintaining digital archives.Commonly used graphic design and desktop publishing software such as Adobe Creative Cloud programs.InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat as well as other related computer applications.Current graphic design and desktop publishing technology.Digital photography techniques.About Ohana Cannabis Co.At Ohana Cannabis Co. we truly believe in customer care and thus do our absolute best to bring our guests an unmatched 5 Star experience at all times. We aim to help our guests find true wellness by building authentic relationships and offering an array of different cannabis, nutrition and healthy lifestyle solutions. As a Collective and as a family, we believe in the theory that a happy body, spirit and mind equates to a happy life. Thank you so much for your interest in joining our strong, positive, passionate, solution oriented and thriving team. We look forward to the possibility of establishing a strong, loyal, long term and prosperous Partnership with you that positively impacts and elevates millions!
