Healthcare needs good data. At PicnicHealth, we are building deep observational and real-world outcome datasets that fuel cutting-edge research while giving patients control of their own medical record data. These complete, clinically-rich datasets produce unique insights — across dozens of diseases — to ultimately get the right treatments into patients’ hands faster. We do this by working directly with patients and leveraging state of the art machine learning to transform messy medical records into structured, research-ready datasets as a part of a large spectrum of observational studies and drug and disease registries. To date we’ve helped tens of thousands of patients securely access their records and proactively contribute to advancing research in diseases that impact their lives.Founded in 2014, PicnicHealth partners with 12 of the top 20 biopharma companies and we have raised over $100 million in venture capital from investors including Amplify Partners, Felicis Ventures and B Capital Group.And we are just getting started! If you are looking to join an award winning, mission-driven, motivated team that is making a real impact across millions of people’s lives, PicnicHealth might just be the place for you.The OpportunityAt PicnicHealth, we are committed to crafting the experiences that make clinical research efficient, effective, and patient-centered. We care deeply about design – both how it works and how it looks. We are looking for a human-centered Product Designer who is passionate about shaping the product strategy and experience in support of our ambitious mission.In this role, you will drive discovery, research, and design initiatives to enable streamlined configuration for complex clinical studies, an exciting new area that is crucial to our business success. You will have the unique challenge of working on a complex system that bridges the gap between internal systems and external user experiences, demanding a blend of technical acumen and human-centered design thinking. Moreover, this role offers the enriching experience of mentoring junior designers, allowing you to directly influence and shape the design culture within our organization. Your contributions will be key in driving innovation and efficiency in the critical field of clinical research, making this position ideal for those who aspire to make a significant impact in both the product and the lives it touches.Most importantly, you will be working in an environment where your ownership scales with your ambition and your team carves out space to support your growth at PicnicHealth (and beyond!).As a Product Designer, you will: - Craft user flows and experiences that makes clinical studies configuration intuitive and efficient. Deliver high-quality designs, interactions, and prototypes to align teams around your vision. Come up with features and improvements that ship quickly and with high quality. - Navigate an ambiguous space by advocating for users’ and the business’s needs. Bring clarity and purpose to the team you collaborate with via creative storytelling and applying design thinking. - Proactively collaborate with internal stakeholders to drive projects forward. Effectively communicate design decisions with creative, strategic, and business reasonings. - Contribute to building a world-class design team, by helping attract, interview, and onboard your future team members during this exciting time of growth. - Contribute to the overall product and design direction of the whole company.You are a strong candidate if you have: - 5+ years of experience leading and designing interactive applications - Excellent visual design, interaction design, and product thinking skills - An impressive portfolio that highlights your diverse design skill set, and a deep understanding for human-centered design practice. - Ability to proactively identify constraints and collaborate cross-functionally to come up with and implement creative solutions. - Experience in designing complex pro-applications or internal tools. Unique viewpoints on design tools, mapping / labeling software, and graphics applications that add something new to the team. - Passion about improving the lives of patients by making a difference in improving clinical research & healthcare outcomes.We expect all team members to be motivated to be amazing in their roles and, ultimately, to move the PicnicHealth mission forward.Perks & Benefits @PicnicHealthAt PicnicHealth you get to solve real problems with real solutions, great tech, and great people. We look to attract and retain exceptional performers through a mission that matters, a culture that allows team members to do their best work and be their real selves, and through competitive compensation and benefits packages aligned to the market and our Core Values.We’re a remote first company, with teammates spread across the US. We support in-person gatherings, including co-working spaces and multi-day onsites, to build connections and move forward strategic initiatives. Expect to travel 2-4 times a year. For our team members in the Bay Area, who prefer to work in person we can offer a hybrid set up to work from the SF office on a flexible schedule.Target Base Salary Range: $140K-$180KThe base salary PicnicHealth offers may vary depending upon the ultimate scope and responsibilities of the position and on the candidate’s job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total package will include equity, in addition to a full range of medical and/or other benefits, depending on the position offered. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.You also get: - Comprehensive benefits including above market Health, Dental, Vision - Family friendly environment - Flexible time off - 401k plan - Free PicnicHealth account - Equipment and internet funds for home office set up - Wellness StipendEqual Opportunity StatementPicnicHealth is committed to promoting an inclusive work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We value a diverse and balanced team where everyone can belong.

boards, color palettes, and design presentations for design reviews and approvals.·        Contribute to developing sample garments, including patternmaking.·        Participate in fittings and achieves.·        Assist the Creative Director in tasks assigned to them.Requirements/Qualifications·        Bachelor's degree in Fashion design, textile, fine arts, merchandising, or related skills.·        Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.·        Ability to meet multiple deadlines.·        Strong knowledge of fashion design/industrial product or industrial At Meta, we’re shaping innovative experiences in service of giving people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Our multidisciplinary design teams are creating new ways to help people connect, find communities and grow businesses. Together, we are committed to building innovative technologies — Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Workplace, Meta Quest and more — to serve billions of people around the globe.As a motion designer at Meta, you’ll have the opportunity to play a central role in the way we build technologies — ensuring they are valuable, easy to use and of the highest level of craft and execution. You’ll be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming the next great product innovation to tweaking pixels right before launch. We’ll expect you to utilize your full range of motion design, interaction design and visual design skills, while contributing to high-level strategic decisions with product and executive partners.Join a diverse group of thinkers and do some of the most meaningful work of your career.Motion Designer - WhatsApp Responsibilities:Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into solid and comprehensive solutions in motion.Drive the application and development of WhatsApp's brand system through motion design, animation and prototyping.Collaborate daily with peers in every discipline, including engineering, content, research, marketing and data science, to take products from conception to launch.Willingness to represent work to a broader product team and other leaders, clearly and succinctly articulating the goals and concepts.Give and solicit feedback from designers and a broader product team in order to continually improve for qualityMinimum Qualifications:5+ years of experience building and shipping multiple features that are broad/ambiguous in scope and encompass an end-to-end experience across a variety of platforms.5+ years of motion design experience with knowledge to define how an experience should behave based on understanding people's needs, plus consideration of how this product will scale. Use appropriate prototyping tools to demonstrate how a particular flow or interaction will work.5+ years of visual design experience with proficiency in typography, desktop/mobile UI, color, layout, iconography and aesthetic sense and how these elements impact product function.A portfolio that demonstrates product, branding, communication design experience.Knowledge of iOS, Android and WWW design.Preferred Qualifications:Experience connecting your work with other related initiatives across the company while driving collaborationExperience in launching consumer tech products and pitching ideas through compelling video narratives.About Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Job Title: UX Design InternLocation: This position is based in our Campbell, California offices, on-site & full-time. Imperative Care does not provide relocation or additional housing compensation for the summer internship.Why Telos Health?At Telos Health we are developing novel robotic-assisted technologies and interventional capabilities that will forever change the disparate outcomes of ischemic stroke – a disease that impacts close to a million people a year in the U.S., and 10 million worldwide. Not only is Telos changing the way stroke is treated, but also bringing this treatment to the greater population who is currently without. We are actively building a team who is focused on developing novel solutions for this complex disease – a disease in which one in four adults will face in their lifetime.What You’ll Do:We are looking for a talented UX Design Intern to be an integral part of the Telos R&D team. Are you interested in developing innovative, robotic-assisted technology to transform the way ischemic stroke is treated? You will utilize user-centered design practices to contribute to the UI design of our novel robotic-assisted system for stroke treatment. We are looking for someone who is eager to work at the intersection of digital and physical. To deliver on our mission you will craft solutions that take user experience, ergonomics, function, aesthetics, quality and safety into account.Apply user centered design techniques to develop compelling UX design from concept ideation to visual mock-upsDesign and deliver user flows, wireframes, use scenarios, user journeys, mockups, and prototypesDevelop interaction concepts that take hardware and UI touchpoints into account, translating complex problems into simple and elegant solutionsParticipate in primary and secondary user research to understand the context of your work, use it as the foundation and rational for UX concepts, and to continuously improve upon designWork collaboratively with other designers, the engineering team and other stakeholder to come develop easy to use, safe andContribute to design documentation and communicationWhat You’ll Bring: ExperienceCurrently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in UX Design, Interaction Design or equivalentDesign portfolio that demonstrates a user-centered-design processCompetent in the use of design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.Strong communication, storytelling and presentation skillsWhat You’ll GainTelos provides an opportunity for students to work in the dynamic medical device industry and gain valuable hands-on experience with state-of-the-art equipment, instruments, and facilities. Our internship program is designed to give interns foundational experience and exposure to a variety of roles and areas of focus to help prepare them for a career in MedTech. This program also offers ongoing networking, learning and professional development opportunities, mentorship from executive leadership, social activities and peer-to-peer interaction.Join Us!Salary: $27/hourly for 10 week internshipPowered by JazzHRDRPCvDyLKl

Job_description: Are you an innovative content creator passionate about making a difference?As FCI's Graphic Designer / Marketing Communications Specialist, you'll play a crucial role in supporting all areas of FCI's marketing communications department successes.This mid-level position provides you an opportunity to apply your content creation talents and organizational skills to achieve FCI's marketing goals while you continue your professional growth.This is an onsite position that reports to the San Marcos, CA facility. Remote work is not available. No travel is required, and there is a registered Alternative Workweek Schedule in place that allows this position to work a 4/10 workweek.Who we are looking for:We seek a highly organized, results-oriented team player with exceptional content creation capabilities to join our fast-paced marketing communications department, who can perform various marketing tasks each day and be relied upon to handle the demands of this position. While there is a learning curve, we are looking for a contributor who can complete tasks daily with little oversight.If you are an innovative, creative, hard-working individual who takes pride in delivering impactful graphic designs, is passionate about supporting various marketing communications projects, and is looking for a position in marketing with growth opportunities, please read on.Key Accountabilities:Contributes to timely and accurate delivery of marketing and sales collateral materials.Includes creation and distribution of advertising materials, layout of web landing pages and e-newsletters, create/update sales and marketing collateral (e.g. brochures, data sheets, ordering guides, price lists, e-newsletters, white papers, magazine articles, videos, presentation materials, website updates, social media, posters, etc.).Ensures design layouts are consistent and follow FCI company brand guidelines.Supports the marketing communications department with various marketing projects.What You'll Get to Do:Here are some examples of day-to-day duties:Create and update marketing and sales collateral, such as brochures, data sheets, price lists, layout of landing pages, and email marketing templates for digital advertising.Create and update content / images/ layout for FCI's websites, email marketing platforms, web landing pages, and social media networks (LinkedIn, YouTube, company blog, etc.).Here are some examples of weekly responsibilities:Creation and distribution of FCI ads per media schedule (ex. new banner ads, web reskin ads, social media ads, resizing existing FCI agency-created ads).Design images to accompany press releases, technical articles, webinars, and other PR activities.Gather and log web updates needed for FCI's Rep Support website and distribute them to FCI's web developer weekly. some examples of monthly responsibilities:Work as a marketing team member to incorporate a continuous stream of new content and features into FCI's websites that drive new and repeat visitors, improve customer experience, and results for improved SEO (examples: Create/post images and PDF documents to FCI's Kentico CMS website and FCI's intranet and rep support websites).Work as part of FCI's social media team to advance FCI's presence w/ social media networks.Design/layout of FCI's monthly customer e-newsletters (content provided by FCI's marcom mgr.)Support FCI Sales representatives with marketing, and user requirements (examples: short product explainer/educational videos, mini-infomercials, animations for social media,+).Take photos/videos at FCI Company events (employee events, picnics, holiday parties).Works with the marketing communications manager on tradeshow/special event planning and execution.Maintains up-to-date database throughout the year of all marketing materials, including product launch materials, photos, price lists, literature revision updates, advertising materials, web updates, etc.Works collaboratively on various FCI Marketing projects with outside service resources such as PR agencies, advertising agencies, web developers, magazines, printers, etc.The following qualifications are required to hold this position:A bachelor's degree in graphic design from an accredited school or equivalent work experience is required. A degree in marketing, marketing communications, business, English, or journalism is a plus.3+ years of graphic design/marketing communications experience, preferably working in a B:B corporate environment or creative agency.Must have advanced working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects video editing, etc.)Artistic creativity and knowledge of photography and video production are essential.Solid working knowledge of website administration for a Content Management System (CMS), preferably Kentico.You will be a great fit if you also possess the following desirable qualifications:Common traits of a successful Graphic Designer / Marketing Communications Specialist at FCI include artistic skills blended with excellent writing skills and strong attention to detail. An ability to translate technical materials and concepts into exciting and compelling printed/visual materials for prospective customers and the sales team. Very concerned with meeting deadlines. Strong willingness to learn.These duties may be modified or changed at any time at the sole discretion of management either orally or in writing. Intercom is an AI-first customer service platform that helps businesses deliver better, faster, more personalized support.Intercom is bringing AI-first Customer Service to the world, dramatically improving experiences for customers, support agents, and managers alike.Modern, fast, and easy-to-use, Intercom’s complete AI-first Customer Service Platform enhances the customer experience, improves operational efficiency, and scales with our customers’ business every step of the way. Intercom is also the most innovative and fastest improving product on the market. Shipping over 200 product improvements every year, Intercom is bringing AI features to market before anyone else.What's the opportunity? 🤔The Intercom Creative Studio is looking to build a world-class creative team. As a key component of this highly motivated & inspired team, we are looking to hire a creative visionary to lead the newly formed Creative Marketing team. This team will be responsible for breathing life into the newly delivered Intercom brand system, maintaining and expanding the Brand book, creating brand libraries for various teams to utilize, lead the creation of net new and repurposed assets in the new brand, art directing illustrators, and managing a team of creatives.The ideal creative candidate will have a wealth of boundary-pushing visual design experience, an obsession with sweating the finer details of a design/brand system, ability to art-direct towards brand accurate execution, a driving ambition for creative quality, and will lead their team by example through unparalleled work ethic, optimistic outlook, and inspiring creative work.As a Design Manager on the Creative Marketing team, you’ll work alongside other creative managers and will report directly to the head of Creative Studio. You will steer creative execution through your clear and inspired art direction, helping to shape your designers’ work to be unparalleled in creativity and quality. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with writers, Producers, Illustrators, and Animators to produce career defining work that will shape the future of the Intercom brand.There’s never been a more exciting time to join the Intercom Brand Studio as we are reshaping what it looks like to build an in-house creative agency within a recognized and reputable Product-lead SAAS business.If you’re a highly motivated and inspired Design manager and you’re looking to help foster creative talent and shape a special, deep-rooted creative culture, this is your opportunity. We’re here to do the best work of our careers and to help shape the future of a thriving and expanding business.Our small but growing in-house team is home to a diverse group of creatives with a broad range of experience, backgrounds and talents. We’re constantly looking for ways to make our day-to-day work feel fresh and meaningful, and we deeply value the health and wellness of each member of the team.What will I be doing?🚀Managing a team of creativesGiving on-brand art direction and creative feedbackDesigning boundary-pushing, creatively inspired workDelivering work at the forefront of design trendsStoryboarding motion-based assets and art directing animatorsWorking within and expand upon a brand systemHelping to implement a new brand identity throughout various touch pointsOwning projects from concept to final executionCollaborating with stakeholders in a highly iterative and agile environmentBalancing design excellence with a need for speed and a focus on success metricsPartnering with writers, producers, marketers, product experts, company leaders and external agencies to drive projects forwardArt directing designers, freelancers, agencies, and motion designersWhat skills do I need? 📖8-10 years of design experience with a portfolio showcasing a breadth of excellent brand-related work2-3 years Management experienceProficiency in Figma, Adobe CCExperience in motion design and storyboarding (in execution and/or art direction)Strong design sensibilities, from high-level strategic direction to production detailsAbility to communicate with precision, clarity, honesty, and respectA general understanding of business goals and strategyA general understanding of web performance metricsAbility to present ideas effectively to stakeholdersAbility to navigate ambiguous projectsBenefits 😍We are a well-treated bunch, with awesome benefits! If there’s something important to you that’s not on this list, talk to us! :)Competitive salary and meaningful equityComprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverageRegular compensation reviews - great work is rewarded!Open vacation policy and 10 corporate holidaysPaid Parental Leave Program401k plan & matchIn-office bicycle storageFun events for Intercomrades, friends, and family!The base salary range for candidates within the San Francisco Bay Area is $148,800 - $201,300. Actual base pay will depend on a variety of factors such as education, skills, experience, location, etc. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. All regular employees may also be eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).Intercom has a hybrid working policy. We believe that working in person helps us stay connected, collaborate easier and create a great culture while still providing flexibility to work from home. We expect employees to be in the office at least two days per week.Intercom values diversity and is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity. Intercom will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.Is this role not quite what you're looking for? Firm DescriptionWalker Warner Architects is an award-winning San Francisco firm with a staff of 70+ that has completed many residential, winery and hospitality projects in California, Hawaii and other Western states. Our work is tailored to the uniqueness and diversity of each client and place, maintaining a consistent focus on design excellence, thorough project management and superior service. We believe in collaboration, continuous learning and sharing, and actively support candidates on the path to become licensed architects. Our office is friendly and spirited, with regular happy hours, field trips and design-focused presentations. We are conveniently located in SoMa within walking distance of all major transit systems.For more information about our projects and firm, please visit us on or Instagram at @walkerwarnerarchitects.This position is based out of the San Francisco office and open to a hybrid schedule once onboarding and orientation is complete.Primary ResponsibilitiesSupport project team in development of the design and production, organization, coordination, thoroughness, and accuracy of the virtual building model and all documents in the drawing setCommunicate and coordinate with project team members, consultants, and contractorsResearch code requirements and interface with governmental agenciesResearch materials, products and systemsWork with the project team to produce presentation materials for client and agency presentationsCoordinate and participate in project meetings; screen share and navigate BIM model and other exhibits through Zoom, record and issue meeting notesDistribute project deliverables (drawing sets, correspondence, submittals)Implement the established graphic standards of the officeAssist with other office-wide tasks that make day-to-day operations of the office possibleQualificationsAccredited degree in architectureTwo to five years of related professional experience in design and productionIntermediate technical knowledge of Type V constructionDemonstrated 3D modeling/BIM proficiency (ArchiCAD preferred, but not required)Excellent verbal, written and graphic communication skillsCompensation And BenefitsWalker Warner Architects offers a competitive compensation package including fully paid health benefits for employees, profit sharing, employer 401(k) contribution, generous paid time-off and flexible spending accounts, plus so much more.The hiring base annual salary range for this position is $85,000 - $98,000. Any offer of compensation will be determined by a candidate’s education, skills, and experience as assessed during the interview process.How to ApplyPlease submit your resume, cover letter and portfolio samples, with indication of your role on the projects submitted. We will acknowledge receipt of your information, but only candidates being considered for a position will be contacted directly.Please no hard copies, drop-ins or telephone calls. Reposting this job description elsewhere is not permitted.DiversityWalker Warner is an eVerify organization. We value diversity and know that diverse workplaces lead to a culture of innovation and more successful business outcomes. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.COVID-19 VaccinationWe strongly encourage all employees to be fully vaccinated and boosted against COVID-19 and provide reasonable accommodations consistent with legal requirements (e.g., for medical and religious reasons.)Physical RequirementsProlonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computerMust be able to lift up to 15 pounds at timesPowered by JazzHRZhw6n3iglH

About Gap Inc.Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials.    This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our team is made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to  learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team.About The RoleAs an Associate Creative Recruiter, you will work in partnership with the Creative Talent Acquisition team to develop inclusive creative sourcing strategies, as well as recruiting full-cycle for entry to manager level creative (apparel design & marketing) roles. You’re a treasure hunter and networking comes naturally to you. You thrive off of making connections that may not naturally happen. Our Associate Creative Recruiter will unearth incredible talent and identify, develop, and execute effective sourcing and full-cycle recruiting strategies to build great diverse teams and an inclusive candidate experience for one of the largest apparel brands in the world. Working in Talent Acquisition means you're doing more than filling jobs, you will be a champion of both the business and talent.What You'll DoAttract high potential talent through diverse strategies to begin to cultivate equal curiosity, access, and opportunities to careers in Fashion/Retail.Accountable for full lifecycle recruiting for complex searches and functions, while driving a consistent and inclusive candidate and interview experienceEffectively manage relationships with recruiters, business partners, and our Equality and Belonging teams.Deliver a diverse candidate slate to Creative Recruiters based on current and future business needs.  Deliver industry trends, marketplace insight and competitive intelligence to help define and iterate our diversity recruiting strategies. Identify, develop, and employ measurable effective diversity sourcing strategies for current and future talent needsAbility to flex and work within multiple functions/channels offering both sourcing and full-cycle support as needed.Responsible for working with talent branding on social media recruiting and other internal/external marketing initiatives.Who You Are3+years in equivalent role as a sourcer, talent researcher, talent scout, or recruiter, ideally working within creative disciplinesYou’re a problem solver. You can work through complex issues and find solutions by effectively balancing individual responsibility while considering the businesses needs and goals.Experience driving complex and diverse search strategies to identify & attract diverse passive talent. Being organized motivates you. You can effectively prioritize and manage multiple tasks in an environment with competing demands.You’re an excellent communicator. and natural storyteller. Your written and verbal communication are strong and you’re able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.You’re a relationship builder. You thrive off of building strong and productive relationships.You have experience creating and executing written and visual communications related to talent branding on various social platforms. Knowledge of EEO, ADA, and employment lawsBenefits at Gap Inc.Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*See more of the benefits we offer.For eligible employeesGap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. In 2022, we were recognized by Forbes as one of the World's Best Employers and one of the Best Employers for Diversity.Salary Range: $75,100 - $95,700 USDEmployee pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level, competencies and work location. We will meet minimum wage or minimum of the pay range (whichever is higher) based on city, county and state requirements.US CandidatesPlease note that effective, June 30, 2022, Gap Inc. will no longer require any of its employees to wear face masks or require proof of COVID vaccination, unless required by local or state/provincial mandates or as part of Gap Inc’s quarantine guidelines after being exposed to or testing positive for COVID. Therefore, please disregard any language in any job posting that refers to Gap Inc.’s face mask and proof of vaccination policy as said policy is no longer effective.

Job_description: Job DetailsShifts: Days - 8 hours, 8am-5pm, Monday-Friday, Rotating w/ weekends, 40hrs/weekWork Location: Hybrid; Palo Alto City, CADuties And ResponsibilitiesDevelops and owns original creative concepts and directs the successful execution of the idea.Executes design and graphic production processes required to produce final creative product.Designs web assets that accurately reflect the organization’s goals, objectives and identity.Creates concepts, artwork and layout for sites and other online projects based on creative briefs and client meetings.Manages the development of creative materials including: Flyers and flyer templates, posters and poster templates, banners and banner templates, brochures and brochure templates, email templates, newsletter templates (digital and print), internal support items such as stationery, business cards and way finding signs, digital graphics and web support for internet, intranet and social media sites.Assures communication to requestors on progress and delivery of final product within agreed upon timelines.Assures standards, templates and quality control check points and reviews are in place to deliver all materials that represent the level of expected quality.Provides in-house graphic support and consultation.Develops creative graphic designs for variety of print, online and direct mail advertising materialsWorks with hospital and marketing leadership to support the creative direction and development of any full scale plans needed for projectsRequirements Education QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a work-related discipline/field from an accredited college or universityExperienceThree (3) to six (6) years progressively responsible and directly related work experienceBenefitsDental/Medical/Vision401k

Who We Are:Founded in 2009, Reformation is a revolutionary lifestyle brand that proves fashion and sustainability can coexist. We combine stylish, vintage-inspired designs with sustainable practices, releasing limited-edition collections for individuals who want to look beautiful and live sustainably. Setting an example for the industry, Reformation remains at the forefront of innovation in sustainable fashion—running the first sustainable factory in Los Angeles, using deadstock and eco fabrics, tracking and sharing the environmental impact of every product, and investing in the people who make this revolution possible. The brand has also established itself as a pioneer in retail innovation, developing an in-store tech concept that brings the best of its online experience to its physical doors.We are a future focused organization committed to the belief that the problems facing our planet and society can be solved through innovation, common sense and education. Being naked is the #1 most sustainable option. We're #2.Here at Ref, we put people first. We know that you can't innovate and do cool stuff without having everyone on board. So we work to create a culture where everyone feels like they belong and where their voices are truly valued. We build an inclusive culture together and make a real impact along the way.DesignerReformation is a mission-based company that is fast-growing and is redefining fashion. We make killer clothes that don’t kill the environment and want our garments’ impact on the planet to be as low as possible. After all, there’s nothing less sexy than leaving a big nasty mess.Reformation has an exciting opportunity for a Designer to be part of our in-house design team. As a Designer at Ref you will be working to ensure we are first in identifying emerging trends, and translating those into wearable designs our customers will love and believe in. You will work closely with the Merchandising, Product Development, and Technical Design teams to ensure you capture the season’s must-have pieces to excite and delight the customer.This role is open to being based in Los Angeles and New York.What you’ll do:Partner with the Design Director and Buyers to understand the vision and direction of the brandMonitor macro trends and translate them to the Ref aesthetic. Own trend forecasting for your categories determining which trends to test and invest in.Interpret key trends into commercial designsIdentify key silhouettes, fabrics and trims that are relevant to the Reformation customerOversee fabric and trim sourcing for your categories in order to continually elevate the product. Learn the Reformation sustainable fabric guidelines and ensure sourcing is in line with the broader sustainability goals.Gather & use relevant internal and external information to drive product and range development for the customerOwn all sketching - new and chase- for your categories.Develop all tech packs for your designs and work closely with product development and tech design to translate the sketches into products.Attend fittings and work with Tech Design and Product Development to fit samples and release to production. Maintain both a design and quality perspective when fitting.Collaborate with your Merchandising partners to build product strategies that support category growth goals on a quarterly and annual basis.Operate within the constraints of the production calendar ensuring you hit all deadlines.What you’ll need:5+ years experience of apparel design experienceAppetite for design influences and strong eyeRelevant contemporary experience with an appreciation of fabric, trimsStrong understanding of fabrics, both woven & knitStrong understanding of garment fit, construction, and garment finishingsKnowledge of CADAbility to create and complete tech packsExperience working with domestic and overseas factories/suppliers is beneficialAbility to work under own initiativeCommercial acumenStrong communication skills and the ability to communicate confidentlyAbility to work under pressure and on tight deadlinesAbility to juggle many different tasks and prioritize workload appropriatelyGood teamwork and interpersonal skillsStrong enthusiasm for Reformation as a brandGenuine passion for SustainabilityBenefits & Perks:Health, vision, and dental insurance for eligible employeesPaid vacation, sick, holidays & volunteer time-off for eligible employeesMission based company + casual and entrepreneurial work environmentClothing discount, dog-friendly office, company events + parties and much more401K with company matchTo apply for this position please submit your resume and cover letter along with the project below:Take this online Color Test and send a screenshot of the results pageCreate a mood board of Fall 2024 key apparel trends relevant to Reformation. Sketch 5 key apparel pieces relevant to Reformation using your mood board images.

About UsRapt is an award-winning design and strategy studio that helps leading brands navigate the complex challenges of this ever-changing world. With locations in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and New York — and with clients spanning the globe — we bring fresh thinking and a highly customized approach to each and every partnership. Our interdisciplinary teams blend architecture, interior design, brand experience, graphic design, and strategic thinking into holistic solutions that further our clients’ missions. Our agile approach earned us the distinction of being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies.We’re embracing the future of work with a hybrid approach. We spend 3 days in the studio each week as a team, and we also have days where we work from home. Ultimately, we trust our staff to know how and where they will do their best work.About The RoleAt Rapt, Senior Designers maintain a keen eye for detail while managing multiple projects, from conception to realization. They lead our designers and work closely with Studio Leads and Design Directors to ensure each project’s success. We’re currently looking for someone who’s got the confidence and creativity required to be on the frontlines of our work.Qualifications:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture or Interior Design8+ years of experience working at an architecture or design studioExpertise with Revit, AutoCAD, SketchUp, Microsoft Office, and Adobe Creative SuiteExpertise working with project teams from concept design through constructionExpertise with project management, construction administration, budget review, building codes, consultant coordination, and client relationsProficiency with jurisdictional agencies and multi-disciplinary consultantsProficiency with commercial projects, including ground-up construction, core and shell repositioning, and creative workplaceState licensure or pursuance of state licensure is encouragedWe’re looking for:A team player with a positive attitude who’s enthusiastic about tackling the unexpected and unknownA creative person with strong graphic, organizational, and communication skillsA conceptual thinker who’s always seeking inspirationA confident decision-maker and risk-takerA leader who’s interested in mentoring fellow design staffSomeone who can both design conceptually and detail thoroughly, with an ability to zoom in and out along the project timeline from the macro to the micro and back againA leader who doesn’t allow ego to push teams or projects in ways that don’t benefit everyone, and who provides guidance not for their own benefit but for the benefit of the project and teamCompensation is based on relevant experience and qualifications. Salary for this role is estimated between $90,000 to $140,000 plus benefits and bonuses.Benefits and Perks:Generous options for medical, dental, vision insuranceLocation flexibility and unlimited paid time off (PTO)Tax-deferred savings through FSA, parking and transit allocations401K with employer contributionComplimentary One Medical membershipsNew hire referral bonus

**Summary Description** We are looking for a graphic designer to create engaging and on-brand graphics for a variety of media. You'll be the one to shape the visual aspects of websites, books, magazines, product packaging, exhibitions and more. Your graphics should capture the attention of those who see them and communicate the right message. For this, you need to have a creative flair and a strong ability to translate requirements into design. If you can communicate well and work methodically as part of a team, we'd like to meet you.**Responsibilities** Study design briefs and determine requirements. Schedule projects and define budget constraints. Conceptualize visuals based on requirements. Prepare rough drafts and present ideas. Develop illustrations, logos and other designs using software or by hand. Use the appropriate colors and layouts for each graphic. Work with copywriters and creative director to produce final design. Test graphics across various media. Amend designs after feedback. Ensure final graphics and layouts are visually appealing and on-brand.**Qualifications** Proven graphic designing experience. A strong portfolio of illustrations or other graphics. Familiarity with design software and technologies (such as InDesign, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Photoshop). A keen eye for aesthetics and details. Excellent communication skills. Ability to work methodically and meet deadlines. Degree in Design, Fine Arts or a related field is a plus.
Industries: Design Services, Animation and Post-production, and Retail Art Supplies

Job_description: ABOUT USThe Travel Corporation is a highly successful international travel group with over 40 award-winning brands. The company is family-owned, has been in business for four generations over 100 years, and operates in more than 60 countries, on seven continents, with over 35 offices and more than 4,000 team members.At The Travel Corporation (TTC), taking care of the destinations we visit is important to us. We’re proud to be a founding member of TreadRight, a joint initiative by The Travel Corporation family of brands that works to sustain environments and communities around the world for future generations.The TTC Tour Brands covered by this role consist of Trafalgar, Insight Vacations, Luxury Gold, Costsaver, Brendan Vacations, and Contiki.HOW YOU’LL WORKWe’re energized by all the opportunities of the new world and are proud of our inspiring global workplaces. We look to inspire teamwork, collaboration, and passion for creativity.We offer a flexible work environment - in person in exciting offices and virtually with leading technology.Working together across markets, teams, and disciplines ensures everyone has a voice and everyone is part of our industry-leading brands. Irrespective of where you are, we cultivate environments where everyone contributes, and everyone flourishes.PERKSAfter your first year, you get an annual travel credit of $1050 to travel on any one of our core travel brands.You also get 2 weeks a year where you can work from anywhere in the world, your choice.To grow – we offer a global training calendar, with a mix of virtual, in-person, and e-learning courses. Plus, we give $3,000 per year to support external learning and development courses that interest you and drive your passion.Giving back - we give you two paid workdays each year to volunteer to make a difference in causes that are close to your heart too. We believe that travel is a privilege, but with that privilege comes the responsibility; to ensure we have a positive impact on the places we go, the people we meet, and the wildlife we enjoy. We ensure that travel is a force for good and that we MAKE TRAVEL MATTER®.FREE Mental Wellness Support - ComPsych Employee Assistance Program - therapy, legal, bereavement, and financial wellness support at NO cost to the employee.Also, the basics - medical, dental, vision health insuranceOptional Pet InsurancePOSITION SUMMARYThe TTC Tour Brands graphic designer role is hybrid with the expectation of being in the office twice a week at minimum. and on time and follow any pertinent laws and regulations.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESCreate branded marketing assets, for regional, global, and/or the parent company’s marketing needs.Assist in developing images, and styling so assets are on brand, accurate, and delivered on timeCreate and export files in various formats, for various channels ensuring all information is accurate - from file size and Job_title: Product Manager - Member Acquisition and Onboarding
Job_description: Company DescriptionLinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.Join us to transform the way the world works.Job DescriptionThis role will be based in Sunnyvale, San Francisco or Seattle.At LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams. This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can both work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what’s best for you and when it is important for your team to be together.We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager on the Core Growth team to lead LinkedIn’s Member Acquisition and Onboarding stack. This is a unique opportunity to own the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for experiences that span across all of LinkedIn’s product lines. In this high impact, high visibility role, you’ll have direct line of sight to driving the most important metrics for the company, by helping users get the most out of each email and each visit.You’ll work with fully staffed engineering and cross-functional teams that have driven consistent results, identifying opportunities to build new features, creating roadmap and detailed specs, and executing with them to ship impact. You’ll also own the go-to-market (GTM) plans with Marketing, Business Development, Sales, Editorial colleagues, and additional functions.In this role, you’ll play a key role in our mission to create economic opportunity for every professional around the world. And you’ll do that while having fun.Responsibilities:Collaborate with engineering, data science, design, and other counterparts to build team’s strategy and roadmap and drive execution.Build deep understanding of conversion funnels by conducting qualitative and quantitative research and identifying high impact product opportunities.Create user stories, use cases, requirement documents and proposals with clear MVP definition and success metrics. Measure progress of business success metrics towards KPI targets.Serve as the main POC and SME for acquiring new guests and members, collaborating across functions (BD, PMM, Editorial, PR, and other functions) and bring features and initiatives successfully to market.Communicate and evangelize the product vision and progress throughout LinkedIn from C-level stakeholders on down. Ensure transparency and alignment across the company.Lead analyses of the competitive environment, customers and product metrics to determine the right set of features to drive growth and engagement.Identify and prioritize tech investment and support resources necessary for innovation and continuous improvement to achieve successful outcome of the product.Develop and monitor OKRs for key product initiatives and ensure alignment with stakeholder objectives.Work horizontally across all LinkedIn’s key businesses and influence roadmapQualificationsBasic Qualifications:BS/BA Degree in a technology-related field OR equivalent experience.3+ years of experience in product management.Preferred Qualifications:Go-To-Market knowledge and experience.Experience with user acquisition/top of funnel user growth.Experience working on consumer growth initiatives.Experience working on highly iterative product development.Experience working on Social Networks at scale.Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with and understand technical subjects and emerging technologies and their relevance to the marketplace.Ability to manage and lead across highly cross-functional teams.Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.MBA is a plus.Suggested Skills:User EmpathyStakeholder ManagementStrategic AnalysisLinkedIn is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.The pay range for this role is $120,000 to $195,000. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor.The total compensation package for this position may also include annual performance bonus, stock, benefits and/or other applicable incentive compensation plans. For more information, visit https://careers.linkedin.com/benefits.Additional InformationEqual Opportunity StatementLinkedIn is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. LinkedIn considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. LinkedIn is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer as described in our equal opportunity statement here: EEO Statement_2020 - Signed.pdf.Please reference the following information for more information: https://legal.linkedin.com/content/dam/legal/LinkedIn_EEO_Statement_2020.pdf.Please reference the following information for more information: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf andhttps://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf for more information.LinkedIn is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. Our goal is to foster an inclusive and accessible workplace where everyone has the opportunity to be successful.If you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening, apply for a position, or participate in the interview process, connect with us at accommodations@linkedin.com and describe the specific accommodation requested for a disability-related limitation.Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process. Examples of reasonable accommodations include but are not limited to:Documents in alternate formats or read aloud to youHaving interviews in an accessible locationBeing accompanied by a service dogHaving a sign language interpreter present for the interviewA request for an accommodation will be responded to within three business days. However, non-disability related requests, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.LinkedIn will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by LinkedIn, or (c) consistent with LinkedIn's legal duty to furnish information.San Francisco Fair Chance OrdinancePursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, LinkedIn will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pay Transparency Policy StatementAs a federal contractor, LinkedIn follows the Pay Transparency and non-discrimination provisions described at this link: https://lnkd.in/paytransparency.Global Data Privacy Notice for Job CandidatesPlease follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.Equal Opportunity StatementLinkedIn is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to accommodations@linkedin.com. This email box is designed to assist disabled job seekers who seek a reasonable accommodation to the application process. Emails sent for non-disability related issues, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.In your email, please include the following: (1) confirm you have a disability; (2) identify the disability-related limitation that needs to be accommodated, and (3) if known, describe the specific accommodation requested for the disability-related limitation.
